I wasn't expecting to like this film nearly as much as I did. This is not a film for someone expecting non-stop action.  There is action to be sure but this film is a stark, leisurely paced dystopian look at earth's future. Oblivion does require a close watch and listen to the dialogue to get the most out of the film. It reminded me of E.M. Forster's The Machine Stops.  I won't spoil the ending by telling you why in detail however, I will tell you that Oblivion takes Forster's idea a very frightening step further.

Oblivion is a post-apocalyptic Sci-Fi treatment of an incomplete and unpublished graphic novel of the same name by Joseph Kosinski and Arvin Nelson. Kosinski's creations are familiar to me from many hours of playing Halo. Elements of his previous treatment of space landscapes, drones, machine voices from the game are recast into the movie and if you readers know what I'm talking about, I hope you will tend to agree slightly with me.

The proposition of the story is interesting. Set in March 2077 in a surreal post nuclear setting with the remnants of distant cities poking through the wilderness, the movie begins with a lie, a mistaken narration from a brainwashed yet wavering Jack Harper, the movie's protagonist.

According to him, humans are refugees from a consuming but successful nuclear war with an alien race from space called Scavengers (Scavs). They first destroyed earth's moon and then invaded earth. The nuclear campaign that followed however left many areas of earth uninhabitable. The survivors we're told launched off in a temporary space station called Tet and while in an effort to colonize Titan, Saturn's largest moon, Harper thinks he and his partner "Vica" are assigned to be last two "mop up crew" on earth to oversee the drone surveillance of Hydrorigs. With visually treating scenes, we learn that Hydrorigs are humungous energy stations constructed in the midst of oceans churning sea water somehow to fusion energy. This energy is apparently a crucial ingredient for humans to colonize Titan so protecting that is their mission.

In the movie, Harper we learn is an armed drone repairman. Victoria or "Vica" stays back in their futuristic home base acting as his communication officer. She also liaises with the suspicious character of Sally, who sits in Tet's Command and hands down mission tasks. Together they direct Jack across the vast topology of wastelands to rehabilitate downed drones with new parts. The root issue for repair is that drones are shot down by the apparent remnants of Scavs who have not hesitated to launch a last stand against their human victors. The belief that Scavs are responsible for this guerilla warfare is vanquished some thirly minutes into the movie.

This movie makes several attempts at throwing in that human touch generously. Harper we see exhibits a dichotomy of character which is the crucial element of the movie.  He is shown appearing shell shocked, nearly faltering with the bits and pieces of his past memories - his wife, baseball games he used to watch, the very basis of his mission... He exhibits frustration that as the war winners, humans were now left to find a new home on Titan.

On the other hand, he doesn't appear too convinced that Scavs are in a dire need to kill him, could they perhaps want something more by capturing him alive? Vica plays the role of reassuring him that their mission will soon end and they will get to fly back to Tet. In perhaps the only sexually themed scene of the whole movie, we see her trying to recapture him into the present as she slips into their swimming pool naked, pulling him with her. However his wavering of belief persists. He is shown taking refuge occasionally at his getaway, a still standing cottage house in a surprisingly well preserved meadow. It is intact with a lake, and the house stocked with select memorabilia that allows him to drift off to a past he remembers.

The first strong twist in the movie appears when he spots a curious space module hurtling towards earth. Immediately flying to the wreckage site, he notices people strewn all over in distinct enclosures called sleep pods with the words Odyssey written on them. He believes this module had been sent from the big ship Tet and the people lying on the ground were survivors from an accident. Something about Odyssey tugs at his memory but at this phase of the movie, we're not sure how its all connected. Suddenly, a drone appears and violently shoots the sleep pods down, one by one. Furious, Jack screams away at it preventing it from shooting the last pod containing a woman he seems to recognize. Well , who is she?

He takes this woman, Julia back to the base and together with Vica, tries to rehabilitate her from her "Delta sleep", a protective state of hibernation. The scenes that follow confuse but keep the suspense. Julia wakes up. They fill her on what happened. When Jack narrates their mission on earth, Julia is seen smirking. In private, Vica and Jack argue on the origins of the ship Julia came in. Jack exchanges doubt about the whole incident and wonders if Vica has any memories of Julia from the past. In another beautifully filmed scene set during sunset, Julia insists she has to get back to the wreckage of the ship to secure the flight recorder.

In a pre-dawn trip back to the wreckage, Julia and Jack successfully find the flight recorder but in a timely yet remarkably ungory fashion, a "scav" attacks them taking them captive. Back at a secret base, a bound Jack Harper wakes up on a chair to meet a new stranger, Malcolm Beech who doesn't hesitate to blow everything Jack believed about his world.

Beech reveals the people Jack were now facing were not aliens, they were humans and it is infact the Tet that won the war and subordinated humans to suck earth dry of its resources. He reveals his entourage of unmasked Sergeants led by the hunky Sargeant Sykes who sticks to his theory that Beech was a fool for bringing Harper there. Beech challenges Jack to prove Sykes wrong.

Taking Jack aside, Beech reveals the full breadth and scope of their mission : to acquire plutonium grade nukes, stick them in a captured drone he had at his disposal and launch it into the Tet to destroy it. Jack would fill in the gap by programming the drone to accept this new mission. Looking to establish his honesty, Beech lets Jack and Julia go back and take a look for themselves into the radiation zones where they were always instructed not to go according to Tet's Mission Command.

This gives an opportunity for a shaken Jack to question Julia - "who are you, what was your mission on Oblivion?" This is the moment of clarity for Jack, who learns that Julia is his wife and the alien ship is actually Tet. What Beech seemed to indicate and what Julia was now telling him co-related. So what was going on?

This also sets the stage for friction between Julia and Jack, Julia who saw them share these intimate moments though her remote camera.  She is emotional and furious at Jack who shows up with Julia at the home base. She declines to open the door for them, and reports to Mission that her partner has suddenly lost all ability to perform as an "effective team". Soon, chaos ensues. Mission Command effectively launches a drone internal to the home base. It targets Julia, perhaps with evil intent and kills her. Sally from Mission Command nonchalantly apologizes to Jack for this lapse in judgment and asks Jack and Julia to come back up to Tet for a new debriefing of their mission. This arouses Jack's suspicions and is another crucial element of the movie...

The duo quickly escape the home base and after a dog fight with three drones, find themselves crash landing in the "forbidden" radiation zone. Another shocker awaits Jack, who finds a replica of himself repairing a downed droned a few yards off from their crashed location. This sets stage for a fight between the two. The replica is killed. Julia is injured in the fight as she takes a bullet to her stomach. Jack rests her body in a secure cave and flies back to the home base for medications. There, he meets a second instance of Julia, who he supposed was dead. He realizes the indications this is giving. Beech was trying to tell him something after all.

Jack goes back for Julia and revives her. In another intimate conversation at the cottage house, Jack tells her he believes he's not the real one she loves yet he somehow remembers everything. Nevertheless, she fills him on the things he said when they got married. They would grow old and fat and die together and no one would remember them. These memories were his, they were theirs... Jack is dazed but succumbs to the reality.

Nest morning, Jack shows interest at returning back to Beech and his crew. Beech is happy to receive them. In a subsequent scene, Beech narrates the whole history of the war once again which convinces Jack he's just a replica of thousands of instances like him created by Tet to oversee the plunder of earth's resources. Phase 2 was drone, programmed with the fire power necessary to survey and kill humans and Jack was only a pawn used by Tet to oversee the operation.

Jack, convinced of the entire lie he were forced to live, programs the drone that Beech had captured and inserts the plutonium nuke into it. In a strong attempt to eliminate this group of humans, the Mission Command, aware of what's going on, sends drones to invade Beech's property. In the bath of war in which all the drones are eliminated, an injured Beech convinces Jack that it's time launch their drone into the Tet. Weary from war, Julia shows her eternal love and convinces Jack to let her go on a kamikaze mission with the drone to destroy Tet. Jack, seemingly agreeing in the scene, packs her into the pod as if getting her ready for it.

Surprises come soon. The final scenes show Jack and his "human" cargo flying into space on this mission to Tet. While on this journey, Jack manages to play back the flight recorder from Odyssey which confirms that in the past, Jack and Vica were commanders on a research flight to inspect an unidentified object in the sky. This object would be Tet, and in a last ditch effort to preserve a survivor, Jack had released a module of the Odyssey back to earth which contained Julia in her Delta sleep. As this realization dawns on him, Jack's ship enters a gaping hole in the Tet and is shaken to see hundreds of his replicas neatly preserved in chambers on the walls of this chasm.

They are greeted by "Sally" who assumes the voice of a curiously shaped massive object in the middle of a chasm of space within Tet. Tricking Sally into believing that the cargo contains Julia, Jack open the pod to show Beech who we learn had chosen himself to die on this mission instead of Julia. Sally is furious and proclaims she is Jack's God and his creator and that she cannot be cheated. A determined Jack recites a verse by Horatius

"How can a man die better
than facing fearful odds
for the ashes of his fathers
and the temples of his Gods"

and initiates the nuclear device that was with them. An immense explosion reeks through the universe and in the next scene, we see Julia, who waking up surprised from her sleep pod back at the cottage house, observes the massive destruction of Tet with a tear rolling off her cheeks.

If I've given you enough spoilers, I'll leave the last 5 minutes of the movie for you to watch. A carefully planted re-incarnation awaits Julie 3 years after these incidents. Go find out!

I want to conclude by stating that the story Kosinski has crafted is decently believable. If readers don't go too deep into asking how fusion energy can be generated from sea water, or why drones would need to be still 'programmed' in the year 2077, why "Sally" as a God is so easily defeated, Kosinski has covered up these weaknesses with a film that has continuity , a good music score, not too overpowering sound effects and moments that call your attention when the human element is thrown in.

Science fiction appeals when it draws attention to virtues that are distinctly human and what separates us from mere machines. When lies and falsehood cloud our reality, there is still something inside us that tugs and makes us want to return to our true selves. We find Jack agrees to listen to that inner voice.

Another essence of this movie is that it shows we all have a greater purpose in life and sometimes we find ourselves alone in trying to overcome formidable odds. Will we fear and duck the challenge, or face the odds? A man, as Jack Harper, couldn't serve earth better just as Horatius the one eyed Roman hero who agreed to stand on the other side of a bridge facing the Etruscan invasion while his countrymen chopped the bridge down. I give this movie 4 stars!

I think that I am finally all burned out on movies being made with an overwhelming wash of special effects and very little of what could be a story at all.

The first 15 minutes of this film, I was really expecting it to be something great, but then this prolonged stretch of unwavering sameness just kept going on with very little of any kind of tangible story unfolding so, by about 45 minutes into the movie, I was getting really bored and didn't see or even expect it to improve and yet it wasn't even half way over yet.

I think I saw it all.  I might have fell in and out of a sleep mode during the last half hour of the film so when it ended, I didn't even understand why it just ended right there. Maybe I missed something, and if I did, it's sad to think that if anything tied everything all together or made the story suddenly make sense, well, it must have been very short and easy to miss during a prolonged yawn or a blink.

If I ever watch this movie again, I better have a double hit of some Red Bull so that I will be wired enough to not possibly fall asleep for at least a week. I'll wait about a month before I try this film again.  I bought it used, so I really gotta learn to be more selective when I take the risk of buying a movie I've never seen first.

Most people know M83 did the entire soundtrack for this movie, that alone makes it worth owning for me. (how many times has he played a hero named Jack through his movie career?... countless times).
The same thing goes for Morgan Freeman (no charisma whatsoever), I have seen him playing that 'role' too many times already.
Olga Kurylenko is the only one who brings some zest to this dry/clich Sci-Fi.
How this movie received 7.0 rating on MDB is beyond me.

Btw: the song playing in the background when Jack brings wounded Julia to his hideaway oasis is called "Whiter Shade of Pale" from 1967.

When I chose to watch this movie, I was expecting another entertaining popcorn sci-fi action movie with Tom Cruise on a motorcycle. I was correct in that assumption! But there were also some surprises.

Pretty much the same movie as 2009, but more glamorous - that glass tower, that swimming pool - and with many more plot holes. The big budget effects and sets and costumes are glorious, though. That helicopter, that motorcycle! Landscapes are fantastic.

But the saggy plot totally rips off 2009's Moon, starring Sam Rockwell and Kevin Spacey. Which I thought was a better movie overall. Well-acted, well-written, tighter plot. It's also claustrophobic and devastating to watch Sam Rockwell's character develop! Greatly underrated sci-fi film and I highly recommend you watch it sometime.

But if you want the big budget set with lots of explosions and a Hollywood ending - this movie is fine. Entertaining. You can watch Tom Cruise ride a motorcycle. Sure.

** Spoilers Alert **

1) What happened to the moon, really, and why?

2) What happend to the earth, really, and why?

3) What happened to the 6-7 billion people?

4) How did they (The Tet) build the drones?  It was just Hal from Kubrick's 2001: A Space Odessey.  Did they have a Drone factory?  And what was the Tet, anyway?

5) What was the Tet's motive in attacking the earth?

6) What were they doing to the earth with the huge water thingies, and why?

7) How could anybody enjoy a film without any storyline or plot?  It was simply a mashup of loud special effects bitten off other movies (Star Wars, etc.), with some emotional drivel thrown in, sporting an apocalyptic sci-fi "aliens attack" setting.  One of the worst movies of all time.

I honestly wish I had not wasted 2 hours of my life on this movie.  Tom Cruise - what the heck?  Why are you doing this to us?  And what about you, Morgan Freeman?  Making this crud!  You should be ashamed of yourselves!  Don't you people even READ a script before you sign the contract?  Gee whiz!

** Spoilers Alert **

Plot, characters, dialogue ? Should you manage to watch 5 minutes of this time-waster, you might as well invest the needed time to watch the whole thing. If this film has one redeeming characteristic, I totally missed it. Watch any grade 'Z' movie from the '50s and you will be vastly more entertained. Sure, you can spend $100,000,000 on CGI and another $20,000,000 on 'star' power, but if you have absolutely no story to tell, what is the point ? Watch anything produced before 1960 and you will be vastly more rewarded.

After seeing this movie in the theater, it instantly became one of my all time favorites.  I have watched it about another dozen times on Cinemax since, and will be purchasing the DVD as well.  I am a Tom Cruise fan, a sci-fi fan, and especially a post-apocalyptic sci-fi fan, but this movie stands on its own merits in just about every other regard as well.  It has a great supporting cast, phenomenal visual effects and soundtrack, intelligent storyline, plot twists, and much more.  The only [slight] disappointment I have is that I would have liked to see a little more character development and screen time with Morgan Freeman's character.

This movie is smart, intriguing, and draws you right into the plot and scenery.  I don't feel it rips-off concepts from other sci-fi films, rather pays homage, as the writers were going for.  The concept of the enemy faced by humanity is great (I won't give away any spoilers).  This said, if you are looking for a shoot-em-up, fast paced, action packed journey through the cosmos, then this isn't for you.  If you want a great story that makes you think and gives you some surprises, all the while dazzling you with great effects and scenery, as well as music, then this is for you.  Let's put it this way...this movie has much more in common, in terms of plot and action, with old-school Star Trek then the new Trek movies...in other words it's a thinker and a mystery with a sci-fi tone, rather than a shoot-em-up action ride.  I loved it...5 out of 5 stars and easily in my top 10 sci-fi features of all time.

The 1960s Twilight Zone series had a background of sci-fi but the story was about the characters, their interaction, and what they did not suspect was happening in the background. Tom Cruise alludes to this as the plot of Oblivion in the commentary portion of the DVD.

This is a drama, not an action movie like his Mission Impossible series. It was filmed in Iceland and New Orleans among other places.

First of all, it should be noted that I am a HUGE lover of futuristic movies with aliens. The interesting plot, gorgeous landscapes, and CGI put this movie near the top of my most favorite movies. Despite it's less than stellar performance in theaters, I feel like this movie is quite undervalued.

Quick Plot (No Spoilers): Jack Harper (Tom Cruise) is an engineer who has been tasked with maintaining a fleet of drones that are assisting in the salvaging of Earth in the year 2077, 60 years after a devastating alien attack. Humanity won the war with the aliens (called Scavs), but Earth was rendered uninhabitable in the process. Along with his partner Victoria (Andrea Riseborough), Jack counts down the days until their term on Earth will be finished and they can rejoin the rest of humanity on the space station Tet that orbits Earth and will leave for Saturn's moon Titan once salvage is complete. One day a mysterious spaceship crashes down to Earth and sends Jack down a path that will lead him to the horrifying truth of Tet and his own existence.
Even though it didn't do too well in theaters, I enjoyed the movie quite a bit. It could have fleshed out some characters better especially Morgan Freeman's. Overall good, will watch it again.
I hate him and everything he personally stands for and represents. That being said I liked this movie. It has a real surprising twist I never saw coming. I was pleasantly surprised.
your rules are tired & I don't have time for all this. the product was as advertised. nuf said! OK

Like any movie, YMMV.  For instance, my lady friend didn't just dislike this movie.  She hated it, even though she really likes Tom Cruise.  Then again, there are very few movies with a sci-fi theme that she thinks is worthwhile.  It's simply not her cup of tea.  And while it's not her most hated sci-fi movie ("Prometheus" probably gets that honor), there was nothing she liked about "Oblivion".

There are many outstanding reviews that I've read here (especially M. Oleson's) that give intricate and informative details on the storyline, so I'll take a slightly different approach.  Obviously, I really liked "Oblivion" (I also liked "Prometheus"), and for several reasons.  First, I enjoyed the story -- one major and a few minor plot holes not withstanding.  Oh, we've seen variations of this story many times, but that doesn't mean I lost interest.  There were times I knew it was purposely oblique, but thought it stood up really well when taken in total.  This is the type of movie where a second viewing may be warranted (I've watched it multiple times).  Secondly, the picture quality is absolutely top tier, stark and pristine  and so were the sets.  In a word, stunning!  Thirdly, the soundtrack.  It's an incredible, soaring soundtrack throughout that really pulls you in and doesn't let go.  And finally, the depth of the bass.  This movie will shake your walls and slam your body hard (if one has the equipment) with clean, powerful bass.  There is one scene where they use a bass sweep that hits single digits (below 10 Hz) that will put a smile on just about any face.  This Blu-Ray's sound capability will far surpass what any theater can reproduce (even the Arclight in Hollywood).  Theaters simply can't plumb the depths that a well-integrated home theater with powerful subwoofers can, nor do they try.  It's simply not feasible to try and reach anything below 30 Hz due to the sheer volume of a large theater.

Rating:

Picture quality:  10 out of 10 (I have never seen better)
Sound quality:  10 out of 10 (did I mention the incredible bass and the impressively soaring and dramatic score?)
Story and presentation:  marginal 7 out of 10 (I had a few issues with parts of the storyline)
Overall: marginal 9 out of 10 (which means that I highly recommend it)

Summary:  If you like sci-fi and have a nice home theater with some potent subwoofers, I can't think of a better movie to showcase.  As an example, "War of the Worlds" is renown for its impressively potent and stellar bass (DVD and Blu-Ray are equally as good and rated 5-stars on AVS), and "Oblivion" (Blu-Ray) is just as impressive.

Tom Cruise is a futuristic astronaut of sorts salvaging the rest of earths resources after some big war with Aliens. Humans win the war, but the earth is unlivable, so everyone packs up and goes to some other planet or moon or something, I forget, but its atmosphere is compatible for us. Or is that whats going on? It keeps you guessing enough to be interested and answers your question sufficiently at the end. You do wonder what the heck is really going on here for a good part of the movie, but its not so confusing that you lose interest. The concept kind of reminds me of After Earth, but Oblivion is better and takes an interesting turn whereas After Earth is pretty boringly straight forward. Say what you want to about Tom Cruise, he does get pretty good rolls and he does a pretty good job in the end. I was satisfied with the explanation and I Morgan Freeman and Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, from Game of Thrones were good in it, but Morgan Freeman is great I everything. Dont expect anything to terribly deep and I think you will enjoy this one.

A seriously uninteresting yet convoluted script leads a Tom Cruise through remakes of scenes from Planet of the Apes, Day After Tomorrow, Wall-E, Total Recall, The Matrix and yes,Top Gun.  In one scene he is once again flying a state of the art airplane with a copilot he loves and fakes out his opponents by abruptly slowing down and then executing a Star-Wars-Like maneuver sliding between rock walls at high speed where his robotic opponents cant follow.
Morgan Freeman and other accomplished actors walk through their parts as well.
Bits and pieces are interesting.  Then again there had to be something to show for the hundreds of millions of dollars. spent on special effects.

Oblivion is kind of like a cross between the gloriously clean visual style of 2001: A Space Odyssey with the more involved, exciting simplicity of Star Wars: A New Hope. The film is simply beautiful in its sparse aesthetic design, elegant technology and breathtaking cinematography. And of course the musical score, as well, with involvement from M83. Tom Cruise is very good in this, as a character who involves the viewer but never overwhelms the story or setting. If you have only read a brief synopsis or saw the trailer, you may be in for some surprises upon actually watching this film, which is a nice thing to be able to say.

In an age where science fiction films are often cluttered, messy and frenetic (which can be good in some cases, granted) Oblivion is a refreshingly different creature. Watching it really feels like taking a breath of fresh air. If you find the idea of a film that combines the relatively clean visualizations of the best prestige sci-fi of the past, with modern visual effects and a dystopian story that is not prohibitively depressing, then this is one to check out.

One of the best SiFi movies I have watched in a long time.  The twists in the movie made it great entertainment.
Great movie.  We watched this over the weekend and enjoyed it very much.  Love Tom Cruise movies. Good for a night in

I am NOT a Tom Cruise fan, but the movie shines in spite of him.

I'm a hard core Sci-Fi watcher, and can usually predict where the plot is going, but there were a couple of twists that surprised me; something I love in a movie. But even if your not into the genre, you'll enjoy this movie if you like a mystery.

By the way, I would have given it the fifth star had there been another leading man. As I said, I'm no cruise fan.

Another good sci fi movie.  This one keeps you guessing and there are twists in the plot.  I am not very fond of Tom Cruise but I thought he did a good job acting.  I like Morgan Freeman and although his role was not as large, he did a good job too.  I wouldn't say this is suspenseful, but it is very good.
this was a beyond great for cinematography and story was perfect. Cruise and Freeman did awesome job with their role's
Great movie. Definitely makes you question what you perceive as reality and how memories are stored. Morgan Freeman was excellent, as usual.
What a great movie.  I enjoy the story, scenery, and music.  It had unnecessary nudity, unfortunately, or I'd give it 5 stars.

I like tom cruse and Morgan freeman in this move. I would recommend this movie to anyone who likes military stile action with a hero and a good story. The si fi is not too gorey but will keep you on the edge of your seat.

I originally watched this because my husband forced me to, and turned out to really like it.  The acting is good, the effects are good and I think the storyline is great.  I think this movie is a good metaphor for our lives - how we believe reality is one way until we learn something different and it changes our lives.  Plus it's quite a little love story too!  Definitely watch it.

For a SYFY movie, this one is in the game. The storyline was nice, the action was nice, the mystery was unique, and the ending was quite emotional...I LOVED IT!!! A great one for my collection indeed.
MOVIE WAS VERY INTERESTING FROM START TO FINISHED  AND I RECOMMED THIS MOVIE IT WAS AWESOME, GREAT FANTASTIC YOU HAVE TO WATCH IT !!!
Great scifi future movie with great plot twist. Good imagery for a future after a war with an alien force.

This is an enjoyable, fast-moving, tension-filled, suspenseful sci-fi film focusing on close to a century in the future after the earth has been destroyed by an alien society; although earth won the war and moved on to settle on a moon of the planet Saturn. But as we watch we realize that something is wrong. We are watching two earthlings assigned to monitor earth. Why is this necessary? Their memory has been erased. Why?
 Tom Cruise plays his part well. He has flashes of his past. He wants to explore what he is told not to explore, and he and we discover the truth.
 The tale has a nice surprise ending.

The FX were quite good, but the story was derivative and predictable SF.  The acting was so so.  I don't really recommend this unless you borrow it from the library for free viewing on a dreary day when nothing is on TV.
It really took effort to watch this for my husband and I. We ended up never finishing it 2 hours in. It has a good concept though.
I actually enjoyed the movie.  I wasn't sure about it at 1st.  Not sure if I'm tired of Tom Cruise in movies.
I first saw this movie while I was traveling in India. I was surprised by the plot.  I really enjoyed and I had to added it to my movie collection.
Excellent movie, very well acted with great actors and actresses. Great story with lots of action and great special effects.
Oblivion is really the type of movie I love to watch, lots of action and didn't really know what was going to happen till close to the end---WOW

Tom Cruise is awesome playing a "repairman" for robotic drones that patrol the earth to kill "invaders" who seem to be intent on sabotaging Cruise's efforts to maintain the drones and also want to destroy the massive devices which are sucking up all the waters of the oceans on earth.  All this while Cruise and his "companion" live in a luxury "condo in the sky" which includes a transparent swimming pool.  SPOILER ALERT:  Cruise is all gungho with his responsibilities, but seems to be finding things that "distract" him from his usual duties AND he encounters little clues that raise his curiosity contrary to the wishes of his companion.  This escalates when he encounters a crashed spaceship and manages to find a survivor... a beautiful female.  He has been experiencing fragmented "dreams" and it turns out the survivor is the woman in his dreams and events escalate thereafter...  I won't tell more, but it's a VERY clever story and well worth watching.  A WORTHY INVESTMENT for Sci-Fi fans and those that are fans of Cruise.
It was not a bad movie over all But I don't think it was Tom's best work There not all going be winners ...

I thought this film was outstanding with an excellent message at the end, even though some say "they don't get it".

I gotta say Tom Cruise has been in some great flicks recently (Jack Reacher was the other).  Very impressive.
I didn't expect to like this movie so maybe thats why I did.  I thought the story and the acting were well done.  I am kinda sad I didn't catch this in the theater.

I am not into futuristic movies.  This is movie I believe appeals to the 20 and 30 year olds.  I watched at all because I am a Tom Cruise fan as he always puts his all into each roll.  You can always expect an above average performance by Tom.  I also appreciate the talents and many movie role successes of Morgan Freeman.
Its not a great movie but its not boring either. It has me watching the movie the whole time and it was entertaining.

Visually stunning with effects that rival "gravity".

Good storyline that if you've not been spoiled, has an interesting twist.

Not sure why Cruise gets a bad rap from the critics..... While most parts of late have become somewhat one dimensional, he does action films well.
This movie was also good. I did not go to sleep and that means that it was good. My husband liked it. The action aS pretty good and it definitely is a collection keeper.

Not too many sci-fi movie is made like this. I still love watching it every time. The story is timeless, it's human, it's jealously, love, it's what makes us human. The music is chilling, and inspiring.

Good futuristic story, nice special effects and very realistic. Cruise and Freeman are on top of their game. The story keeps you interested with a couple twist and turns. The sound track is really good as sell.
Good SF story that hangs together well and has a satisfying development and ending.  Tom Cruise gives a very reserved and thoughtful perfoemance.  Not your standard invasion flic.  Well done.

The movie represents an outstanding example of what people can do with current movie making...CGI and the like and when coupled with an outstanding cast and music score you can not miss....have several examples of various versions of the movie.....but really wished it was in 3D and that there would have been "The Making of...." book....or "The Art of...."
Didn't know anything about the movie the first time I watched it.  Liked it so much I had to buy it.  I'd watch it every week if I had the time.
I buy books and put them on bookshelves to read when I have or make time.  I have not read this one yet but will comment more in the near future.

This movie took me away from the first moment I saw it, deeply moving it makes you think for yourself instead of just agreeing with other people or
going along with the in crowd.
The love story aspects will move you to tears I love a good love story, and everytime I see this movie on cable i have to watch it. I Love This Movie !
I was surprised that I liked this movie ... it was pretty good and not totally ruined by having Tom Cruise in it!
it was an interesting movie that no one could see coming until the end. it kept you interested through out the movie
It's a very unique film and one that I like very much as a Sci-Fi fanatic.  I think you'll like it if you like the Sci-Fi genre.
Although this was not what I expected I still enjoyed this movie.... Oblivion isn't a bad rainy day movie .

Rarely do I not have some idea as to where a film is going. This one from the start had me fooled. I will be watching it many times over. I will not review the story line, all need to see it without knowing what is to come. Enjoy.

Great movie.
Tom Cruise gave an excellent performance.
The plot was well written with enough twists to keep you engaged throughout the film.
Action, romance, sci fi, something for everyone.
This is an OK SyFy film.  Not a bad way to pass a few hours.  The price is reasonable for the DVD.

Not sure why in the press the reviews were mixed. This is an absolutely great movie, the best Tom Cruise has done in years. The storyline is good, nice action, great cinematography, just a fun movie with some twists. I can highly recommend it.

This was a good story line ~ and as much as I may personally dislike Mr. Cruise, he did well in this film.  Aliens leveled the planet and we won the was (or did we?) but the Earth is now a barren wasteland with caretakers stationed at high altitude platforms to oversee the harvest of Earth's water ~ man has moved to Europa (moon of Jupiter) following the devastation of Earth.  Teams are comprised of a technician (Cruise) and a communications specialist (female) ~ their task is to maintain the armed drones that protect the vast water pumping stations sucking up all the Earth's water ~ the protection is against groups of surviving aliens.  Good action and directing.

This movie will keep you guessing till the very end, and that is what I like.  I hate predictable.  Get this flick.  Tom Cruise was right actor for this movie.  Morgan freeman was there just enough.  Good job, Morgan. No offense. Get this flick.
Got this for my grandmother and she really apparently like movie. It was a surprise for her and she was very happy.
i wanted to rent this but i wait to buy a used copy . i liked the story and  watched it twice . if u like tom crusie u might like it everybody has there opinion .
The movie was a lot of fun, It gave me something to think about, what could happen when there is first contact  from Space.  Not a big Tom Cruise fan, but I liked him in this role.
A great look into the future of Mankind. The special effects are stunning. This movie will keep you on the egde of your seat.

You'd think that producers would have realized by now that CGI does not guarantee a great film experience, that the basics of plot and character still count.  But no, we are continually dished up visual extravaganzas that have about as much originality as a 50s cowboy formula flick.

This is a film about an outpost, run by Cruise and his girlfriend, which they believe is an outpost that will enable humans to colonize a moon and start over after a devastating war with a mysterious alien race.  The way that they live is fantastically vivid, as are the automated weapons that Cruise maintains to protect huge fusion reactors visible across the horizon.  It is a good life, but they are doing time, waiting to rejoin their cohorts on a space station.  Nonetheless, amidst his dangerous work routine, Cruise is disturbed by visions, seemingly old memories, of a girl he once loved, even though his memory has been "wiped" to protect information he purportedly has about the satellite.

Things, it seems, are not what they appear.  And, of course, they turn out not to be.  On the positive side, the actors are good.  I am a Cruise fan, and Kurylenko and Morgan Freedman give strong performances, too.  I do not want to reveal the surprise explanation, and there are some nice twists, but really, once you have seen this you will not want to watch it over and over - there is not much to savor, beyond dazzling visuals and Cruise-style action.  Scratch beneath the surface, and you get next to nothing.

I would only recommend renting this.  The fancy formats are fine, but why buy it for the rare viewing?

it was worth watching but I don't think I would run out to buy it
has that unexpected twist that makes you think "ahhh haaaa"

I like almost everything about this movie.  Special effects were not over done.  The physics of everything seemed real.  Mandatory for me is an ending that is only partially depressing.  I really like this movie.

I knew this was a post-apocalyptic like sci-fi movieand I'm a fan of this genre. It was definitely different than most I've seen, and the ability to keep me on-edge (figuring something was going to jump out at any time) was something few films make me do these days. Some reviewers may give away the plots in their reviews but not I! The twists and turns in this film are mostly unpredictable. The film was shot in many parts of the world, including Iceland, and much of what you see is "in camera" (meaning, not using green screen effects added later). Even some of the sky imagery was created using projectors instead of green screen visuals.

The video quality was excellent and the HD audio was incredibly full (almost too much low-end at times). The special features on the blu-ray provide a decent behind-the-scenes look at how it was made. I definitely recommend the blu-ray version (the digital copy is fine for mobile devices but just doesn't have the same quality as the blu-ray).

Why not 5 stars? Heh, 5-stars are reserved for masterpieces or future classics (in my eye). This is a very good sci-fi film, but I can't put it up there with the classics.

This is certainly a handsome looking production and things blow up real good. I can't figure if the makers of this film are assuming the audience's intelligence or stupidity.  The plotting here is so dense that it renders the narrative incoherent.  I scratched a groove in my scalp trying to figure this movie out.  Tom Cruise looks perplexed.  Morgan Freeman collects another paycheck for basically showing up.  Best scene in the movie is the skinny dip between Cruise and Andrea Riseborough.

So, yeah, Cruise and Freeman draw you in but never manage to explain what they are doing. The movie is very weak in story and plot and is explained in random spurts of unintelligible dribble.  It is more interesting if you just turn off the sound and watch the movie, making up your own plot as you go along. I never expect or am a fan of Cruise but Freeman keeps slapping his name on these junk shows. Does he really need to take that many flying lessons?
this movie was a good one, not only because of tom cruise. the movie back ground an other actors was so great , that everything stood out in this one

This movie arrived on time watched it and I am still confused,  did not like it! Not enough action, I fell asleep watching it so I watched it again,  and started to drows off yes for me,  it was that boring!

If you like sci-fi, you'll like this movie. If you don't, you won't.

Cruise is in fine form in this "last man on earth" post-apocalyptic tale. What the movie does best is a gorgeous visual aesthetic and pulsing electronic score featuring some quality acting.

However, the ideas are nothing new with a familiar story to most genre fans. The twist is good but not great, and a wee bit convoluted as well, though it sure wants to blow your mind. The film's opening expository voice-over is quite dreadful too.

But Oblivion is always nice to look at with some decent action/romance beats too.
The movie dazzles and is just plain cool ... I've watched it several times and love it. Get yourself as copy!
I'm not a big sci-fi person, but this was a great movie.  Watch quite often, never get tired of it.

I thought that this was a very good movie. It was intelligent, without the obscure, boredom of 2001; it had action, without the shoot 'em up blood and guts of Alien; and the ending was satisfying, unlike many Sci Fi Movies. For whatever reason the premise, the actors, and the story line all worked for me. I didn't have to go back and watch it several times just to understand something or catch a fleeting scene. Overall a great film. Some have tried hard to find fault - but I simply liked it the first time I saw it. Get it and see for yourself; you won't be disappointed.

Well it's pretty much the same as any other Tom Cruise movie.  A little wierd.  I felt like something was missing in the middle of the movie.  It's like they ran out of time so they just cut a part out of the middle.

Disappointing movie. I'm a science fiction lover and an avid fan of Tom Cruise's movie career. Still think he's a great actor but I wasn't impressed at all with this movie or his acting performance. You may Rent it but I would not recommend buying it!
This is what a Blu-ray is supposed to be like ! The picture Quality is perfect, if you have a good home theater system the sound will blow you away !

Oblivion is a great movie that has more then one twist & turn that keeps you guessing and on your toes.  The last 20 minutes are great & the ending song by M83 adds a coup de grace that completes a great movie!!!

Cruise ain't what he use to be.  The only reason I watched it was I got desperate for a good adventure.  It's an okay movie but I've seen a lot better.  Now I don't remember a lot about it.  Because after all it was just an okay movie and not a spectacular one.

I'm a big sci-fi fan. I have been kind of off Tom Cruise after he managed open his mouth and stick his foot in his mouth so many times.. When I saw the previews of the movie they looked good and I was encouraged that Morgan Freeman also starred in this movie.
When I saw the movie, it was very well written. It had a small cast, but each of the primary characters were very well done by the actors. This movie had great special effects. I liked how the set was both futuristic but also demonstrated all of the destruction on the planet. I also really enjoyed how the screenplay slowly revealed what was really going on, despite the way things seemed. That was quite a twist in the storyline.
There were quite a few things on the set of this movie that took real vision to set just the right atmosphere necessary for this movie. Kudos.
I enjoyed this movie so much that I had to add it to my collection. I was thrilled when I found the Blu-ray, dvd and digital copy edition on sale just before Christmas. I have really developed a preference for buying movies that have a digital copy available whenever it's possible. Now I can even watch this movie and enjoy it with a collection of other digital movies on my pc.
I really enjoyed this movie. I recommend this movie to other sci-fi fans. I hope you enjoy it as well.
Great movie!! Went to see it at the theater. Sucks that I had to wait for it came out on DVD. :)
I didn't see this in the theaters but I read some good reviews about this blu-ray. It is a very good looking release. was not disappointed
Good movie. Horrible and over-used plot. Enjoyable if you're not expecting greatness. With the actors in this, I was hoping for better.

Although parts of the movie were predictable, there are a few twists that were unexpected. Acting was on par for the cast. And, unlike so many recent sci-fi films, it was nice to see a movie with the bright colors of daylight as opposed to the darkness of outer space. All in all, I would recommend this movie.

Tom Cruise has been impressive in his recent releases and this one is no exception. I first watched it having only the expectation of disappointment and I was pleasantly surprised. This concept is really cool and you will not be disappointed at all! I talk about it all the time to the doubters like myself. Check it out!

I think the story was about a topic I have pondered, that is, when people start leaving the planet in droves, what happens to those who couldn't afford a ticket? ...I think that's what it was about. (shrug)

Chuck
Movie had a good plot development right up to the lame ending.  What was that the HAL 9000 big sister???  Come on man...
pleasantly surprise in how much I enjoyed the movie. Little bit of Wall-E and I am Legend. Tom Cruise definitely did a good job playing the main character.
I loved this movie ever since I went to the theater to see it. I love the twist that this movie has and the scenery. A good Sci-Fi movie.

I wish I hadn't wasted a gift card on this piece of trash. Dialogue was very shabby. Who wrote this crap? I really wasn't pleased with one of the actors or the weak plot that surely could have been strengthened by a good writer.
Oh well...... I admit I am not a Tom Cruz fan and also not big on Sci-fi but I quite enjoyed oblivion. Excellent Movie!

Did not do well at the box office, but it should have. Great visually. See more every time you watch it. Tom and Morgan make it that much better. Suspence, twists and thought provoking. Also have to watch special features.
Well worth watching if you are into sci-fi fantasy. Good acting, decent story line - good twist at the end. Morgan Freeman overplays his role - but it's palatable. Good movie, I may even buy the DVD.

I really liked this show. I missed it at the theater when it came out, and then the critics panned it... 'cause that's what they do... but I think it's a fun piece of Sci-Fi "who done it ?". A great ending, and a good story. Get yourself some of it !

Loved the story, acting, twists and ending.  Constantly keeps shifting and never boring. Cruise and Freeman are just excellent. A must see for guys or girls. Lots of mystery, suspense, action, and thrills.
it was a "OK" film.. can see why the ratings are not so high for it though.. The could have spent more on the special effects
I'm not a Tom Cruise fan, but I enjoyed the movie because I am a SyFy fan.  Like most movies today it is a real kick butt film.

I ordered this either for my wife and I or as a gift if you look at the rating we gave it that will tell you if we liked it or not, if it is special we will add a little comment same if it is bad. But telling me how many word I need to use is STUPID !!

We are dropped into the story and must deduce much of what is going on.  The focus is on the working couple of Tom Cruise and his costar, but mostly on Tom's growing dissatisfaction with his job of working for the god-like computer in the sky.  Even when the character roster enlarges, the story is still laser aimed at Tom.  So if you love Tom Cruise, you will definitely like this movie.  Ultimately the mystery is solved.  The solution is satisfying.  Whether renting or owning this is a money well spent.
This is a GREAT movie for any Science Fiction Fan.  Also for fans of Tom Cruise.  The ending surprised me...which doesn't happen too often!
Worth watching. Not the best but better than most. I am writing this part because the review app is making write a minimum amount. Good Day!
Actually gave this to my son and not sure if he liked it but I think he did.  He requested it.  I didn't actually watch it.  Came very fast and perfect condition. Thank you.
I'm a Tom Cruise movie fan and of love Morgan Freeman as well so I wasn't disappointed with this movie. No surprises and I was able to figure out the plot early on but that's okay.

The special effects of this film really serve the story and keeps viewers interested in the action and the storyline. It is a compelling story that is not just action-packed-mindlessness for teens. For me, it's one of those futuristic films that is worth owning, rather than just seeing just once.
Very well done, great special effects, with a great story line, and great music!  Must see if you like Sci Fi.

Tom Cruise plays a technician on a de-hydrating Earth, repairing drones against aliens he thinks still exist on the surface. Tom Cruise actually does some acting in this movie, and the plot is surprisingly complex, with a number of twists and turns. It is a decent sci-fi flick that poses questions of identity and an interesting moral dilemma at the end.

Its hard to find good sci-fi movies these days, with a totally different story, without dealing with alien invaders that just need to kill humans in one way or the other. Some are good and some are just overdone with the same concepts. This is one is a much different approach to the genre. I like Tom Cruise and he did great in War of the Worlds. His plays this character very well and the landscape is much more creative. Yes...there is CGI involved but it was about the only way to create the floating house he lives in, high in the sky. I wish I had a home like that myself. Good action and story that you won't find on cable TVs Sci-Fi channel.
This is one of the best Sci-Fi movies i have seen in a long time.  If you enjoyed "TRON Legacy" then you will like this.  It also has a very good story line and is well acted.

Short facts;
Watch the trailer and walk away. The making of the movie short is very good and draws you in, and makes you want to watch the full movie, and the trailer, screen shots are also spectacular. So, just be satisfied with that and save your money.

This film is a lame, repetitive, movie with a lackluster script.
The kind of movie you find yourself doing other things while you watch it,  like looking for another movie to watch.

From a true SCI-FI perspective some may get a kick out of it; for those who need dialectic and connections between characters, this movie is very lacking and seems like a bunch of scenes cut together in an editing room.

Left me wanting lot more......and my money back.
This is a fantastic movie.  It's got action and lots of twists to keep you thinking throughout.  Was enjoyed by myself and my guests.
I love  a good Si fi movie. Go's good with a hot beef sandwich and a beer. Great time waster

As a long time science fiction fan, recent films in the genre have disappointed me.  So Oblivion was a breath of fresh air and gives me hope for more good science fiction to eventually emerge.  Highly recommended.

You have to really watch this movie carefully or you will miss things.  It is a beautiful love story, a story of the triumph of the human spirit and the soundtrack is amazing.  There is something for everyone, for sci-fi lovers, for heros lovers, for romantics.  Truly if you haven't seen it, you really ought to.  Another top quality Tom Cruise work of art.

great visuals regarding visual settings, Tom Cruise contract clause "show me with no clothes on, my muscles and let me smirk and arrogant swagger smile every other scene" etc... So you get a nice picture, shallow Sci-fi story with Cruise hamming it up as usual. The story is ok, but almost like his new movie coming up? pointless repetition if you ask me.

Once you've seen this, there's almost no reason to watch it again unless you're in love with watching Tom Cruise himself. The story is predictable and rather small in scope like most modern films which is sad.

I was obliviously confused with all the obliviousness that is going on in oblivion. Obliviously, I rated this movie 2 stars because I was obviously disappointed. I know tom cruise is not as tall as morgan freeman. No good content. The story was misleading and it's trying too hard to be like "inception". Stay original and maybe viewers like me would enjoy more. Till this day, I still am oblivious to the story line in obivion.
Great special effects and interesting plot.  Reasonably good acting but somewhat predictable ending.  Definitely one I will keep for my SciFi collection.

I've watched Oblivion 5 times in 2 months and enjoy the set variation.  I also like to to study the ship, motorcycle, and guns.  I loved the surreal living arrangements of Tom Cruise's character as the "mop up crew".  Costumes where ideal and represented a wild west indicator of good guys and bad guys; white hat vs black hat in westerns.  But eventually in "Oblivion", the two opposing sides decide through shared awakenings to join together in an effort to chase the bigger threat to them both; the machine in the sky.
The other White house movie much better.. This movie just OK..wait for it to  cost less. 1.99?? maybe  thanks for info
This was a great Movie ....  I am a big Sifi fan and if you are, you should watch it.
Great story line on an old aliens versus us theme.  Amazing effects with some incredible visuals make this story come alive.  Definitely worth the watch. (written by her husband!)

Husband and I rented this DVD while on vacation, and after viewing once, I had to buy it. Action packed and exciting, with tid-bits of details not caught during the initial viewing that really jump out with the 2nd and 3rd times through. Highly recommended for any movie library!

I was surprised by this movie.  I thought it'd be complete junk, but even for hardcore sci-fi fans, it had some interesting substance and style.  The only problem I had (other than a few excusable plot holes) was the fact that having Tom Cruise, kindof took away from the mysterious setting of the story because every time he's on the screen it reminds that it's just a Hollywood blockbuster, and you always see that guy in movies.  This would have been a perfect movie for a breakout star (and freeman could have still generated some name recognition).

Still, surprisingly worth watching if you're into sci-fi blockbusters.  Way better than Elysium, which shares a ton of similar attributes, but wasn't good at all IMHO.
Not a huge Tom Cruise fan but this was an interesting concept. Visual effects were great. Morgan Freeman did a convincing part. Better than what I thought it would be.

The plot line starts out solid....then you start using your brain and realize that you've been blinded by fancy spaceships and Tom's teeth. My disappointment level went from a -1 to -10 during the scene where "all is revealed".  Ugh...really?
This is an awesome movie, great effects and a great story, with a huge twist at the end. Cruise delivers as he always does, as does Morgan Freeman. Highly recommend. One of my favorites!

I really enjoyed this movie and consider it a solid addition to my collection.  Story line is good, Cruise does a passable job and the plot has a couple of good moments that were not as predictable as you might imagine.  Solid piece of cinema - while not a 'classic' to be sure it is watchable and a decent go to movie with the digital copy/Ultraviolet.

Wow!... What a engaging sci-fi movie.  I haven't seen a movie so human and compelling in this genre since Stanley Kubrick's '2001'.  It has a real plot, action, scenes and cool tech.  It has a real love story as opposed to the typical sci-fi lust stories.  The story tells of the treacherous circumstances of the characters with the minimum amount of carnage and destruction to make the point.  Jack (Tom Cruise) is trying to regain his humanity in a truly inhuman construct.  Which speaks to all of us today in our pseudo-social networked devices.  How did this movie get such smug reviews?  This one has quickly become one of my all-time favorites.
I have bought this movie when it first released on Blu-Ray and I love this movie. Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman very good as well as the other actors
This flick is first class all the way...Great sci-fy concept and some real thought about plot and stringing the movie into on piece...I would like to give it six stars if I could...

I like Tom Cruise and IMO he rarely misses. I love sci fi as well and am always hoping for best case scenario when a new big budget SF flick comes out - so had high hopes for this - unfortunately it misses the mark. It is derivitive and predictable. I won't post spoilers but there are certain twists that just weren't needed and ultimately took away from the experience. Watch on cable or rent this one first as I don't think it is one you will return to... I am giving three stars but really should be 2 1/2
Really enjoyed the entire movie and what a great ending.  Kind of a little sad and happy too.  Makes you think...
A really great movie and incredible special effects.  This was my first opportunity to view a Blu-Ray DVD on my HD TV, and it was more than I expected.

I love this movie. It is beautifully filmed. The Icelandic backgound is a perfect backdrop for the sparse but visually stunning movie.
 Loved it.
Even Tom Cruise  can't make this dud tolerable,It is  horrible. I'd give it  no stars if that was possible. Save your money and time---pass this one up.

This movie is awesome. so this is what earth would look like after the moon is destroyed and alien robots attack. and then take two astronauts and clone them and wipe out their memory. well I hope I don't live to see that day. I thought that this movie has a great story, excellent actors cruise and freeman. the movie was a little slow at times but got very interesting towards the end. I though that it was made well done even if it had slow parts in the movie. the actors did a great job and the special effects were sweet. this is a great movie. if you have not seen this movie then I recommend you do

this was even better than I had expected...  it seems to get you involved... plenty of action and shooting but not
like most these days..  tastefully done... the plot seems to run right but leaves you wondering whats up and as the
story unfolds - yes - there is a story  hahaha -  you get more into it..  a little more confusion near the end but
you will get all the answers and an excellent ending..  even though you might not think so at first.. it is thought
provoking...  and heartfelt...  more than just the usual shoot-em up sci-fi...  enjoy,,  I know you will.

This product arrived undamaged and quickly.

As for the movie itself, without spoiling the plot(s), lets just say my wife and I really found nothing new about this film's story.  It reminded us of Mad Max, specific episodes of the Twilight Show, a specific movie of Star Trek, undertone of Matrix, and a few other movies.  Don't get us wrong, it was a good movie, but many of the concepts seem as though taken from past films.  There were a lot of aspects were you could point out many plot holes, especially near the end.  Yet taken at face value, it was a good moviejust not great.  The acting was good, the images were great (often beautiful), and the situationthough similar to past movies, was interesting.  We would have given it more stars, but there were just some aspects that made absolutely no sense and we didn't feel the plot had us locked in.  Some characters place themselves in idiotic and dangerous locations when you know they never would have prior, other situationswell, we just don't want to ruin the story by the flaws we found with the film.

However, do not get us wrong, it was not a bad film by any means.  It was just common and somewhat lacking, thus our 3 star rating.  That being said, this is just our opinion, and if you love Science Fiction with a twist, this might be a great movie for you.

We hope this review helps.

I mean... it's Tom Cruise. Any movie he's in, he's never anyone else but Tom Cruise. Rarely is he in a very deep or thought-provoking movie in this genre. (vanilla sky is one exception that comes to mind) Oblivion is good fun as "sci-fi lite" for when you want a fix without a labyrinthine plot. Basically the polar opposite of something like Blade Runner or Children of Men. (side note: I'm not sure I can name a movie where Tom Cruise disappeared into a role... he's always the same, good or bad you always just see him.)

Having said that, this movie has visual style to burn and is not without "twists" in the story. Everything is telegraphed prior to revelation and thus not much is terribly shocking for anyone that treads the science fiction waters regularly, but it is a solid movie. That's not to say that some won't miss those tells and be thus surprised at times... it is a well done movie with good talent all around. (yes, even Tom Cruise most of the time) Most reviews were overly harsh and similar to 2010's Tron Legacy, this was raked over the coals without giving it a chance. (Which may be more telling that you first think as they both were directed by Joseph Kosinski) It is allot of fun, especially when watching with others and the aforementioned popcorn. It is enjoyable.

I did mention style, and it truly oozes a visual flair that makes the world come alive. (or bleakly dead, depending on how you look at it) It comes from a comic (ahem, graphic novel!) and keeps that saturated look to it, which is a great feast on larger TVs. It is worth Buying Blurray over DVD without question. Note that this is not style over substance (say like Ultraviolet or Chronicles of Riddick) and this still runs plot circles around those types of movie. More-so, when stood up against most things from Marvel (which are firmly planted in the 'unsurprising-but-enjoyable' popcorn category) and everything from Michael Bay (which is in the 'throw-money-at-the-screen-and-don't-even-bother-to-stitch-it-together-intelligently' category) then this movie looks positively stellar.

Bottom Line: If you like action-sci-fi with great visual flair and decent story then this is worth seeing.

The blue ray was packaged well, the movie excellent.  I watched this movie twice before getting the plot.  Not because I am dense but because I can not tolerate Tom Cruise and was reading a book all during the first showing.  When I realize there really was a plot and his acting was good, I paid attention the second showing.  It really is a good movie. Warning: Spoilers here:
Seldom do I like a movie so much that I watch it twice in one week. To me, this was a very thought provoking scifi film.
It was also a great love story. And I thought Tom Cruise did a good job acting. What's the mind blowing scifi concept, to me, in this film is that our soul stays with us even if we're cloned, and as the character Jack says in the film, "If we have souls, they're made of the love we share. Undimmed by time, unbound by death." So even though there are many clones of Jack, he remembers the love he had for his wife. So, the question is, if we're cloned do we live forever? Do we have more than one soul? Does each of Jack's clones have a soul? As time goes on he remembers more and more. The idea of our existence, our consciousness, being transferred to a clone boggles my mind. Would it really be me? In the end Jack says, "I am him". He said, "For three years I searched for the house you built. I knew it had to be out there, because I know him."
[Julia and Jack stare at each other from across the lake]
Jack: [voice over] I am him.
[Julia's child points at Jack]
Julia's Child: Who's that?
Jack: [voice over] I am Jack Harper. And I am home.
[Jack smiles]

Some have mentioned the unemotional nature of the way the statements were made. I prefer that to ham handed, overly emotional "acting". To me, I could imagine myself in that situation, and I think I would have been about the same, not overly emotional. The overwhelming reality of what happened to Jack and Vica, and their legion of clones, is amazing. And the visuals of a future destroyed Earth were some of the best I've ever seen in a future Earth movie.

Lastly, it ended so well, so uplifting and happy, to me. "The Road" ripped my guts out and the visuals were much more spare, and the same with the "Book of Eli", there were some stunning visuals but they left you wanting much more. "Oblivion" has wonderful visuals, shocking and stunning, and they were satisfying, I didn't really need to see more. They showed you enough that you "got it" without over-doing it.

To me this is one of the best scifi films I have ever seen. I loved it. Also wanted to mention Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, his role was pretty small but still a good one, and in the end when he smiles, and he's got one of the greatest smiles, and it was perfectly timed. I hope to see a lot more of him in future films.
I thought it was very well done.  It was a suspense and not a big action flick, with some action.

This product comes with a Blu-ray, DVD, and digital version allowing its viewing anywhere.  The visual stunning epic provides reality to a nearly-ruined future earth.  This plausible creative futuristic tale after an apocalyptic alien invasion of earth is worth the ride.  Cruise plays Jack Harper stationed there as a lone security repairman.  The film ends with humanity's fate in his hands.  No better CG found anywhere.

Too many reviewers are giving away to much plot.  One of the things that keep this movie going is that there are several plot surprises throughout the film.  Some of the reasons I liked this movie was because it is a fairly original idea as to how earth was attacked, why and by whom, not going to tell you.  The relationship with his female partner and back-up, if in trouble, make them a "very effective team".  The whole story about what his job is or may be is good.  Tom Cruise has memories but they can't be true, and the women he dreams about.  It is scary and sad to think that something like this could actually happen. who knows?  There is enough action but not so much to blur the plot and keep this film an adult Sci-Fi film.  There is a lot of beautiful scenery.  The special effects are first rate and much more realistic then all those silly hobbit movies.  Finally, all of the actors did an excellent job, and this is another very good performance from Tom Cruise regardless of the haters.  I think another reason this is a more intelligent Sci-Fi movie is because this is partially made by a foreign movie company and not the bankrupt of ideas Hollywood crowd.  I highly recommend this movie.

What makes Oblivion stand out to me is that it doesn't really focus entirely on laser beams shooting everywhere and several elements of hard-to-follow suspense and excitement like you'd typically find in such science fiction movies that deal with the destruction/deterioration of planet Earth.  Instead these particular type of segments only occurs occasionally.  In its place lies segments involving drama concerning Tom Cruise's wife from 60 years prior found frozen in a capsule, and how she wakes up to find the world in its current state which is practically in ruins due to an alien invasion being the reason.  Tom Cruise of course is the man who's expected to save planet Earth!  Who else to play that role, right?

While the occasional segments showing space crafts flying everywhere are certainly interesting and comparable to what you've seen countless times in similar science fiction movies, the storyline itself is rather confusing to figure out.  The doppelganger Tom Cruise that appears later on is when I finally got *completely* lost.  Also when Tom Cruise returns to his base and his current girlfriend (or wife- the redheaded chick) doesn't acknowledge the fight between her and Cruise that *just* took place a few minutes earlier apparently either because her memory went out or a change in time occurred without acknowledgement at some point.  Never could figure out which one truthfully.

Morgan Freeman is a fantastic actor in his role as a deep-voiced leader, Olga Kurylenko is ridiculously cute as one would expect (but exceptionally cuter here!) and so is Andrea Riseborough.  Despite the confusing storyline and never knowing what's really happening on screen, one area where the movie truly exceeds is in the visuals.  Despite millions of people having been killed years earlier and the destruction of several famous structures and landmarks such as the Golden Gate Bridge, it all comes across appearing remarkably pretty and appealing oddly enough (especially the forest area that Tom would sometimes visit while listening to Led Zeppelin and Procol Harum, rock bands truly deserving of their classic status!)

Overall, pretty awesome film, but expect to sit through a fair amount of drama and even romance which is more of a focus than anything else.

nothing special, but tom does tom and you almost get your money's worth.

I'm always looking for a good science fiction story, since there aren't very many out there, especially in film. This one delivers. It escapes the trap of overproducing the special effects and tells a good story that just happens to be set in a far-future of bleak reality. Still, the effects are good and well done. I never got the feeling that I was looking at a contrived setting.

I liked the way they handled the characters. We get to know Jack and Victoria Harper just as well as we get to know the back-story of their barren earth and their mission there, even though we don't have much time with them.

And a plus for me was the ending. Maybe I shouldn't have been, but the ending surprised me, and I'm always glad to see a story do that.

Most importantly, this movie touches on some of the themes that often get lost in science fiction, such as the need for a little peace and quiet along the lake shore and a connection to the past.

I will watch this movie again, more than once.

Tom Cruise proves once again that he can give a highly convincing performance as the leading man in a futuristic film. This future is bleak since earth is now a resource for a mysterious machine driven power that is sucking earth dry. Like many films and stories, Jack, the character played by Cruise, undergoes an awakening of consciousness regarding the power or authority under which he works. He discovers much about the rag-tag cave survivors on earth and in a play with time finds a capsule with a beautiful women inside.  The viewer makes sense of it all at the same time that the truth begins to unfold for Jack, a time honored technique in story-telling. Jack has had his memory erased and thus as he makes sense of the world in which he lives, so does the viewer of the film.

This is a good looking movie with some of the best art direction I have seen in a while. I loved the soundtrack, it was perfect for the look and feel of this film.

I neglected to see this in theaters because reviews were mixed and the word-of-mouth that came to me was that it was Ok-to-Good. I regret not seeing it in theaters because I think this movie is underrated. It's a shame it under-performed at the box office. I suspect it will build up a nice following over time. As everyone seems to agree, it's visually outstanding. Acting is consistently good. Tom Cruise really is a fine actor and I think this is a terrific performance, subtle and restrained and just right. There are some elements that are awfully reminiscent of other science fiction movies, but it didn't distract at all from my enjoyment. There is an almost obligatory chase sequence...He's flying through some kind of big indoor space chasing and being chased and shooting at things, then squeezing through a tight spot to exit..I could have done without. Also, as much as I respect and admire Morgan Freeman, I'm wondering if it's possible WE CAN GET A FREAKING MOVIE WITHOUT MORGAN FREEMAN. Anyway. The movie has a fine twist to the plot that I didn't see coming. (It's clear that SOME kind of big plot twist is coming, but I wasn't at all sure of what it would be.)

I'm sure I'll watch this again and am happy to recommend it to my friends.

Just for the heck of it, my wife and I just watched this on streaming video and found a VERY different film than expected. With a few action scenes worked in here and there, this is actually a very thoughtful and surprising post-apocalyptic sci-fi story.

Set about 70 years in the future, the Earth has reportedly won a war with alien invaders by resorting to the nuclear option. The relatively few people left have abandoned Earth to live on Titan (a large moon of Jupiter), and the few people left hanging around are protecting large machines that are generating needed power for the colony by sucking up the Earth's oceans.

Tom Cruise plays Jack, one of these survivors whose job is to repair weaponized drones which protect the power generating machines. Along with a female partner, they spend their nights in a luxurious base and their days working to find and repair drones downed by the remnants of the invading army.

The surprises in this film won't be shocking for highly experienced sci-fi fans, but their gradual revelation makes for a very intriguing and very thoughtful story. Jack's increasing self-awareness and his struggle to arrive at the truth is a fascinating story which is 180 degrees different than the movie suggested by the ads ... and trust me that's a GOOD thing! :-)

Well, any more than this and I'd be getting to spoiler territory ... as if there likely aren't hundreds of reviews with spoilers out there anyway. LOL I'll just say that we found this to be an excellent film with plot twists that kept us guessing for quite some time. Highly recommended.

Its 2077. The Earth has been rendered virtually uninhabitable after an alien invasion that took place sixty-some years earlier. Even though the humans technically won the war (using nuclear weapons which pretty much wiped everything out), most of the planets survivors have long since moved to a colony on one of Saturns moons, leaving behind only a handful of people, like Tom Cruises Commander Jack Harper, as part of the  mop-up crew, whose job is to repair drones and to make sure the alien remnant known as the scavengers don't interfere with the continued production of fusion power from the oceans that is needed by the humans living up on Titan.

Complications arise when Jack rescues a female flight commander (Olga Kurylenko) whose vehicle is shot down by Scavs. Trouble is he thinks he may remember her from a time before he had his memory swiped as a needed security precaution given the sensitive nature of his job and mission.

Oblivion is a visually elegant film from director Joseph Kosinski, adapted from his graphic novel, which was never published. The screenplay by Karl Gajdusek and Michael DeBruyn has some of the opaqueness of Inception, as, like a master card dealer, it shuffles the planes of reality to the point where the characters and the audience cant quite make out what is actual and what is a mixture of dreams, memories and alternate realities. Similarly, the filmmakers seamlessly blend CGI action, metaphysics and a surprise, turnabout ending to create a subtle, thought-provoking vision of technology in a post-apocalyptic future.

Oblivion takes its time telling its story, more concerned with mood and impression than with whiz bang action and plot details - though it doesnt stint on either of those two things either.

Andrea Riseborough, Melissa Leo and Morgan Freeman round out the cast, though Freemans character feels more plot contrivance than genuine person.

Oblivion isn't a completely satisfying movie in the final analysis, but its effective balance of tone and glorious visuals makes it worth watching.
20 words to describe your generic action flick...good movie... Lots of good action scenes ... Not totally predictable...buy it for your next long plane ride

I'm a Tom Cruise fan & even though I saw this movie & loved it I still wanted to add it to my Tom Cruise Collection.  Every so often I'll take one or 2 out & watch it.  I enjoy all his movies but I do have my favorites!
