Rating: 2.5 out of 5.0

In the U.S., 'Oblivion' grossed approximately $89 million. Overseas it was close to $197 million. What does this tell us? For all those non-English speaking people, the Oblivion narrative perhaps wasn't all that important--special effects and one action scene after another, were the key to the overseas success. Here perhaps word got out that this Tom Cruise vehicle was not as gripping in terms of narrative, as the Oblivion marketing people, led us to believe. There were possible reasons for this, mainly having to do with the nature of the story itself.

As I found this sci-fi, action adventure film to be mediocre at best, I have no trepidations about giving away the main twist that the main plot rests its head on. So if you haven't seen the film, I strongly suggest you quit reading here and read some of the more critical reviews found at Metacritic, which don't give away the whole kit and caboodle.

We're led to believe that Tom Cruises' 'Jack Harper', is a drone repairman in charge of servicing various sphere-shaped drones that emanate from a tetrahedral space station dubbed 'Tet', run by the 'good 'guys'--the surviving humans, represented by the mission commander, 'Sally', who it turns out is a computer generated entity, similar to the 'HAL' of 'A Space Odyssey'. Harper has been told that the drones service and protect fusion power generators on earth that are supposedly extracting the necessary energy for a plan to have the rest of humanity migrate to the Saturn moon, Titan. All this after an apocalypse on earth, caused by alien 'Scavengers'. Harper believes that humans defeated the 'Scavs' after they destroyed the moon, decimating earth due to the resulting gravitational shifts. Remnants of the Scavengers still remain on earth, attempting to destroy the drones which must keep the power generators operating.

Before the break into the second act of the story, 'Oblivion' operates as a typical sci-fi action adventure flick. Harper's significant other, Victoria (aka Vika), has dramatically little to do, operating the computer console and assisting Harper keep track of the drones back at their house 'in the clouds'. At a certain point, Harper gets involved in a chase with the drones very reminiscent of the chase inside the death star in Star Wars. Finally, things get mildly interesting when Harper saves Julia, a human astronaut in stasis from before the apocalypse on earth. Harper has vague memories of Julia, despite having his memory 'wiped' by his overseers.

When Harper discovers that he's a clone, he finally figures out that the 'Scavs' are actually the good guys as they are not aliens but humans who are battling the true aliens, represented by 'Sally' up in the 'mother ship'. So the second half has Harper joining forces with the Scavs, in their effort to destroy the aliens. It turns out that right before the alien invasion, there was a mission to Titan with the original Harper and Vika as the astronauts at the controls. Those two turn back to engage the aliens but before doing so, jettison the rest of the crew (including Julia), who turns out to be Jack's wife before the apocalypse. Harper and Vika are the prototypes used by the aliens to create the clones.

'Oblivion' asks us to applaud the twists and turns in the plot, particularly the revelation that Harper is a clone and the Scavs are actually human. But it's not enough to make this compelling drama. The problem is that Cruise is not pitted against a well drawn out antagonist throughout the narrative. Before the 'big twist', Cruise as Harper battles the faceless 'Scavs', who look like rejects from the first Star Wars series. Even after it's revealed that Sally and her minions, are the true villains, Harper spends most of his time battling the antagonists' surrogates: the drones who are constantly trying to annihilate him. This is also true of the first half of Act II--it's the opposition to the drones that basically fuels most of the conflict in the script. 'Oblivion' really is reduced to a standard sci-fi actioner for most of the time.

'Oblivion' also feels like an amalgam of many sci-fi predecessors. We've already alluded to 'Star Wars' but one is also reminded of 'Planet of the Apes', in its scenes of a ruined New York City after the apocalypse (here it's the shell of the Empire State Building which triggers Harper's memories of meeting Julia for the first time)--of course in 'Planet', it's the 'Statue Liberty' that gets the end of the world treatment.

Both 'Oblivion' and 'I, Robot' have similar antagonists--a female voice which represents an entire computer network. Both 'Sally' and 'VIKKI', serve similar functions and both Will Smith and Tom Cruise must destroy the network in order to save the day. 'I, Robot', however, is much more compelling since Will Smith's character has a complex ally to play off of ('Sonny' the robot). Not so for Cruise, whose strongest ally is Julia (who is hardly what you would call a foil at all).

'Oblivion' just rates an average 2.5 out of 5.0 in my book. It's got some nice special effects and that one big aforementioned twist. But in the end, 'Oblivion' is nothing more than a glorified 'shoot em up', with Cruise playing his usual 'good guy' part. I certainly wouldn't discourage the first time viewer from watching it but it's not something I would want to take a peek at, on a second go-round at all.
This was a good movie.  I found myself watching it all the way through.  The acting and special effects were good.  I don't think that you will be dissapointed

I am a picky Sci-Fi lover. This movie was panned. Why?

I know that the reviews aggregated by RottenTomatoes point to the 'trite' plot, though I think that's part of the brilliance. If you only pay attention for the first hour, you think that it's trite and unoriginal. If you keep watching, though, there are factors that come into play that you probably didn't expect at all. It becomes pretty interesting.

Additionally, the design is really quite cool, the photography is gorgeous, and Jamie Lannister and Maverick are in it shooting guns and stuff.

Yeah, there are a couple gaps in the plot, so it doesn't get five stars. However, I think that the purpose of Sci-Fi movies is to propose alternate realities and juxtapose them to what we know now, highlighting universal human traits and flaws or strengths within society. It does an alright job here and the visuals are enough to keep it interesting when the pacing slows down a bit.
Far too many stupid plot points. I get that this is fiction, but the aliens are idiots. They couldn't create the technology they did, cross vast distances and still be that stupid.

it's a waste of time. The makers of this movie obviously think that if it has Tom Cruise in it, it should be fine even without a decent script.  Well, it ain't.  It's down there with Vanilla Sky and some of the other story-less, disjointed futuristic flicks Cruise has to his credit.
What a waste of money.  Predictable story, subpar CGI.  This movie is overrated for what it really is, a Tom Cruise vehicle to generate money that it doesn't deserve.
Ok movie with some easy to predict plot twists.  Great special effects but you need more than that to make a good movie.
Good special effects & a surprise plot twist makes this story interesting. Morgan Freeman always adds another star to any movie project he is in. Entertaining.
No. It's with Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman, which means that this movie is about Morgan Freeman in the future. THAT'S IT.

So here's the spoiler warning, because I'm not going to try to not talk about aspects of the movie, so, if you think, like me, that the movie looks cool and you're probably going to watch it anyway despite what I say (just don't do it. really), you shouldn't read this. If you want to know about all of the dumb (you should!), read on.

I realize this isn't an issue for some people, but it is for me, as I've mentioned before: The movie did that opening narration thing to explain what's going on. I'm convinced that opening narration is almost always a bad thing. If you have to have it, you have either (1) started your movie in the wrong place (2) failed to provide information within the movie in a way that works for the viewer. The Star Wars movies are one of the few places where you can find effective opening narration (in the form of the prologue scroll). And, then, not only did Oblivion open with the narration providing the viewer with an out-of-character monologue of events, but all of that same information was provided about halfway through the movie in almost exactly the same format. Please, do not provide me the same information more than once in your movie. I can almost guarantee you that I got it the first time (which is why I tell my kids to not repeat themselves when they do something they find funny: I did just see it happen).

Despite the opening narration, the movie doesn't make much sense. Ostensibly, Jack and Victoria are a team placed on Earth to defend these large fusion reactors, but, really, why are they needed? There's actually no good reason for them to be there. Sure, sure, he's some technician who has to repair the drones, but that's flimsy at best, because that whole set up is just to support the fact that they want this character that doesn't have any memories, but from any kind of logical standpoint, it doesn't make any sense. I mean, it might (almost) make sense if the stated premise of the movie was true, but you know it's not, because, even if it was, what would be the point of erasing the memories of the support teams? However, with the knowledge that the aliens are really in charge, there is absolutely no good reason to have things set up the way they are. Why do they need humans to repair their drones? And why, after the Jack clones fought for them as their army when they took over the Earth, do they need to trick the clones into believing they're normal humans anyway?

Then there's the problem of Jack having this whole wilderness retreat that he's built, somehow, without anyone finding out. He's able to just turn off the tracking unit in his (what I'm calling) dragonfly ship (which  is very cool, by the way) and go "off comm." What the heck? His navigator person (who never leaves "the tower") doesn't have any idea where he is when he does this and neither do the aliens. Seriously? They just allow him to go off and do secret things without bothering to know what he's up to. Completely implausible. Sure, it makes sense if you believe the story as it's presented at the beginning of the movie, but, again, you know that's not the whole story fairly quickly, and the idea that the aliens (or whatever) would just allow this is beyond imagining. It's what the writer/director do to support the lie and get the audience to buy into it, but those things need to make sense after the truth is revealed, too.

Jack has these dreams... dreams of being in New York before it was destroyed, but that was 50 or so years ago, and he's not that old. My wife kept joking about them being "clone dreams" because, at that point, we were trying to go along with what the movie was telling us. Trying. But we both knew she was right. Right in that being what the movie was going to say they were: memories of Jack's life before he was cloned by the aliens. Seriously? This isn't the 80s anymore, and we already knew in the 80s, even in sci-fi, that clones don't get the memories of the being they were cloned from. The memory flashes work if his mind really was "wiped" before his mission, but it doesn't work as some remnant from his genetic donor. It's just dumb. Why can't we seem to get past this stupid idea that clones have the memory of whatever they were cloned from? (And, again, I just have to point out that Star Wars does not do this, the only sci-fi clone movie I can think of that doesn't fall back on that tired idea.)

Also, the drones, which can follow Jack's "DNA trail" (really? we leave a trail of DNA in the atmosphere even when we're in an enclosed, airtight vessel?) have a problem with his voice identification and consider killing him more than once. I suppose they can't sense his DNA when he gets too close. That's only a long-range thing. (Do you sense the sarcasm there?)

And there's the bit where the drones are flying through the human hideout blasting everyone into cinders but, when one of them corners Jack's wife, Julia (introduced only to be a princess-in-the-tower character), and a bunch of other humans in a dead-end corridor, it pauses and decided to scan them. Again, really? The drone, programmed to kill humans, suddenly needs to stop and scan them? For just long enough for it to get exploded from behind, of course.

And, after all of that, we're not even up to the stupidest part of the movie. I know! I see your jaws hanging. The stupidest part is when he finally flies up to the alien ship, this huge, upside-down pyramid thing, and it's just full of vast expanses of space on the inside! When did this become a thing and what kind of sense does it make? So, yeah, he's flying through this huge space and, every once in a while, he has to fly through an opening in a wall, and the walls are covered in clone pods. The only other things in the huge alien space ship are drones. No aliens. And, when he finally gets to the center to arrive at "Sally," it's just another inverted pyramid thing with a flashing (talking?) red light. NO ALIENS! So tell me why they needed to take over the Earth and use it as a source of material for their fusion reactors IF THERE ARE ACTUALLY NO ALIENS? And, if that's all they needed, why didn't they just stop at any of the unpopulated planets on the way into the solar system? Wouldn't that have been so much easier than having to fight a bunch of humans for the materials they wanted? AND WHERE WERE THE ALIENS?

There was also an even more stupidest part. The part where somehow the flight recorder from Jack's spaceship from when he first got captured by the alien ship went from being in the command module, recording what was happening, to being in the sleeping quarters of the ship even though the sleeping portion had been jettisoned. Because that makes all the sense.

The acting, though, wasn't bad. Not great but not bad, either. And the tech was decently cool. But there was a reason (many of them, actually, as I've pointed out) the movie didn't make back its production budget domestically. So, unless you just have to prove to yourself how dumb the movie is, this is not one I could suggest to anyone.
Plot is exciting and interesting to a point,  but the more one watches, the more one has to suspend reality until the ending become totally ludicrous.
Morgan Freeman's character was a little clichd but I loved this movie because it got a major "what the F" moment from me and that rarely happens.
movie would keep stoping had to restart over and over to view movie. Very anoying. Should have a refund on this item

Something about this movie is very captivating! I watched it 3 times in 3 days! Not what you expect and probably need to watch it twice to see what makes sense - kind of like having to watch The 6th Sense twice.
This is a good  film but I am not a big fan of Tom Cruse but I like to see the movies hat Morgan Freeman is in

I'm not the Sci-Fi fan I used to be, but I've still seen and read a *LOT* of Sci-Fi in my life.
I really enjoyed this movie, and true, the amazing visuals did help. Any discussion would risk spoiling the story, though.
It is nice to see Tom Cruise finally showing some signs of age...
I hate Tom Cruise, but he does get great scripts. This is a beautiful movie to watch as well as exciting.

It was a bit predictable.  Certain parts of the story line were difficult to follow or just didn't make sense.  Tom Cruise's character was just sickeningly typical for the types of characters that Tom Cruise plays.  Tom Cruise needs to broaden his appeal by being cast against type sometime.
Beautiful graphics, unique story line with a twist.  If you like Tom Cruise and SiFi you'll like it.  Worth renting.

Of course the viewer will like it. It's another "Tom Cruise" movie. Good action although a bit off the planet. After the movie, I wander where and how the base in the space came about. Anyway, Mr. Freeman did a good job with his short part in the movie but could have been a stronger character. This movie is only a "one bagger" of popcorn.

I watched this being a little skeptical not knowing much about it. I thought what the hay, it has lots of 4&5 star reviews it can't be too bad. I'm so glad I did watch. This one blew me away and had me hanging on the edge. The ending was perfect. I totally loved it. Tom Cruise still has it.

Very cool story.  I enjoyed it very much.
Could have done without Tom Cruise taking my Lord's name in vain, twice.  It really takes away from the movie and does nothing for the story.  Ever since he's been in scientology, he seems to make it a point to say that in every movie.
Otherwise, I like the story and the movie was put together real well, I stayed intrigued the whole time!
Love the movie!  Love Tom Cruise!  Came as expected.  No problems with the DVD.  Happy to have movie!  That's it!
This is a cool movie with a easy to follow plot and neat robots that you can almost believe are real , just a well done action film .
ONCE YOU UNDERSTAND WHAT IT IS OCCURING, YOU GET IT.  TAKES SOME THOUGHT, THOUGH.  IT IS ENERTAINING..TOM CRUISE, DIDN'T DISAPPOINT ME.

Could have been released as a 3 part mini-series on TV. Tediously long and tiresome.  Some trailers make it out to be more than it was.  Gorgeous landscapes and futuristic hardware can't fill a movie without enough meat.  If I had to do it all over, I would have waited for this title to be available on Netflix.
OK sci-fi flick.  Cruise is a pretty good actor.  Wasn't sure if it was going to be any good, but was pleasantly surprised.
I like the movie, the action, the underdogs always come out in the end, and love conquers all.  The actors where great.
tom was on his a game here with a great supporting cast and a top notch story with twists and turns that will keep you on the edge of your seat
Great movie. It kept me thinking and on the edge of my seat the entire time. Crazy twist at the end.

A good  film with a solid plot and good acting. I am not a Cruise fan (on or off screen) but the man knows how to pull off a movie like this. Does the man age at all? Excellent camera and special effects. All in all, an enjoyable competent film.
I loved this movie. Tom Cruise may be crazy, but he can act. The story was great and the images were hauntingly beautiful. I also love listening to the soundtrack while I'm working.
This movie was excellent.  I'm not the biggest Tom Cruise fan, but I enjoyed this move.  Its intricate plot will separate it from others.

My son talk me into watching this movie it was good and the acting was good, you really have to watch and pay attention to understand it, which I find hard to do at times, still not sure if I understand the movie.

It was a good overall movie. Had a few twists & turns that were unexpected.
Is it for the die hard sci-fi person, maybe not but was an interesting two hours.
I thought that this movie drug on a little bit. They defiantly could have edited this movie to be about 45 minutes shorter.
The surprise element is FANTASTIC!!!! This movie was a LOT of fun though the ending was less than believable.  Better than critics grade it if you enjoy Sci-Fi and are imaginative.
This film will have you guessing for while. At first, you think that - okay, we lost Planet Earth, but we won the war. Or, did we?? Tom Cruise fans will really love this movie. I did!
Meh.. Good graphics, predictable and a little cheesy at times, I feel like I have seen it before in some way.
It is what I ordered  what else can  I say  we wanted the movie and now we have it  Ok ?
really cool new age movie with tom cruise, desert scenes and old ruins made it cool. some good twists that make it interesting, overall a 4 star movie
Feels like there could of been more behind it. Maybe a better explanation to it than what was told. Slow to the point.
Better than some others of its kind.  It was kind of hard to completely follow until the almost the end.

This is an action filled si-fi movie staring Tom Cruise. There are a few good surprises and a lot of adventure. Tom Cruise is good, but it is Morgan Freeman who plays an excellent role and makes this the outstanding movie that it is.

I expected more based on the cast.  What a fantastic cast!  Sadly, if you've seen the trailers, you've seen all the good scenes and it isn't difficult to guess how it ends.  It was eye candy, but lacking otherwise.

I just watched this movie on Blu-ray, and I was very, very impressed. Visually speaking, this is the type of Blu-ray that makes me lean forward in my seat, the sights are so eye-popping. The rendering of a post-apocalyptic earth afflicted by nuclear winter is strangely beautiful, as is the way in which the story is presented. Those who dislike Tom Cruise will not be able to move past his presence (he is in virtually every frame of this two hour movie), but for those who are interested in a unique, mind-bending sci-fi spectacular... you are in for a treat!
The DVD arrive quickly and was very inexpensive.  The rental version lacked special features but that was not a big issue for me.  Now I know for the next time.

I am a big fan of Tom Cruise. This is going to be my Thanksgiving day movie.
My guests are going to really enjoy it. Would recommend it for family viewing.

I really do feel that the critics, who reviewed and did not like this movie, don't like science fiction to begin with. If that's the case, stick with your "period" films and "drunk weekend" pics.

This movie was great from start to finish, special effects are really good and I felt the story was a very good one and did not get lost in the array of eye popping effects. I'm not a big Tom Cruise fan but he did a great job as did the other actors in this film. Glad I bought this to include in my large DVD library.
Not as good as I was expecting.  tom Cruise is verytalented, but this was not one of his best movies.
cool. . . this movie was good.  the story was new and the characters were interesting.  only negatives was that we didn't get to meet the aliens. . . oh well

As a fan of Tom Cruise, I wasn't all that impressed with his performance in Oblivion.  The acting in general seemed to be sub-par from what I would expect for a movie he is in.  The plot was decent, but wasn't anything too exciting...most of it was predictable.  The visuals and special effects were well done, and the drones were pretty neat.  However, a sub-par plot and mediocre acting made me give this one 3 stars.  I'd wait for it to come on Netflix.

If you like sci-fi then this is for you.
Set in the future, it really made me think what the planet will be like then.
plot needs a little more work.  We love Morgan Freeman. It has a good ending... a bit rushed but a good ending just the same.

This film relays heavily on an intriguing story line. This approach works well - you are around half way through the film before you can really start to understand what is going on and have a feel for the plot line. This movie doesn't move particularly quickly, and the slow methodical approach defines the film. The graphics and the world they create are pretty incredible. Despite the graphics and special effects the winding plot makes the movie more thought provoking than many post apocalyptic Sci-fi type movies. I enjoyed the acting as well. Tom Cruise plays Jack Harper, a repair technician tasked with repairing drones on a largely decimated planet earth. His character evolves the most throughout the film. Morgan Freeman also play and interesting role.

The bottom line is that this was an average film. I enjoyed watching it but I will not be in a hurry to watch again. The plot dragged at times and the ending was not satisfying in my opinion.
Good acting from Tom makes this movie fun to watch. Fun adventure and great story. Epic adventure and a creative story.
I really loved this movie it is a must have for any tom cruise fan out there. All the action and the way they made the movie with nobody hardly out there but few people.
The pace was fast, the story and the actors were great. I enjoyed the movie from the beginning to the end.
I watched it a few weeks ago and cant even remember most of it, the plot was very thin and could have been much better if they didn't try to focus on the "star".

I had a night off and thought "I like to relax and watch the good sci-fi movie".
I found "oblivion" and decided I would give it a shot, but 2 1/2 hours later I regret every minute of it! Don't waste your money on this movie.
This is a movie that I will be watching again very soon. I found it to be entertaining and full of action. I would recommend.
liked the twists and turns in the plot--similar to how I felt after watching "The Lathe of Heaven"--you knew something was wrong, but had no real hint of how truly bad it was.
A well-done but not especially entertaining post-apocalyptic story.  Cruise does fine and the special effects are fantastic, but the plot and dialog are pretty sparse.
Very good movie - lots of action - good surround sound, great scenery!  you really can't go wrong with these 2 fine actors!

Amazon came in with flying colors with easy technology to provide me this movie. Never gave Amazon's service a second thought while watching this movie. That is what everyone wants in their shopping experience (its when we primarily indulge ourselves not anyone else or retailer/Amazon) to have now without any hassles. Sounds selfish, shopping is...shrug. My reasons for not doing it often!

I actually enjoyed this movie despite it having Tom Cruise. It hardly has any Morgan Freeman in it, despite being on the cover as well. But this movie is good speculative sci-fi with characters showing us a story. There's no obvious villain for most of the movie, so some people may find its pacing slow, but it has wonderful layers that it peels back throughout the story.

Minus one star for Tom Cruise.
Not a bad movie, but nothing outstanding either. Nice look and a good idea, but it's just lacking something. Maybe for me it'll be one of those movies that is better the second time I watch it.
It is not your normal end of the World movie.  It is surprisingly good and definitely worth watching at least once.
Great special effects but story line is lame. Ending is a take off from Star Wars "Death Star" Ending. Plot is confusing.
Took two showings to understand, once for us and once for Grand Kids. Special effects pretty good. Seems there was a lack of diction in some scenes.

I enjoyed this movie. Some fun little twists and turns (which open a few little plot holes here and there but no more than in any other sci-fi flick in my opinion).

I though Cruise did a fine job and the CGI and cinematography were top-notch.

Overall, a good rental for an in-home movie night.

I read the reviews online but decided to take a chance. Very much enjoyed the storyline. Could have had more character development but kept me well entertained. Had a Blade Runner feel but the characters were more innocent.
It's Tom Cruise, my wife likes him but he needs a reality check to get the bogus crap out of his films, you know like Daniel Craig.
I liked the concept, as well as the actors.  They did a great job with the theatrical twist and special effects.

Oblivion is an entertaining and visually excellent movie.  The idea behind the movie is reasonably clever, the technology is visually interesting, the actors are top-notch, and the action is generally good.  There's not much to the story but it is well presented and easy to enjoy.  Approach this movie looking to have a good time, not to see an epic sci-fi masterpiece, and you'll be fine.

It's refreshing to see a movie that doesn't feel it needs to blow up every living thing in order to hold your attention. This movie is strikingly beautiful at times. Enjoyable in it's simplicity.

Is it a flawless script, or a masterpiece? No. Are there are times you may say... yeah I've seen this before, yes... but it's been so long. Enjoyable and beautiful. I highly recommend seeing this on a large screen with popcorn and a moment to take it all in. Clean and crisp visuals leave you thinking about this world and it's imagery long after the movie.

I gave it 5 stars because I really enjoyed it and my time away. Is it really a 5 star movie? No, but judge for yourself. It's well worth a watch if you don't mind a slow movie. Enjoy!
Entertaining but there were moments I didn't follow the story too well. I didn't really care for the character as the story went on.
Great movie! I wanted to watch it again after seeing it the first time. Visuals are stunning, great scifi story.
Cruise delivers a star performance as expected. He never gives any less. It's all here: great story, action and the unexpected. Great sci-fi.  Recommended watch.
Very good a definite watch. Acting an story are top notch. Probably one of the bettet sci fi films I've seen this year.

I think this is one of the best Sci-Fi movies I have seen in a long time. There are a lot of different influences in this film, but I think they did a good job incorporating those influences for a compelling story with fabulous shoots of scenes and locations.
The movie was fragmented and the dialog was heard to hear.  Tom Cruise is far from my favorite actor or person.

I enjoyed it a lot not much more to say other than that. It's not a movie short on emotion or dialogue which is unique to find in a modern day holywood Sci-Fi flicks that usually have shallow plots with CGI galore. This movie is colorful and beautiful in comparison to the usually dark and sepia toned post apocalyptic movies.
My son and I enjoyed this.  Well made movie, good acting, good story, good graphics, enough suspense to make you think a bit.
Nope not really digging this movie... about half way through realize you've been duped into something completely unforseen with no way of possibly coming to that conclusion on your own

Despite some of the bad reviews, this movie is good enough for a second or third watch.  One, to have a better understanding of the plot. You need to listen to everthing that Jack (Cruise) narrates to understand what happens at the end and why everything is not what it seems.  Two, the plot is good, it is original story with some likeness to other scifi with similar apocalytic last person or people on Earth plot.  However, I had not seen this story repeated in another movie.  You don't have to be a sci-fi or Tom cruise fan to like this one. What I do like about this movie is that its not about the origins of man like other sci-fi movies of the past decade. Oh, Morgan Freeman, enough said.  :-)

I just can't say enough about this movie.. And couple that with the fact that I'm not a huge Tom Cruise fan and I think that Morgan Freeman phoned it in and is currently over-saturating celluloid.
I think that it's just a combination of all things comprising the whole which knocks my socks off. I love the minimalist art design, The muted colors of the environment and the structures create a unified colour scheme that helps to bind The imagery to a common thematic thread.  And while it does have this mono-chromatic feel, It never comes across as forced, but rather the natural result of the devastation left behind and the soulless reconstruction of the 'man-made' structures. And the cinematography beautifully and deftly aids in its execution.
I found the story both fascinating and quick to get its point across without becoming a clich action movie.
The direction was spot on and flowed perfectly.
And last but not least the music by M83 perfected what was an already visually beautiful film.

If I had to give one very minor nitpick it would be that the whole human underground subplot felt like it wasn't as smoothly incorporated into the film as it's other elements.

I'll even swallow a little pride and say that Tom Cruise pulled off a brilliantly understated yet very convincing performance.
 Not that it has anything to do with anything at the end of the day, but I hear that he was served his divorce papers if not at least signing them while he was on the shoot. Nothing like a cold, hard shot of reality to temper an actors performance. In my book, the man's stock raised quite a few points from the bottom where it had come to rest over the last few years.
I've heard rumors of people Coming away from this movie with ideas that it is purveying a Scientology dogma, if not in a subtle metaphorical way. I didn't see that at all but then I don't think I had any kind of agenda going in except to enjoy what looked to be like a really good movie. I think that this observation ,in many instances came from people going in ultra-aware of Mr Cruis' past with the dubious organization. Idk.

All I can say at the end of the day, is that in my opinion,  this was a fantastic science-fiction movie with a great story, great imagery, fantastic music and very competent acting. Directed in such a way that the movie seemed to end almost as soon as it had begun, as it was such a blast of a ride.
Enjoyed this film. While not fantastic, it was solid in plot and acting. I don't make a habit of picking apart films like this. It wasn't claiming to much and it fulfilled my expectations.
A Tom Cruise si-fi action movie about earth in the future that he has to save. The special effects are excellent. Good supporting cast.
Very entertaining action movie. I would have gave 5 stars but it was a little hard for me to follow in places.
everything was great about it...from shipping to the movie itself...u won't be wasting your money! Tom cruise and morgan freeman are really great actors

A couple of things that stood out:

Several times throughout watching the movie, I caught myself admiring the continous ambient music. The background music and gorgeous scenes blend together and perfectly enhance the dystopian / dream like feel of the movie. I also really enjoyed watching a movie without the blood and gore we usually see in SF movies these days. The only thing that did not convince me was the idea that Jack's clones were used as a ground attack force. Made little sense. The machine with the drone technology and anti-gravitational devices may need Jack to keep everything in place, but to conquer the planet? Extra points for mentioning the Roman story of Horatio!

I enjoyed this much more than I expected to given it's average review scores. I wonder if people expect a certain type of movie with Tom Cruise and are disappointed to find that this movie is a bit more thoughtful than they expected?

This was a nice surprise.

The movie "Oblivion" is a great movie to relax with if you are a post-apocalyptic science fiction fan. It starts out appearing as a story about a man/woman salvage team trying to gather resources from the destroyed earth to take with them to their satellite home where the last of humanity lives and then going to one of Jupiter's moons to restart civilization.  However appearances can be deceiving and it turns out that the world is not what it seems and they are not what they seem.  As the story goes on many secrets are revealed as to how the world was devastated and how Jack Harper (Tom Cruise) was involved in it.  I enjoyed the special effects and the action but one thing  made the film less enjoyable to me.  It was obvious at a certain point how the plot was going to resolve itself and the required happy ending was not that satisfying.  Still, it's a good flick and I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys this film genre.

This movie is a sleeper.  When you first watch it, you will find the catch to be something you would not have considered.  I have seen this movie at least 30 times and have found some small nuance I had missed before every time I watch it.  From awe inspiring landscape to the great acting, you have the feeling that you are there.  This is not a movie that you want to miss.
I don't think this futuristic action-movie got great reviews when it came out, but I just watched it and thought it was really pretty good.  And my neighbors borrowed it and liked it a lot too.
Enjoyed and watched again after all was made 'clear' at the end.  What's not to like about the 2 headliners.
Reminded me of the older Sci-Fi I used to read in short stories years ago. Well done movie, good actors.
this movie reminded me of the Matrix with a lot of sifi, it was good but I would not rent it over
I lived the movie.  Had an interesting plot and some twists I didn't expect.  Great actors in the movie.  If you like Morgan Freeman and Tom Cruise you will like this movie.
It was entertaining, but pretty predictable.  One of those grand, sweeping movies, that tries to cover too much, so there is little depth.
I just don't like the movie.. I feel like I seen movies like that before.. Tom cruise it a pleasure seeing him on screen.. It just didn't cut it for me..
Although the story is not perfect, it was a fun movie to watch. Very entertaining, fast-paced, action packed movie. HD a must.

15 mintues into the film both my wife and I had taken out our laptops and were looking at other things. I eventually fell asleep. When I asked her what happened, she was able to summarize the plot in under a minute.

Not the movie you want to watch tonight. Have you seen Gattaca recently? That was a good film.

I'm writing this review, with one star, to express my displeasure at the production company. I rented this movie from red box. I thought it was decent, nothing all that special, but still wanted to check out the commentary and deleted scenes. The production company made a special "rented" version that does not allow for the viewing of special features. How selfish have studios become that they force you to spend $20 on a movie you have already paid for for a single viewing? I found that to be incredible ridiculous and I hope my review will be just enough to knock that rating down for this movie. Did they honestly think that people would rush out to buy a copy just to get Tom Cruise's opinion on a scene and see a few deleted scenes?
One of the few films Cruise has made that actually has some merit in both acting and story line.  A true purist film.

Just too many things that made us all laugh and say some line from the matrix. We talked alot during this film which is something I usually do not allow but, we couldn't help it. I liked Brads Z movie much better and I don't like zombie movies.
Movie was visually striking but very predictable.  I think Tom Cruise does a great job with what he's given.  Fun movie.
none, new movie to lazy to rent it, plus they closed the local Blockbuster. Point and click, God is he lazy.lol
a twist on an old plot. acting average.somewhat light on giving the background that led to the factions left behind
Another payday for Cruise. He surrounds  himself with women nearly 1/2 his age, fast motorcycle, few body closeups, 95 percent of the dialogue, and shoot'em up, stunts. ....mind waster.
I can usually see twists coming and guess endings but this one caught me by surprise, a pleasant surprise. I enjoyed it and even watched it a second time that same day.,
Movie was weak, but nice eye-candy on a big screen.  If I had been the producer I would have gone with cheaper talent since the characters don't receive any development anyway.
Special effects were totally awesome.  Story line kept you guessing all the way through.  It was well worth the purchase.
Overly complicated, with poor acting and a weird story line. I would not recommend this movie to anyone. Watch something else.

Oblivion is a good science fiction flick, but not a great one. The plot twists are predictable, but the action is good and the story is interesting. If you are looking for a science fiction flick and are willing to ignore the plot holes, check it out.

To be honest, I like most sci-fi action flicks.  I especially enjoy ones with strange or unexpected twists.  Throw in one of my favorite actors (Morgan Freeman) and really what is there not to enjoy.  This was a fun movie.

This is a rip off of The Matrix trilogy!

Jack = Neo
Beech = Morpheus
Julia = Trinity
drones = sentinels
Scavs live underground = people who live in the underground city of Zion
Beech tells Jack what really happened to humanity = Morpheus tells Neo what really happened to humanity
triangle ship in space holds countless pods of clones = machine city has countless pods of humans
Jack goes to the triangle ship to save humanity = Neo goes to Machine City to save humanity
Jack flies a machine that runs on a form of electricity = Neo flies in The Nebechanezzar (hope I spelled it right)
Jack and Julia fly through a thunderstorm to get away from the drones = Neo and Trinity fly through a thunderstorm to get away from the sentinels
Sally is the machine with a human voice that controls the drones = The Source is the machine with a human voice that controls sentinels

The visual effects are great but there's just too many similarities to The Matrix trilogy for me to recommend this movie.

Cruise delivers yet another Science Fiction masterpiece! However this time, its his best. Oblivion centers around a mop up crew awaiting to go "home" when Jack Harper (Cruise) begins to unravel the truth. I highly recommend this film it is arguably the best science fiction film of the year only behind (Gravity). A must watch for Cruise or Science Fiction fans.

One of the reasons I bought Oblivion, which I had already seen when it came out on Red Box, was the M83 isolated score. So after watching the movie I enable the isolated score and after a few seconds it makes a noise and disappears, and the receiver is showing that is not receiving any signal. Then it comes back, but it goes away after a few seconds, and as far as I can tell, it's like that throughout the disc.

I don't have a cheap Walmart $30 player, I have a Sony BDP-S5100 that has no problem with any other disc. Evidently whoever authored this disc didn't do a minimum of quality control. It doesn't seem to me like the disc itself has a manufacturing problem, or I would have had problems playing the movie itself.

This is pathetic, how can Paramount release a Blu-ray where it promises a bonus feature that it doesn't deliver? Especially ruin what is an otherwise flawless movie.

"Oblivion" offers a post-apocalyptic future far more devastating and terrifying than the zombie apocalypse:  thousands of Tom Cruise clones have over-run the earth.

Tom Cruise will be a forever mediocre actor, whose shortness of theatrical range and physical height limit every movie he's in.  But what's undeniable is that "Oblivion" is a clever -- if totally preposterous -- story that is helmed by an inexperienced but excellent director.

I'd heard many terrible things about this film before watching it, almost enough to make me not bother, but I'm a sucker for sci-fi blockbusters so I gave it a try. The good news is that it's not a bad as I'd heard, the bad news is that while it's reasonably entertaining it's far from a good film.

At its heart this is an Independence Day type of affair and while it tries to take itself more seriously any purists watching it would be cursing the poor science of it. Unfortunately it's not as much fun as Independence Day either, however it's more modern visual effects do provide some stunning scenes.

The story is simple, aliens attack Earth and are beaten off with a nuclear attack that irradiates vast regions of Earth, rendering it unihabitable. Most of the survivors ship of to a colony at Titan, but two stay behind to protect essential assets needed to support the far off colony. Remnents of the invading aliens still survive on the Earth's surface and are trying to hamper the operation.

Things aren't quite what they seem and the story really unfolds from there. It's fairly predictable as to where the story is heading, but the journey isn't too bad. The cast all do a reasonable job with their roles, but there's nothing inspired about any of it. It's a sci-fi blockbuster that goes through the motions, an ok watch, but nothing more.

I was not sure that this movie would be any good but I was surprised that it was actually pretty good.  We had family members of several different ages watch this and everyone liked it.  It is a low budget but fun to watch
I very much enjoyed this movie. Tom Cruise may be crazy in real life but always delivers as a great actor.

I'm a (non-diehard) Sci-Fi fan, but have gotten extremely gun shy since there's so much bad Sci-Fi out there these days. I actually left this one in the player for about two weeks before I resigned myself to watching it - I shouldn't have waited so long!

Some folks complain "the story was slow" - I think the operative word here is STORY (it actually has one)!
It was refreshing to see a well made movie in which the special effects contribute / go hand in hand with the story, instead of simply trying to overwhelm you with what can be done with CGI, and overloading your senses in the process.

BTW-his flying contraption was pretty darn cool!

If you think it's slow, simply watch when you're in the mood for something "slow (er)".
Personally, I didn't think it that slow (enough action and edge of the seat scenes), but if you're simply looking for an overloaded CGI smashfest, mebbe so?

It also has a good soundtrack, which is always a bonus.
This Blu-ray looks really good. The Story was a little slow but I still enjoyed It. It's a good popcorn movie

Another great perfomance of  Tom Cruise and the other actors, with beautiful architects designs and very creative machines .
a lot of fun and imagination
Good Flick: Good action film in tradition of the Twilight Zone.  The DVD is such a good copy, I doubt if there is a need to buy the Blue Ray.

It is hard to nail down where this movie went wrong; you have A list actors, a great story line potential, what looks like a great budget - and nothing comes together.

SPOILER ALERT:
Story Line:  Its hard to tell a good story within the attention span of most people today, but the ending of this movie was so predictable that a 3 year old would have demanded their money back.  I mean seriously; this is the best you can come up with?  Next time hire a 6th grader to polish off the ending, at least they could have through up something 'as good.'

Actors / Talent : I hate projecting 'roles' on actors, but in all reality we expect things from certain actors - I will admit they can surprise us and do other things well, we just didn't know, but it is a rare surprise as well.  Tom Cruise as a cowboy space jockey just didn't work - just drive a stake through my chest, it would have been more entertaining.  Morgan Freeman was almost believable in his role, but once he tried to be the action hero guy he fell on his face as well.  The 'female' talent was obviously selected for the T&A bling quality of who will show the most.  The rest of the forgettable cast we never got to know enough to care that they were wiped out.

Visuals: Of course a talented CGI department and great camera's are about all you need now a-days to pull of great looks; there is no real disappointment with that in this one.  Huge ocean sucking reactors and flying space drones were about the best part of the movie: but that can only eat up so much time.

If they had spent as much money on the writers as they did on the rest of the crew to make this movie, they may have made something worth watching - but given the chance to watch this movie again; I will hit TV-Land for a rerun of Captain Kangaroo.

I really liked this film; The critics have said there was nothing new and that it had all been done before one way or another....which may be true but the quality of the production; the timing of the disclosers; the movement of the film; the soundtrack the visuals and the ability of the actors to bring out emotional reaction with very little dialog involved...was superb...The timing in the film is excellent and comes across smooth as glass...which is enhanced by the visuals and music. The one part in the film that I thought production timing broke down was where Jack and Julia were at the cabin and A Whiter Shade of Pale starts playing in the background...I thought that Julia should have looked a little more sheepish and guilty and Jack a little more regretful and insecure but otherwise I thought it was a good choice of music and songs. This movie should be used in Film class to show how Visuals; Music and timing can enhance an otherwise mediocre script for a movie and make it come out great and spectacular..Also I was very impressed with most of the acting involved particularly Andrea Risenbough who I thought played her character to a tee...You really need to see this movie in Blu Ray with a high quality surround system and as large a screen as possible to experience this movie as its meant to be seen..watching this movie on your I-phone is just not going to give you the experience that you need in order to evaluate this movie correctly....if the critics had loved this movie and given it praise I might have only given it a four start or three star rating; but because The critics had given it such a low rating I was shocked when I finally saw the film and was drawn in...I had to get this movie hence this review on the Blu Ray....

I was very pleasantly surprised at how good this was...  it did not have the normal idiotic pandering to the masses that the normal sci-fi's do. Which is why it probably got a lot of bad reviews by Sheople. If you want a good solid movie that actually follows a story line and the science stays in the bounds of believable, then watch this. You are in for a treat. Might even bring out a tear or two by the end...
This movie really flew under the radar but it is definitely worth checking out.  A rare uplifting movie in the post apocalyptic sci-fi genre with a positive message. Check it out.
I was not a fan of this movie, it just wasn't what I was hoping for. I was expecting some more action, interesting plot, could have been done better.
I liked this movie. I thought it had an interesting point of view and I even liked how it ended.
What an exciting and simply escalating suspense/Sci Fi movie!  If you want to watch a movie that will keep you at the edge of your chair and wanting more?  This is the one!

I had to watch it twice to understand the plot, but interesting sic if movie.  If you are looking for plausibility for get this movie.  If you want a mind bender that will have you researching questions about the movie on the web this is for you
The only interesting thing about this movie was knowing that he was filming it when Katie Holmes devised her brilliant scheme to leave him.  Now THAT'S the kind of movie I WOULD LOVE to see.

Definitely a cool twist. Tom Cruise does a good job, as always in these types of movies. That man sure can run! Lots of good action scenes, and some good uestions at the end on identity and existence.
The movie was great, very entertaining, enjoyed the special effects.  The combination of Freeman and Cruise made this movie.  I will see it again.

Yes, this is another post apocolyptic movie. But do not under estimate this movie, if you are a scifi fan like myself, just be patient.

The story takes place 60 years after earth demise, aliens invaded the planet leaving the human race hanging by a thread. It may not seem like it but the humans won the war.  Tom Cruise character is joined by his girlfriend and coworker as the two remaining human on earth to rid the planet of lingering aliens.

While Cruise is left on his bounty hunting expedentions his gal pal is left at the home base watching a far, until Cruise discovers the truth.

This movie is extremely scifi!! But this is a HUGE twist that will draw you into the movie even more.

Good movie!!
Thought provoking movie, with good plot, & cool action.  My whole family liked it.  Not too intense for kids either.
It is difficult to follow the line of the story....movie is only based on visual effects. Not relevant to my taste.
Visual arts are great! But the end kind of stumps people. I like how the movie applied mystery with the Sci-Fi atmosphere
The movie was slow moving & boring. Wasn't near the action I had expected for the duration of the film. Plot was feasible.
This is one that was a surprise when you got it! Enjoyed it. Started slow but then it seemed like the movie was over picked up fast.

The other day I was placing an order for the new 3d movies and came across this. No, it's not in 3d (too bad) but it was shown with them and not knowing anything about it and given it's star power, I said "give it a try". Glad I did. What a surprise. At first I thought it was just a big and beautiful version of a movie I had seen about ten times, then something happened. It changed. It became a different movie. It might not be the most original Sci Fi (not the channel) movie I've seen, but, it's close. It's a shocker and it's haunting and will leave you thinking long after it's done. Think Waterworld meets Moon meets The Twilight Zone. It's so cool and what a music track! Buy it, rent it, see it. You'll be glad you did.
This movie really grew on me with multiple viewings. Little details really add a lot as the script is quite lean. Beautiful visuals and excellent performances. It takes on a very dreamlike quality.

To me the film is worth a five for the final third.  I maybe should have given it a 5, because without the first 2/3's you cannot get to the very satisfied ending.  Tom Cruise puts in another good performance with great physical stunts.  Plenty of action and twists that keep you anticipating other results which you do not expect.  Great premise and unexpected results.  The movie proves that humans are unpredictable.
Very good SYFY doomsday movie with a twist. Very good special effects. The movie was visually stunning. Tom Cruise is a very good actor and does most of his own stunts.

Great film. Stunning cinematography with a compelling premise. Excellent acting from a great cast. And a beautiful soundtrack to complement the sleek visual effects. Entertaining and informative behind the scenes extras. This edition comes with nicer case artwork than the stock seen in most stores.

Pretty bad but not true bottom of the barrel. As usual in any Cruise movie has uncomfortable traces of Scientology weirdness throughout (lost memory engrams, for example) but these can be ignored. The movie could have been 1/2 hour long. Has some nice aspects but redundant. Cruise is as good as the role allows him to be. Good muscles. Babes=B+.
Think of the worst movie you have ever seen.....buy that one...you'll be happier, and won't miss a thing. It is bad
This is one of the blu rays that I was honored to add to my collection.  Action packed and full of excitement.
the plot is obtuse, good special effects tho, i don't think i would recommend this movie to anyone, not a fav of mine

***NOT FULL SCREEN HDTV VIDEO***This Blue Ray DVD does not fill your entire screen leaving black bars on the top and bottom of your screen. It is my understanding all Blue Rays are 1080p which would naturally fill your entire screen and serve as the current standard in Blue Ray quality. I instead received an inferior blue ray product that will not fill my entire screen on a 2012 Samsung PN64E8000 3D HDTV as though it were formatted for 720p pixel resolution or less. I also used a 2013 Sony BDPS7903D Blue Ray player which was also formatted properly. This Oblivion Blue Ray purchase is not True High Definition as per today's standards. This is a 2013 movie so apparently the Blue Ray provider did not think filling up your entire screen was important. When I called Amazon to complain about this conundrum, the customer service representative was courteous but she had never heard of this problem, but I let her know in detail, how my HDTV screen and player was formatted correctly and that other Blue Rays perform fine but not this Oblivion Blue Ray. I don't think it is a defect because I found another Oblivion movie version advertised on Amazon with the letters "HD" printed at the top of it's Blue Ray jacket. I suspect some kind of fraud by the Blue Ray manufacturer until I get a full explanation from someone. Amazon did offer to look into the matter but Amazon never contacted me back on this. Maybe the truth was too costly for so many inferior Blue Rays that were produced. I don't know...Tim L Thornton Springfield, IL
Unfortunately the movie was unable to be viewed and would not download. Unable to receive credit for purchase_-paid for nothing-very disappointing trying to view while traveling.

Loved this movie...from the great special effects to the ending twist, which I did NOT see coming.  Visually a treat to watch, and a good story.  Wish Amazon would sell it for a reasonable price, though.
I normally don't like tom cruise but I say let me see if this movie any good because Morgan freeman is Also in this movie,gabbage,hate it!
In the beginning it was boring and then Was good on the end just needed more action otherwise was a good movie  I enjoyed it
just a love story disguised as a sci-fy movie. Good twist, but predictable toward the end. I would suggest it.

The ads featured Morgan Freeman with a significant presence. In the movie he's a seldom used afterthought. The movie has little to offer. The story could have been rendered better, but whoever is responsible for that decided to bore it down. If you like real boring movies, this is it. Otherwise, it's not worth five bucks and two hours of your time.

This movie is a success on many levels.
It's visually attractive. It has an engaging plot. It drops you right into the grinder just when you were getting comfy.
I like it.

Like sci fi and watch what I can - I chose this over the bad reviews for After Earth. I liked the visuals for this. Kept me watching. Not sure if I understood the thing off of earth. And had several questions that left me hanging.

I liked the movie and my wife liked it to when we saw it at the movies. I bought it so I could watch it at home in more comfortable
surroundings.
The story had an interesting ending- not at all expected. Lots of action and decent effects. Just typical high ego Tom stuff.

Creative story idea.  Tom again, but he isn't a bad actor.  Plot presents complex thought for thinkers and the shooting and space flight entertained those watching for a brain vacation.  Acceptable, but just a bit lacking.
Loved this movie, I have never watched a movie of this type without appreciating it to the fullest. I hope this genre never dies out and continues forever.
Loved this movie!  Watched it several times to pick up all the information and nuances.  Not usually a Tom Cruise fan, but this movie was really good.
not worth paying money for..worth watching for free..jumped around a lot, didn't make sense, and then it became very predictable..
This movie was different than I thought and in a good way had me wondering what was going on until the very end.  It was very good and recommend it for a family to watch.

This movie came highly recommended so I rented/purchased it as soon as it became available online.  While the action was strong and the acting solid, the concept floundered towards the middle.  At times I felt as if I were watching a high tech version of Legend (Will Smith) but in the end, the antagonizing force left a bit to be desired.  I would place it somewhere between iRobot and Legend for quality and watchability.  For true Tom Cruise fans, this is a decent watch.  For Morgan Freeman fans, you'd be better served by punching yourself.
Got to really pay attention when you first watch it or you won't understand the movie . Tom Cruise was good in this movie . Must see if you like sci-fi.

With all the different Sci-fi movies out there I was not interested in seeing this at all.  I was however surprised by the plot and different direction it took.  That was truly refreshing.  Plus I love Morgan Freeman.
really good and fun to watch...my 12 year old son loved it!! and he will watch again, and again....good movie!!

I enjoy sci-fi movies and I thought this movie had a good premise (although a bit of a Matrix ripoff with the growing of clones as tools for the aliens' use).  Tom Cruise was his usual self; you know what you're going to get with him. Morgan Freeman seemed to be tossed in for his name. His role was pretty small. I thought the human opposition forces could have been developed more fully. All-in-all, I enjoyed the movie. Nothing spectacular but better than most movies out there.
Gotta love this style of movie. I just have a hard time seeing Tom Cruise as a hero that saves humanity. The twists are neat and the movie is nail biting in a few spots.
Tom Cruise his usual character; Olga just beautiful, and the other girl not bad to look at. Standard sci fi story except for the cloning. Written and acted well. Just a good tight movie.

Is a very good move.

Was not expecting much from this movie with all the drama surrounding Tom Cruise's personal life but
I have to say that this was a very good movie and the acting was very good.

Story line and special effects were very good.

Very original story line.

Highly reccomend this movie to watch
I like syfy movie almost i watched all movies,  but this is Very slow movie, .....you can sleep confortable all movie and almost nothing happen..dont loose your money, in 2013 there are better movies
theres a lot of talking and I love action packed movies the movie is confusing as well but it is entertaining I guess

This is really an easy watch Tom Cruise movie, plot's not real deep and the action is good but not your typical non stop action. The science is believable and the plot twists are pretty good - it leaves you smiling! The cinematography (can't believe I used that word) is outstanding, very visually pleasing and it also has a great sound track as well - sample it here on Amazon.  No blood or gore, not scary or thrilling, just a good down to "earth" sci fi movie, that you can watch a couple times.

I really didn't know what to expect with this movie.  If Morgan Freeman is in it, it has got to be good, right?  Damn right is was.  The special effects in the movie are the best I have ever seen, they are mind blowing.  And if you want a surprise, well, this has the surprise of all surprises. BAM!
Despite a very slow start and a few stupid chase scenes, this is a good story that ends well.  Even Tom Cruise couldn't screw up this film.

This movie is tasteless, and boring. If you have seen the amazing film Moon you'll instantly recognize that this movie stole the biggest plot twist in the movie DIRECTLY from Moon. They didn't even hide it, at all. Then for some good measure sprinkled Independence Day in. The acting is terrible, the effects are just polishing a poorly written turd. Just do yourself a favor and watch Moon first if you somehow read this before watching this horribly unoriginal garbage.

This was a visually beautiful movie but confusing for me. I never quite figured out exactly what was happening and why.
Still it's worth renting if not buying.
I am a lover of sci fi movies but almost always end up disappointed. This one was a little confusing and probably a bit long. But worth a watch.
It's been a while since I have seen such a well made science fiction movie.  Great Job.  Good acting. Great feel!
this is a great tom cruise film this is a 5 star. i like everything in the dvd. i would recommend this to everybody. thank you.
great movie I don't usually rate movies but this one was great I recommend watching it if you like that kind of movie

You know something is wrong, but you don't know what.  Then you figure out what, but you don't know how. Lots of delightful twists and turns. Great cinematography and effects. Good acting. Enjoyable right through to the last scene.

Several scenes pay homage to other Sci-fi Classics, but I will let you figure those out for yourself.

I knew the ending of this horribad movie in the first 5 minutes. The Inception/Tron music didn't even help this movie to pretend to be a blockbuster. I didn't care about the characters whether they lived and died.  Moon is a much better movie.
I would give this movie an 8.5 out of 10.  Visually stunning!  Acting is strong but the story is a little weak.
Saw this at the theater & knew I had to have it. DVD was in great shape. Product was as expected.
It's good a good movie, normal Tom Cruise action with good looking leading ladies. Can't go wrong with that combination.
The only element of the movie that was good were the computer graphics, but that was the only gem in this otherwise self absorbed Tom Cruise narcissistic flick.
Not really much to say, other than it is okay. Kinda interesting plot. Of course anything with Morgan Freeman in it is worth watching, but he has a rather small role.

I bought this movie expecting it to be good considering the actors involved, alas it failed to impress me. Every "plot twist" I called before it was revealed, and I'm not the type of person that is able to do that very often (I didn't figure out the twist in "The Sixth Sense" until that was revealed). Now in no way do I fault the actors for this, I think they did the best they could for the script that was handed to them. The visuals in this movie were BY FAR the best part, they were amazing. However it doesn't quite make up for the lack of depth in the story for some very important parts of the movie and for the tedious manner in which they showed other less important parts.

I'm still trying to decide if I keep this movie or give it to someone that is only interested in how visually stunning the movie was...
Long and drawn out. Husband lost interest early on. I stuck it out but was disappointed. I expected better with these actors.

The visual effects in this movie were really well done.  The story line was pretty cool, without giving anything away I have seen a similar story made before.  That being said I still think this movie was well worth the rental, I would have even paid to seen the film in the theatre, although I don't see myself watching this film over and over throughout the years and nothing about it really blew me away, again though, this was a good movie and well worth the watch.
Tom Cruise does a great a great job in the film, very typical Tom Cruise action hero role for him.  Small role for Morgan Freeman but his delivers his quintessential Morgan Freeman speech and looks cool in the movie.

The movie had a lot of plot twist.  Was hard to follow at first but the movie came together nicely at the end.  The movie seemed like it moved along too slowly at times.  Not as much action as I thought looking at the reviews.  I am a big Morgan Freeman fan but you were half way through the movie before his 1st appearance.

Didn't like this movie too much. I love the actors, but darn the story was hard to follow and understand why we are here to watch this. Defintely Si-Fi, that's for sure. If you like off the wall crazy un-understandable movies, then you'll love this.
cool movie, typical tom cruise, good watch on a sunday afternoon. not much more to say about it, nice that you have all three versions.
At first it was slow to comprehend what was really happening but it is one of those movies that at the end everything seems to fall into place. Pretty good special effects.
Not bad, watchable , a little boring, not enough, not your regular Tom Cruise movie needed more action for viewer
horrible movie, stupid story line. but since I have to use 15 words or my rating will not appear. Horrible, stupid, stupidly horrible,

The special effects were well done . The plot line is a Little thin and you won't understand the movie until the end. Tom Cruise carries the movie.

The audio and visuals were well done, that's about it. I thought it was unoriginal, incoherent, acting was subpar, story was pretty shallow, music was pretty cheesy. It was a very 'Hollywood' sci-fi movie, just trying to make money off shallow entertainment value. I was disappointed, although I didn't have high expectations. Honestly, this movie was laughable at some points. Teenage boys must have been the target audience.

I had to watch it twice to understand it.  Very good CGI.  Difficult to contemplate the absolute post-apocalyptic deprivation in the face of superior alien technology, including the ability to clone people.  Although some may feel the ending was hopeful, I found it depressing.
I thought it was entertaining. I'm just getting tired of watching Tom Cruise as the tragic anti-hero saving the world from annihilation. Do ya think he could try something else?
Incredible how this movie was made. Worth every penny to buy it on BR.  Watch "the making of oblivion" in extras menu. Minimal CGI used in filming. Love it.
Very fun seeing these two in a movie together.  Neat special effects and great story line.  Liked the ending as well!

Ok maybe its because I've seen thousands of movies and I've been able to figure out what the writers will do (most of the time) - So the story wasn't overly gripping. Aside from the usual lack of common sense and story holes, I think Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman both made this movie better than it would have been if lesser stage presences were used. The special effects were very good and the story itself was Ok. If I've seen a movie in a theater - I will buy the Blu-ray if I loved it (i.e. Star Trek Into Darkness) , I'd probably  watch it on PPV if I really liked it (World War Z) , or not watch it again (i.e. Thousands of movies - Most recently Elysium). In this case - Maybe PPV if nothing else was on.

I've read some rather pointed critique about this film, however I found the film entertaining and although they sometimes "give the plot line away" in still delivers a couple of decent twists and surprises. There are precious few decent sci-fi films today, so against this sad background I found Oblivion to be a refreshing and positive experience. The story is plausible and the pacing is good. Tom Cruise may be a wacky person off-screen but he continues to deliver some very credible performance in exactly the way that Bruce Willis does not (try watching "A Good Day to Die Hard" to see how far Bruce has fallen from his "Twelve Monkeys" days). So kudos to Tom Cruise, the supporting cast, the story, the photography, special effects and the Director for pulling off a complex film. I've watched this film 3 times and it still pleases - few films do that for me. I find techno-trash films like Prometheus to be depressingly stupid - Oblivion was a really nice surprise by comparison.

I remember a reviewer who wrote a very positive review of the Sci Fi film 'Soylent Green' by saying something like 'it's a fine line between campy schlock and a profound film'. Oblivion straddles this line. There's also a fine line between a film that is derivative and one that 'pays homage' to films that have come before it. Oblivion rests there too. There are also one's out there, I suspect, that are not sure what kind of film they want to be. 'Oblivion' resists easy categorization. It has romantic and fantasy elements throughout the film. The viewer never knows where the film is leading to. With Jack Harper's memories being erased, and Earth's past something we grow increasingly unsure of, the events make a good mystery. Oblivion ends up being a feel-good experience of the highest caliber. As loose ends of the film are tied up in improbably ways, the film goes more into a mode of fantasy. As the events become more unbelievable, or at least unlikely, the film becomes more dreamlike. This could seem like a cop-out on the part of the filmmakers, but I enjoyed the film perhaps even more because of it, or because of the way it was done. I've come back to this review *spoilers ahead* and I must ask, how can the film have such an upbeat ending when there's no water left on the Earth? Was the fantasy at the end meant to literally be a dream of a doomed Earthman?

Oblivion reminds me of an old Outer Limits episode titled, 'Hearts and Minds'. An episode where human soldiers find themselves fighting an alien enemy, or at least an enemy they believe to be alien, when in reality they are fighting other humans - other humans who have been led to believe they are fighting an alien enemy. The film makers may have examined this other work of art before crafting this one. The most startling line to me in the film is when Jack Harper is getting ready to fly into the forbidden 'radiation zone' and when asked what he will find one of the humans says to the other, "he will find his destiny". This is obviously taken from the original Planet of the Apes film where one ape asks another what 'Taylor' (Charlton Heston) will find inside the forbidden zone and the ape replies, "he will find his destiny" or simply "His destiny". It's probably the second most memorable line in the film after "Get your paws off me you damn dirty ape". The line makes no sense other than 'go out and find your destiny' until the end of the film or until the second viewing where it becomes obvious that the ape knows in the forbidden zone Taylor will discover he's on planet Earth and his destiny is to be replaced by apes. There was really no need to have a 'forbidden zone' inside the Ape film except perhaps to add mystery to it? It does bring to mind, are the apes so racist they will outlaw travel to half the continent over fears apes will discover they are not the pure 'firsts'? In this film we never really learn what is inside the radiation zones for Jack Harper decides not to go into them other than flying near. One might wonder in hindsight if he would find huddled remnants of a dying humanity but we never discover what is there. For whatever reason, perhaps film length, this is a plot development that goes no where and we are treated with something else to interest us instead.

Oblivion owes it's greatest debt to the recent invasion movie 'Skyline'. One where humans face an impersonal, and really unseen, enemy. An enemy who has us fighting ourselves, in a sense. I think the mimicry of so many of these general human themes or archetypes works out in a good way. The familiarity of the subject matter, combined with the uncertainty of where the film is going, move the audience even more. Notice the uncertain relationship between the subservient Jack Harper (Tom Cruise) and his female superiors, including the female head of NASA, as we are exposed to this film supposedly taking place in the future. It's a mystery for us to ponder. Then we can't help but notice the strong Southern accent of this bureau chief, even as we discover Morgan Freeman is somehow her enemy and we're not yet sure why. We only ever see this one NASA chief, 'Sally', always wondering what is behind her, something that is never really resolved even at the end of the film. Yes, obviously it is not really this NASA chief we are seeing but only a facade set before some kind of alien intelligence that is mimicking her. The most likely guess is that this may be some kind of automated enemy. Certainly a very cold one, at the least. It might be interesting to compare Sally to the computer villain 'HAL 9000' in the film '2001 A Space Odyssey'.

I really liked this film and was moved by it. I give it 9 out of 10 stars. I liked the love affair within the movie, too. I must admit to not being an unbiased viewer.

Would except a little more from a film with Cruise and Freeman, but still a decent Sci Fi movie. Decent special effects and OK story but just not a top notch movie. I enjoyed it, but was left hoping for  a bit better movie.
This was a good movie. I love good science fiction movies and this one did not disappoint me. Not the greatest but ok movie.
Not worth the pixels that illuminate it.  I can't believe after decades of experience and billions of dollars, this is the kind of movie we get from our 'A-listers'.  This is a culture in decline.

Not a big Tom Crues fan and this film did little to fix that. In Tom's Defence the overal film atributes were just as mediocure. Wish it had been better but it was OK. The Twisted ending will leave you thinking.

I really want to like it, but I just can't.  It is like how sometimes you can cook a meal, and all the ingredients are there, but it just comes out disappointing.  Tom Cruise, Morgan Freeman and the special effects are great tools for a director to have access to.  I simply wish that he had an idea of how to use them. We put the movie on at home and forgot it was even on. At no point did it ever grab out attention. Major bummer.
Great story. Great CGI effects. The story moved well with no dull moments. Exciting with just the right amount of tension. Nice mystery with a satisfying ending.

Seriously, the media and it's official movie critics are, as usual, way off. This is a great movie. Don't hesitate on sitting down for 2 hours with your favorite snack to watch this! It's GREAT. My wife wanted to pass it over just because of media movie "experts" and their stupid opinion. She liked it. Just read all the other thousands of likes on amazon.. It's a great movie.
