I like this movie.  I am a huge science fiction fan and this did not disappoint.  But, I had to watch it twice in order to understand the scope of the plot because of the complexity of the story....with much of the explanation of why earth was destroyed and just who the enemy or bad guys were being divulged through dialogue of characters.  It could have been a little more descriptive about the aliens but that being said, I must say I really enjoyed watching the movie....even the second time around.  It was action packed as are most all of Tom Cruise movies and the plot was twisted, which keeps you guessing.  I would recommend this movie to all Science Fiction movie bugs.
good flick, never expected the ending. It kept you guessing who the real villains were. The tech was very interesting, but where did they get seeds at the end?

anyone giving this movie 1 to 2 stars most likely have an iq of about 1 to 2.  its a sci-fi, it doesn't have to make sense!  staring tom cruise...meaning, tom cruise is gonna be in most of the movie!  reading some of the low ratings make me wonder how stupid some people are when it comes to understanding a movie...

the movie is good...watch it...it's only 5 bucks!

As others have said the cinematography is outstanding. Be sure to watch the extras on the DVD/Blu Ray for the authors inspirations for making this movie so visually stunning. Unfortunately the plot is a little thin and there are hints dropped throughout the movie that makes you question what's really going on. By the time we see Morgan Freeman you should have figured out who the scav's really are before there actually revealed. There's a sprinkling of many other sci fi themes in this movie, but I've never seen any movie without their flaws and plot holes. Sometimes you can ignore them, sometime you can't. As stated earlier the real star of this movie are the visuals and special effects. You won't get the complete story until the last 15 minutes of the film so watch it to the end.

There's going to be an Oblivion 2 that will take place before our civilization was destroyed that will offer more answers. From what I've read it going to be a prequel.
Kind of a strange movie, but it is entertaining. Worth it for the out of this world scenery of post apocalyptic earth

My husband and I enjoy sci-fi, and so we enjoyed this post-apocalyptic film, in which Tom Cruise plays a pilot assigned to earth - along with his companion/flight operator/wife - to maintain drones and eradicate any remaining rebels, as the few real survivors of the earth's destruction are now living off-planet. His discovery of a sleeping survivor in a pod crash who, once awakened, claims to have been asleep for 60 years and to have known him before, causes him to question all he once believed. Tom Cruise is excellent - he is best in these intense end-is-near kind of roles - and the images of the destroyed earth are absolutely enthralling in a can't-look-away kind of way. However, the story twists and turns a lot, and we weren't always sure we were exactly following every twist. But it's a good action sci-fi if that's what you are after.

Movie is visually stunning, acting was OK, special effects very good, plot was OK to good, but movie seemed to go on a bit too long. Integrating all this info gives about a 3.5 to 4.0 out of 5 stars. I am a sci fi fan, so I appreciated the rather slow start to this visually arresting movie. The plot is OK, but it does not take long to figure out what's going to happen if you've seen enough sci fi flicks. Special effects were very good also. I found the ending kind of "fakey" and somewhat abrupt however. Would these smart aliens/extra terrestrials/or their intelligence or computer technology not see what's coming ahead of time? After all, they tricked the earth and its people into becoming a wasteland, thereby feeding their technology and energy needs years ago. Overall, it was worthwhile watching. Just slow. Finally, with apologies to Judy Collins, "Send In the Clones".

How can I start this without a bunch of superlatives?

Can''t be done Absolutely perfect transaction

Many Thanks

Gary Mann
Just ok movie...disappointing ending...not worth rental really. Ending was not great. disappointing overall. not recommend. look else ware  bye now

I enjoyed the movie, it had a pretty good plot, good action scenes without being overly violent, some good twists and the special effects were top notch. I wish Hollywood would make more movies like this.
Mildly entertaining. There were times where the story line jumped around too much. It came together at the end to our satisfaction.

Spectacular landscape shots, combined with mimalist living quarters is a nice touch. Overall the acting is good, the plot twists keep you wondering what is going to happen next and the science fiction isn't too hard to follow. Throw in a love story, hope for humanity and it is a good, entertaining movie.

Having seen the movie now, I see some parallels with Stargate with a little bit of Matrix thrown in. There are a few holes once you're done watching the movie and you have time to analyze it. I read some reviews that the movie was too long, but I thought it played out fine.
A futuristic movie that didn't go over that well with me. Pretty much guessed what would happen next and less that mid-way through figured out that the people were being manipulated; but to what end?
A surprisingly good SciFi movie.  Tom Cruise pulls off another good character.  Story line was refreshing and a joy to watch.
A great film for turning on the creative science side of your mind. A lot about this film reminded me to keep thinking. Superb sounds and scenes. Thrills and chills
I like movies with a twist. I assumed the plot just by the trailers but I love the plot twist (no spoilers)

This movie was ridiculous in its premise and did a terrible job with the development of the characters. Apart from the cinematography being stunning, Tom Cruise delivers another self indulgent performance complete with a scene where he fights himself. I feel confident that if the director would have allowed it Tom would have tried to play every part in the movie. All in all way too hard to follow and has a real lack of character(s) you can root for. If sleep is what you need, rent it.
Just boring, seriously wait till it comes out on over the air TV as I doubt movie channels will waste the money on it

Loved the movie!  So much better than I thought it would be, and the ending was great.  I would rent this over and over just to watch.  Action, plot, actors were great.  I am going to buy this one.  Rent it watch it.

The movie had promise.  I wouldn't go as far as to say it was a bad movie, but there were plenty of moments during the movie that could've been shorter or eliminated as they were not necessary...as well as others that SHOULD have been longer that would've helped the story.  Not bad, but predictable and not as good as it could've been.

All I can say is ooopha.. This movie was the epitome of stupid. You would think it would be decent, but no. What was worse is this movie was more expensive than the others. Dont waste your time (2 hrs 15 minuts) or your money.
It was a good movie.  I usually do not like Tom Curise by I have to say it was good.

This movie is over the top visually stunning. The soundtrack from start to finish by M83 Susanne Sundfor is beyond perfect and hauntingly breathtaking. A Great movie for Tom Cruise. The Ukrainian-born actress Olga Konstantinovna Kurylenko as his real wife has the on screen chemistry that makes the movie perfect. A five star surprise. I wish that John Carter or Jupiter Ascending had been cast this well. I went back and changed my original rating from 4 to 5. I have also been playing the entire soundtrack and purchased the DVD. This is the movie that I watch over and over again. What a Classic Science Fiction Movie !
The movies started good and as it progressed it got weird. The part of how his wife still looked 20 as she was lost in space... not my favorite.

I'm not usually a huge Tom Cruise fan but when I saw the trailers for "Oblivion" I knew I'd be watching the movie. I'm so glad I did.

This movie was gorgeous on Blu-ray. Special effects were stunning. I was sitting here during the movie trying to pick out all the Earth sites that I could identify that weren't totally destroyed. Sound quality was super. Subtitling was done well (I'm partially deaf and it makes a huge difference to me in the enjoyment of films I watch).

The storyline was easy to follow, which doesn't always happen in newer sci fi films. There were a lot of twists and turns but I followed them all (or at least I'm pretty sure I did).

This one is a keeper. I'm sure I'll be watching it again.
Good entertainment with action, romance and a twist in the story line that surprised me. I'm not a Tom Cruise fan but this was enjoyable.
It was pretty much what I thought it would be and I enjoyed it. It's not a great SciFi film, but it is good. Worth the $5 rental on Amazon.
I had some concerns from negative reviews but am glad I rented the movie.  Fx awesome for sure and story was a benchmark.

I was really surprised at this movie. I thought it was just gonna be another tom cruise action movie but it turned out to be an original sci-fi movie with a good plot and good actors. I suggest watching it twice because there are a lot of details but it keeps you guessing.
Though the movie wasn't action packed or high suspense, it had a good story line and I did enjoy the unexpected twist.

Similar to other reviews, good special effects (not great) and a theme that seemed all to familiar. I enjoyed it and did not feel like it was a waste of time. So it is recommended but wait until the rent is cheaper or free through Prime.
Visually it is worth watching.  Story wise it's kind of bland and canned like much of what Hollywood churns out.  Glad I watched it on amazon and didn't waste $ on a ticket.
The movie was so bad - I was waiting for Nicholas Cage to show up in a cameo as Oblivion was about the quality of Cage's films these days...
This was definitely not what I expected... the trailer made it out to be a fun scifi action thriller, but it was very drawn out and introspective, with not enough subject matter or plot to be so.
The acting is well done, the soundtrack and effects are impressive, I would recommend it if you want to keep guessing what it's the real evil until the second half of the movie.
This was a good movie.  It is a sci-fi movie.  I will need to watch it again.  But I enjoyed it.
Not my type of movie but very, very well done. There was enough interest to keep me involved. More my husband's genre.
Tom  Cruise is a boss in these types of rolls and Morgan Freeman is the always the man  in any movie!

Certainly there were some unexpected plot twists in this story.  But the post-apocalyptic repression of humanity by a deceptive alien force is certainly not a new scenario.  The movie is totally dependent on special effects to overcome a weak story line.  It falls short.
Not a bad show, definitely worth a watch lots of action little dialog, plot twists. Felt like they could've put more into it but it is what it is.
Great sci-fi movie; could have used some background info; it could have a sequel for sure. Probably in the works.
Really enjoyed the premise of the movie and the way it played out, even if it was slightly predictable for most sci fi fans.

Tom Cruise action movie... you'd trust it would be good, but has his recent stuff been up to par.  Who cares!  Oblivion was original and just down right entertaining.  I loved every second of this action packed sci-fi film.  Enjoy!
Tom cruise always plays great role in anything he does. Great story line and acting. Really keeps you guessing what is going on but clearly explains it by the end.
Again, as a SciFi fan and a Tom Cruise follower, this was not one of my favorite's of his.  It leaves a lot unfinished.
Bad movie.  I was surprised Morgan Freeman and Tom Cruise would be in such a bad movie. I suggest you spend your time and money on something else.
Great movie.  Should have been a hit.  Tom at his best.  The plot was great.  Some twists in there.  Not one of those awful Hollywood movies that are all special effects and no acting or plot.

It's marvelous what ideas can become after watching this movie. The storyline is fabulous the cast did a great job as well,  very convincing and making you feel been involved in it as well. Plenty of on the go action with a few twist and turns to upset the story a bit as to make you think. I rated this an A grade plus for sheer entertainment that keeps you on your toes as to not knowing what is next. The story is out of this world and very different, to explain it's a bit hard as not to give away all its plots so now its up to you to go get it and have a look. Now it's time for a bit of relaxation so put your feet up grab some popcorn and watch a wonderful movie from another world.  Enjoy!

This movie didn't seem to do well in theaters but I was holding out hope it was better than I'd read. I was right, it's a solid science fiction tale with plenty of surprises. Good acting, believable sci/tech, and not too much Tom to make it unbearable.

This was a very well done picture, both graphically along with an interesting storyline, which has a surprise ending. I really enjoyed every minute and found myself putting the long movie on pause just to get a drink, since I didn't want to miss a single scene.  Those of you with high large wide high end monitors will really get a treat with these amazing visuals.  How funny and strange how Earth seemed just as beautiful as before it was destroyed. Highly recommended!

Thanks for reading my review,

Michael

My husband I rented this movie last night.  We were not sure what to expect based on the critic reviews.  We absolutely loved it.  We enjoyed it so much that we watched it twice.  The movie is the complete package....cool story with a twist, great special effects, and a moving music score that completes the ambiance/mood of the movie.  More please!

The movie has a good story line but was a bit predictable. It flowed pretty well other than a few occasions where the plot line muddied a bit. My bet is the cutting room floor holds some of the key elements which would have made it an easier movie to follow for those who aren't into Sci Fi. All in all I watched it twice but didn't/wouldn't buy it after rental.
excellent story, visuals, and music.  blu-ray looked impressive.  there is enough going on to make it worthwhile to watch more than once.

While I'm always reluctant to like a Tom Cruise movie, Oblivion is an extremely well-made, psychological thriller that ranks among the best films I have seen this year.  Set in the year 2077 after Earth has become uninhabitable, Oblivion is visually stunning and has a compelling plot line that held my interest throughout the entire 2-hour drama.  I was also pleasantly surprised by the very limited amount of violence and strong language, since our 6-year old daughter decided to join us on the couch for most of the movie.  All in all, this HD rental was well worth the price and a film I would highly recommend to just about anyone.
There was a lot of action and good special effects.  But I thought the plot was a little weak.  I would recommend it.

Glad I bought this movie! Every time I watch it, I learn something more to helping understand the storyline.  Worth renting as well.  I'm a movie watcher who can watch a good film many times and I'm expecting to watch this a few times anyway.

I've admired Tom Cruise's work for years, his films are always well produced and entertaining. BUT OBLIVION is an aimlessly talky movie which seems purposeless and confusing, TC's acting is fine, though subdued. I wonder if shooting in Iceland froze his typical enthusiasm. Why did he agree to participate in such a pretty yet bland project? I have a theory: TC seems impulsive and on occasion a victim of his own raving enthusiasm. According to OBLIVION's 'Making of' Feature, TC was shown a graphic novel of Oblivion to illustrate the movie's potential/look and was blown away. And so signed on. The graphics he saw were indeed good. As great as the movie isn't. The 'Making of' feature has Cruise and company swooning over the design of eating utensils, chairs, costumes, imagined ships and stations. So, in a decorator haze he must've green-lighted the production. If he saw a script and read it, he must've been glowing in that initial haze, or he fell asleep. Oblivion's plot and Dialogue, in today's parlance, simply suck. Acting is numb and occasionally dumb while the the entertainment quotient slurps. I saw another recent TC film Jack Reacher (Two-Disc Blu-ray/DVD Combo + Digital Copy). It's Great. Smart, sophisticated plot, dialogue, acting and action (TC's martial arts are especially real, good too; sure seemed he was the bad-guy thrasher, no stand-in as far as I saw). I gave it five stars, wishing more stars were allowed. I've seen it three times; (I'm retired from media; study production values. TC's JR film is fine the first time, even better in multiple viewings. See it, you'll see how well it's made... Circuitous + inane = Boring, frustrating and irritating. Pretty pictures though. I hope to find the graphic novel of OBLIVIOUS; er, sorry, OBLIVION.

Plot is rather primitive and movie is just boring more often than not. Tom Cruise is doing his thing which gets old. Both female leads are pretty bad as far as acting goes. If I paid two dollars for HD rental I would give 3 out of 5.
Stunning cinematography and well executed plot - a mood piece that gets under your skin. Would it be as good without the big-name actors? I think so.
it is nice and i used it and i put it to use after I used and its a lot of words 15 lame

While Oblivion had some impressive graphics and filming the storyline was lacking. The movie was very slow and I was expecting a little more action for the way the movie was advertised. Morgan Freeman was pretty much non-existing in the whole movie except for about 2 minutes. It would have been nice to added some more background material about the surviors and the past leading up to the present time of the story. Wasn't much character development at all for any of the major players in the movie. This movie was much hyped and I honestly was let down by the slow pace. Okay movie but I probably would have been better off renting it rather than owning it.

The imagery is somewhat captivating, but the story is thin, and the characters are totally uninteresting.  I never felt any sympathy for any of the characters - it all just relies on special effects.  It is far short of good sci fi movies, and it will be forgotten quickly.  I'm surprised Morgan Freeman signed up for such a weak movie.

Story line was not what I expected but it was a pleasant surprise. Morgan Freeman commands the screen as you would expect him to and even jumps into the action (Go Morgan! Old Guys Rule!) Tom Cruise does a good job and has some solid scenes. Well worth the time and money spent.

Nice special effects. But a familiar twist to story. We've seen this before. Memory and betrayal are always interesting.
Humans destroyed by a superior intelligence we don't get any insight into.

I watched this movie twice because I thought maybe I had slept through a crucial plot point. The movie moves at a confused pace. We take time to digest the broad devastation of our fair planet then we do a quick montage of the "droids" flying at impossible speeds and then slow down again to view the strained relationship of our tech worker and mate. Water is being sucked from the planet at an incredible rate yet there is plenty to create a floating pool for our hero. Said hero states to his "other half" that he thinks the "scavs" want to catch him and then they do. Lo and behold the "scavs" are human. All of a sudden these folk tell our hero they need his help to destroy everything our hero has been protecting and he seems OK with that.
I love Sci-fi, but this one is a head scratcher. There is not enough back story and too much emphases on CGI. The ride of Mr. Cruise on a motorcycle seemed only inserted so we could watch Tom Cruise on a motorcycle. Is it just me or did it seem like an "I feel the need for speed" moment when we saw the sunglasses on the shelf? Then there was the whole flight recorder anomaly, how could it play back data that happened after it was jettisoned? As I said in the headline, the movie is stunning visually, but the story line sucks, and in a few shots, poor Tommy is looking his age. It happens to us all.

Movie in beginning got my attention,"we won the war but lost the planet"  thought it could show what these aliens look like but thats why I give 3 rating, to keep it abstract & cause Tom Cruise & Morgan Freeman chemistry doesn't work out as well as Christian Bale "Batman Begins" only because Tom Cruise of course has to control it, the star of the movie of course, while keeping Morgan Freeman at bay.

At least Tom Cruise is finally figuring it out without a good M83 sound track to go with the movie, I would of it given it a 2 rating. Russell Crowe movies whether a 1 or 5 rating realizes, a movie is only as good as the sound track to go with it.
3 rating for the movie
4 rating for the sound track
This is the first movie since Amelie that I watched twice. I really enjoyed the plot. It was very entertaining.

My post title sums it up. Learned negative quality about Amazon video rental: I was under the impression that once you started watching a paid rental movie you had 2 hrs to complete viewing it. Once the rental expires, even if you are halfway through it, the video shuts off. They need to explain that more clearly in their policies. I missed the last 5 minutes of the movie which was pretty sucky (maybe the last 5 minutes were excellent and made up for the previous 120)

Many have panned this film, and for good reason.  It is often incomprehensible.  The problem is less with  the acting, which is decent, than with the directing/editing.  They just did not put together  coherent story.
Has a good but foreseeable plot, but overall is a decent movie.  I wouldn't have wanted to pay the money to see it in theaters though.
Typical sci-fi.  Not great, but not horrible either. I Would not pay theatre prices to see this movie.  Not great for young kids

Kind of like The Matrix and Deep Impact but still a good story and CGI.

Overall, good movie and story.
I loved this movie in the theatre, and rented it to share with friends.  It froze at 1:44min in.  UGH

I have been a sci-fi fan since a child. But not many sci-fi movies succeed in both the plot concepts and the visual experience. Oblivion did a fairly good job in both. The plot is well constructed and quite intriguing, the visual effect is impressive. I would highly recommend it.

Wow. Well, where to start is a little difficult. I guess, What at twist, is a good place. This post apocolyptical rendition is one of the few better ones I have seen. I guess because I can relate to the dangers of being a technician out in the field. But, I guess that's getting too deep into it. But we really loved it. Just wished it lasted a little longer and maybe hinting of a sequel or something. My mind was eager for more. I would recommend this to all. Especially the sci-fi techies everywhere.

If I had never seen any other movie I would probably have been blown away.  However, I have, which makes this seem unoriginal.  I felt like I have seen this type of story before, told more skillfully.  It used all the old plays from the Tom Cruise move playbook.

I love good Sci-Fi movies and this is one of them! Excellent Sci-Fi movies are hard to find, actually. Especially these days! I did read the other reviews complaining about how this movie was a compilation of some many other classic (and not-so-classic) Sci-Fi movies already done. So what? It was done well, that's what counts! The movie was beautiful to watch, the plot was intriguing, the music was awesome. (Especially if you have surround sound!) Those three add up to a five star rating right there. Add in Tom Cruise who 9 outa 10 times somehow doesn't fail to put out an amazing film (I just don't know how he does it, but he simply puts out "Good Film' over & over! TYVM Tom Cruise!) If you love Sci-Fi movies for Sci-Fi movie's sake, the see this movie. If you plan to nit-pic, then maybe this movie is not for you. Plan on a beautiful ride, though. 'Thumbs up'.
boring, mindless movie that went no where.  Cruise acted like he was bored to be in the movie-came across as a low budget, weak script flick that had no message-worst Cruise movie ever!
Morgan, definitely was not the typical morgan in this one. Rather see him on SyFy.  Cruise is still having Top Gun flash backs.
Thought provoking... intense film.  I would recommend  it to my friends.  There are some good twists thrown in it for kicks.

"Oblivion" was worth a one time viewing but I am not likely to watch it again.  The special effects are good and add a modicum of entertainment value.  CONS:  The plot is convoluted and the basic concept is unrealistic and not particularly well conceived - even for science fiction.  The construction of the characters does not really permit me to "connect" or empathize with them.  I felt this way right after watching this movie.  Two weeks later, this is not a memorable movie for me in any sense.  Rent it to watch - not worth buying the DVD.
Starts well and does a decent job in drawing you into the story. However it does not finish as well as it started.

Really enjoyed this futeristic tale of a post acopotlitic earth. Morgan Freeman plays the commander of the Scav's who are battling for the earth with a race of aliens. Tom Cruise plays a 'drone repairman' plagued with reoccuring dreams of a 'past life'. Well done with good special effects
I know it might not be for everyone but as far as Sci-fi goes, I thought it was pretty good.  A cool story and way better than I read from the reviews.
I'm a big Cruise fan & this vehicle did not disappoint!  Exhilarating, intelligent & edgy - just the way I like it!

Fun special effects, fine story, all.the actors are good, and yet the movie left me flat.  I felt I wasted two hours. Maybe because the plot twist was so predictable, but I think it was just poor story telling.

I wish blockbuster was still around because I have never wasted my money more until I bought this stupid fall asleep movie. it would have been a waste of money renting it from blockbuster but at least I wouldn't have to see that I wasted 20.00 every time I go to pick out a movie from my collection

Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman, need I say more.  The story was fantasy with a dose of possibility so I enjoyed the action and the storyline. In fact I will watch it again.  So well worth a watch or even two or more (smiling). I do believe you will enjoy the movie.
What I love about this movie is that it has action and adventure without being a gore fest.  The ending was a little predictable but that didn't take away from the quality of the film.

The movie is epic, Thought provoking, beautiful scenery, wicked drones. This movie is comparable to what's happening today with the wars over oil in the middle east. Sit back, grab your drink, and enjoy!
Visually pretty cool but very predictable, blatently copying scenes from a number of sci-fi films. I couldn't help but laugh at the bad acting a few times.
Loved it and the special effects are spectacular. The ending caught me by surprise and I like that. This is a definite see for all Sci-fi fanatics
Didn't care for story line. Special effects were nothing special. would not recommend. glad i had this as a promotion and didn't pay out of pocket.
COOL trailer and 2 of my favorite actors, sci fi in the future: my favorite type of movie. But nah, this movie just didn't do it for me.

This movie was really horrible. Plot was silly, directing was an insult to the viewer and acting was subpar. Not to mention the childish dialogues. It is sad seeing Morgan Freeman star in such productions. Stay away!
I liked Tom Cruise's character..I think I'll watch it again...maybe this weekend. Eight more words required, I'll make them short.

This was a nice film. It isn't non-stop action, so if you need that to enjoy a film look elsewhere. But it is a good story and Cruise does a very good job with the material. Direction, cinematography and effects made an overall good film. I would actually like to have seen it a bit longer for more character development.

Tom Cruise has had his issues recently, but he is almost always a reliable actor.  He came prepared for his normal action/drama role.  The standout though was the premise, special effects,  and his co-star, Andrea Riseborough.  Her refusal to accept the situation they were in was fabulous. Morgan Freeman phoned it in though, but even then that's better than half the actors out there.
Ending is wonderful and different.  Enjoy the flying and scenery.  Would not mind having a house, I guess would need to make a whole lots of money.  Still, nice "digs".
If you like Tom Cruise, you'll like this movie. It's him playing a familiar character that we have grown to love. The story is solid and the cinematography is beautiful. Definitely worth a look.

It gets kinda slow for a while. They couldve done sooo much more with the idea of this movie.
Its Ok as a redbox type rental but i wouldnt be happy if i had paid $12 to watch.

I would not waste any money on this movie. It almost seemed to have a lot to say about Tom Cruises personal life as the clone girlfriend was a red head like his first wife and the new wife was a brunette. He just does not really cut it anymore as an actor which is sad.
I was looking forward to the sci fi, but it was a big disappointment. The story was a bit hard to follow. There was not enough connection to the real humans.
Just don't bother.

I'm normally not a big Tom Cruise fan, he's a good actor but I think most of his movies are look at Tom Cruise. While this one has that element, it works. The movie is really engaging and the visual effects are stunning.

One of the most visually stunning movies I've seen in a long time - if you love good design and beautiful cinematography, this movie is worth your time alone.  It does however tend to be a bit over complicated and doesn't have quite the narrative conclusion that satisfies.  But in a field of average summer blockbusters, this one is sure to delight.
I liked the movie, but it took two viewings before it made sense.  I like the actors that were cast in the various roles.

I wanted to be open minded despite the fact that it stars Tom Cruise. I rather enjoyed _Minority Report_. It's what you should expect from having seen many other sci-fi films staring a "teetering on the edge" leading man. Only the acting was a bit worse than most. Channeling what I can only assume is an outdated boyishly cute quality didn't help Cruise in the first part of the film. The trait neither fit the plot nor his age.

As for the plot, you can figure it out pretty quickly based on familiar idea that the main character's inner self is smarter, deeper and more selflessly heroic than the establishment. I can't help but think it's the same storyline as _The Last Samurai_. Though I could be mistaken; I've all but blocked that one from my memory. Only Tom Cruise has the skill and knowledge to save us in a world where Tom Cruise cannot and will not die. As usual, the film is unwillingly dominated by his presence, so it's difficult to say if any other cast members were good.
To my film knowledge this seems to be an original story well written and well directed.  The plot isn't mind boggling, but still entertaining.  I would suggest this for most Sci-fi genre fans.
Good sci-fi action movie. I love movies that make you think and figure out what's really going on. This movie is definitely entertaining and worth a bowl of popcorn to watch.

This movie contained a lot of sequence-shots, landscaping, and storyline. I love the breakaway from the normal routine of Sci-Fi action movies, and this one had such a great story I'd put it up as a Sci-Fi Chick Flick, with plenty of explosions and Tom Cruise shooting things. Great movie if you want something with more than explosions and weak plot points.
Very impressive sets and scenery but a weak story. We bought it even though we saw it at the theater mainly because it was cheap and came with a free Amazonnversion.
I'm sorry, this was the worse movie of tom cruise I've ever seen, the futiristic movie is not to enjoyable to watch with him.

As with most movies nowadays this started off promising, but then went down the cherry hill fast....
I liked the actors in it, but the story was very slow and a bit confusing. This flick dragged on forever as well, trying to take itself so serious but without any fun or inspired action. Nothing stood out. I'm still not sure what the movie is really about?

I have to admit that I had low expectations going in to watch the movie.  I was pleasantly surprised with the movie on several levels.  Yes, there were action scenes, but this movie moved along mostly at a very sedate pace without being boring.  Tom Cruise did an admirable job in what was essentially a four character movie.  I won't include any spoilers - you'll have to watch this movie for yourself - you will not be disappointed.  It's a rare movie these days that can sustain a thoughtful pace with a tasteful use of action scenes.  Kudos to all involved in this movie.

This movie actually shocked me.  I was not expecting something on the order of a masterpiece when I purchased this film.  There are multiple twists and a great, unique story here.  It's something special.  I watched it with my kids and they were able to mostly follow it and after a bit of explaining got the concept.  This is something to not miss if you enjoy anything from the sci-fi side of things.  Again, a must watch and a great buy.  This is in my top 5 sci fi flicks with actual stories of all time.

I have followed Tom Cruise for many years and films. I do believe this is his best and the cast was well picked and directed.  The Graphics were well done and almost made you feel like you were there.  Thumb up

The film is wonderful! I just feel sad I did not see it in theaters, especially IMAX. I was misled by the reviews and Universal did a poor job of promotion and explanation. The reality is this is a landmark film because, a) it's an original story without a predictable ending or middle, b) strong story and dialog--no teen characters in the way, c) great acting, d) great scenes, and e) inspiring music. That's about it unless you have been brainwashed by formula flicks at this point and still need rehashed stories and characters.
Oblivion is a recycled story with some updated special effects.  Not Tom Cruise's best, but not his worst.  A much better Tom Cruise movie is Jack Reacher.
Turned out to be more exciting than expected. Keeps you guessing through out the movie. Would recomened it to others
....for a film that delivers you to that oblivious place. All I can say is don't sit down to watch it unless you are well-rested because if you aren't, you will be oblivious to the pretentious plot.

The movie was confusing from the first five minutes.  I liked some of machine's and special effects.  The story line became disjointed and hard to follow.  Overall I expected to more entertainment not boring.

This film is just simple enough to be predictable at times, but the sense of adventure is sustained.  It is well written and well acted enough to be compelling.  I hesitated to watch this now that we know how crazy Tom Cruise is, but he's still a good fit for a role like this.  (I would like to think this film might become an allegory for his personal disillusionment regarding the church of Scientology, his struggle against himself, and ultimate renouncement of the crazy).  A lot of the fun of sci-fi is in the gadgets, and here they do not disappoint.  Those drones are actually scary, and their domicile is like a preview of the iHouse (they live in an iPad, haha).

I would have liked to see more exploration of the human element, but there wouldn't have been a lot of room for that in what's basically a "what-if-our-stuff-was-stolen" on a grand scale tale.  Bottom line, it's fun, and I would watch it again.

Everything about this was classic good Si-Fi except Tom Cruise.  In fact, spoiler alert, there is a piece of the story line that is so Cruise that it screws up the story.  I mean really, clones of him??? gezzz...

Otherwise this is a well executed Si-Fi with excellent special effects, a great story line, and a dystopian future that is easy to accept. Still I give it 4 of 5 because I can (sorta) ignore that it is Cruise.

Tom cruise did some amazing acting. It has a little bit of plot twist but its a weird twist that doesn't necessarily enhance the movie. Also has a lack of a background story so if your looking for action and a weird ending go for it

Great Movie! I really love the concept but you have to pay attention to it. It is not a movie you can do other things during and know what's going on. Morgan Freeman plays a great part. Unfortunately, he only plays a relatively small part in the movie.
It was a pretty good movie. Makes you think...Enjoyed watching it at home, but not really one i would want to go to the movies for...

M83 did a really good job on the soundtrack, but the movie itself felt kinda dull. Plus the movie does almost nothing to hide one of it's "big reveals".

Overall it was worth a watch, but one viewing was enough.

Very scary future which does not seem that unrealistic. Many of the technologies are on the horizon. The drones, and cloning are very likely in the not to distant future. The destruction of the earth to increase the wealth and waste of a few is already rampant. Get a glimpse of where we are going.

The premise behind Oblivion is clever, and somewhat disconcerting, quite like Duncan Jones' "Moon."  However, the basic plot twist becomes fairly obvious about half way through the movie, leaving the second half rather flat.  For sci-fi lovers, it is worth renting for a night, but I don't see this one being ranked among the classics.
Enjoyed this movie with popcorn and soda. Also, my favorite pillow and blanky. I hope you like this movie too!
Would watch it again. Liked the little shuttle Tom rode around in. Great graphics and special effects in Blu ray.
It's worth watching, but could've been a little deeper in storyline, like most Hollywood science fiction films. It had great special effects and good acting. Definitely a good choice for movie night.
Really liked the movie. Cruise was great and the story was not near as bad as I've heard.  Overall a thoroughly entertaining film.
Lots of action, good special effects, weak story, weak acting.  Glad I didn't see it at big screen prices. Not Tom's best!
Over all entertaining.  The story line is a little hard to follow, but I believe the writers intended it to be.  Somewhat suspenceful with an interesting conclusion.
This movie was fun enough to watch, but it wasn't particularly thought provoking or anything. We are glad we didn't pay to see it in the theater, but it was fine for an Amazon rental...
Started out pretty slow with too much emphasis on the daily activities of the protagonists. That becomes relevant later on, so it makes up for it in the end, so just be prepared for slow start.
boyfriend liked it more than me --- after 40 minutes it lost my attention --- i just thought it was a little boring
Could not even get through the first 15 minutes. Tom Cruise is not very compelling in this role, and the script lacked originality.
Great SciFi movie and beautiful cinematography.  Not a fan of Tom Cruise but he does pick great movies to be involved in.

I think the script tried to hard to be sophisticated but only succeeded in out convoluting itself to the point of confusion. Tom played Tom as usual and Morgan Freeman was reduced to a cameo, but Morgan is great at whatever he does.
I was really disappointed with this movie, it was boring and extremely slow moving.  It didn't seem to have an interesting story at all
amazing SFX. good story. great acting. but it seems to be missing a lot of details. would have been amazing after 2 joints
Not just another average action flick. Good story line, and action scenes. Definitely worth watching =) Good movie, clever story.
Good movie, hit you in the end with a great twist.  Also a good amount of action. I would recommend it.
Great story line, with a different twist. Sparks the imagination. Loved the idea of  no ugly aliens. A higher intelligence would trick us like this.
This is a entertaining movie. If you are into Sci-FI/action/Adventure movies it's worth the watch. Acting is good and the plot is good.

Robotic acting provided by the entire cast is propped up against a green screen of death and colored over with CGI.
I did like the noise the drones made which was reminiscent of the mothership in Close Encounters.

The concept of this movie was interesting. I can't say it was my favorite, but it's worth watching a couple of times. There's a bit of action and of course, there's that bit of romance and mystery mixed in. There were twists to the plot that I was really thrown for a loop, but I followed fairly well. (And if anyone knew me, they'd know I don't catch onto things very quickly sometimes!) I don't really understand the reason for sex in movies, or even nudity considering that the best stories are portrayed without that crap..however, putting that aside, I liked the movie alright. It's a little slow, but interesting.
I liked the plot and action, better then I was expecting.  Tom Cruise is better in this then in his recent movies.

Without giving away much, we live life as if we are in control of ourselves and our future. Are we really in control? Can we really say to ourselves that we are the only version of ourselves? Is it possible we are programmed to be who we are?
This movie was so slow in developing the story that we almost wished that it has been sent to oblivion.

I was expecting a typical brainless sci-fi action schlock film, and that's not what this is. Yes, there is some action, but it is very well thought out and shot. The vehicle design is what really impressed me in this movie. The ship that Tom Cruise flies around in is very practical and is actually something you could see being used in real life. The story is great and I found myself really caring about the characters and what was going to happen. There are enough twists to keep you interested and guessing, and the payoff is great.

The visuals are absolutely stunning. This is one of those rare films where you don't think "that looks fake". Everything looks real, and the locations..my god the locations...A lot of work went into finding the perfect locations for this film. They do such a good job of merging locations with built sets that you forget you are watching fiction. I can't say enough good things about this movie.

What a great movie.  I'm excited that we still have original movies coming out that aren't afraid of NOT having a sequel.  This move will scratch most of your itches.

SciFi?  check.
Futuristic Guns?  CHECK!
Cool vehicles?  Check!
Diabolical Aliens?  CHE C K!
Post Apocalyptic?  CHECK!

We ARE an Effective Team.
I fell asleep before the movie ended, couldn't keep my interest very long, movie seemed to quiet, not enough actions scenes.
Complex plot but great visuals.  It is one of those movies where you need to watch it from beginning to end to understand what is going on!  Tom Cruise does a nice job.
I didn't expect much, however we all enjoyed watching it and thought the plot, while a little conceptual, made for a good movie.

This story really surprised me! It looked good and was one that I wanted to see, but I had my concerns that it wasn't going to be anything special. After watching it I can confidently say that it exceeded my expectations. The story was unique and had a twist that I didn't see coming until late in the story. It was a great action/mystery that I thoroughly enjoyed.

I watched this movie expecting an explosion filled slightly confusing sci-fi flick, which would have honestly been just fine because I like explosions and science fiction. However; this movie went much deeper than anticipated, the story line is exceptionally well laid out and it went further and deeper than most sci-fi films of today. I found myself placed in the story as if I were a character in the plot, the movie brings up questions of purpose, the classic "Why are we here?" kind of stuff, and it does it in such a subtle way that I felt like a friggin philosopher during some post movie discussion.
Bottom line: I'll be getting this one on DVD soon.
Wondered where it would lead and it was all around good movie. Worth checking out. The effects were pretty good
A solid scifi movie without any extra gimic. Did not feel like the movie was long. Plenty of twist to keep you watching.
Every movie I tried to watch through amazon instant video through xbox has failed to load consistently and therefore un watchable. I would not recommend amazon instant video to anyone.
This movie was a brain teaser, I had to watch it 3 times. Great action, nice graphics. Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman, what a great team.

I enjoy a good Sci-Fi and found Oblivion very entertaining.  The only downside is for the next week at work I kept asking the team, "Are we an effective team?". And yes I'm very privileged to work with an extremely talented (effective) IT team at the University of Florida.

This movie is extremely refreshing to watch. In the age where most studios only seem to remake things, I thought this was a great concept to bring to the big screen. Loved it and so glad I purchased it.

Very good movie even though I'm not a big sci-fi fan.  I particularly enjoyed the love story, the surprise twists and turns, and the ending left me wanting more.  Glad I added it to my collection and I will definitely be watching it over again.

I'm not a Tom Cruise fan, and wasn't really in the mood to see it, but was instantly drawn in by the spectacular visuals/cinematography and ethereal soundtrack. A perfect match, and I practically forgot I was watching Tom cruise. Subtle acting, no unnecessary over-explaining dialogue, and no distracting product placement. I was a bit baffled by negative reviews on rotten tomatoes. I've watched this film twice now and liked it just as much the second time.

I wasn't expecting much as this movie got panned but it exceeded my low expectations. Wasn't that bad. I like sci-fi and special effects if they are done well and I enjoyed this movie. Wasn't great but wasn't bad.
It was overall a very good movie. I had to watch it in bits and pieces but the twists and turns were good and kept you interested.
This film was interesting because Tom Cruise was the actor. But take away that and the story is old and not freshly told.
Good Tom Cruise movie.  Nice plot twist at the end.  I stayed with it all the way through.  Worth watching twice.

First saw this in the theatre and was expecting a decent sic-fi movie, but instead much better than I thought. This move was great, really enjoyed it and had to own it. Plus the soundtrack by M83 is absolutely stunning!!!

Surprisingly better than I thought it would be.  Oblivion is well crafted and gives us an interesting look into a not so perfect world.  Unlike many of the films in this category Oblivion held my interest throughout.  Well not a major Cruise follower I thought he did well in playing an all too familiar roll in science fiction films.  I liked the storyline and the relationships both within his 'home' base and the outside world where is works.  The special effects were really well done and the environments where we discovered each step along the main characters journey with him were wonderful and kept my interest.
Morgan Freeman is of course Morgan which is fine but his character's story was short and too predictable for me.  There were a few unforeseen left turns in the story which worked but the ending was pretty much a Hollywood ending.  I liked it and recommend it to anyone who loves science fiction whether your a Tom Cruise fan or not.
I really enjoyed this movie. It was a great story concept, that kept you wondering what was going on until the very end. Beautiful graphics.

I was surprised this movie did not do better at the Box Office. Honestly I watched this movie only out of lack of anything else to do. Boy was that wrong. I found it kept me wondering what was going to happen next with a lot of "I didn't see that coming" Movie of the year it is not, but definitely a movie worth seeing and I am glad I added it to my Sci-Fi Collection

When I can I plan on buying this movie. Unlike the reviews, I actually loved this movie.

Without giving anything away, I love the fact that it had twists and surprises. It was definitely exciting and kept me on the edge of my seat, I almost have no fingernails left.

If you want a surprising movie, that is fun and wonderful, this is DEFINITELY a movie to watch!!!

I decided to rent this simply because I love Morgan Freeman, and think Tom Cruise, despite...well, I don't have that much space...is a fantastic actor.  I didn't really remember much from the television promo's so I viewed the trailer.  It still did not look familiar (trying to remember if I had seen it before) so I rented it.  That was the best $4.99 I have ever spent on a movie rental I do believe.  It's hard to refrain from recapitulating the fine points made in most of the preceding reviews for they all share my amazement of this film.  It is almost completely original; yes we've seen the post-apocalyptic rebirth of earth and its meek survivors before, but this differs from those, I believe, because that is not the story-line.  It acts as supporting role to the main plot/theme - that being the power of human spirit, sacrifice, strategic defiance, and determination.  The action was fantastic.  When the drones go flying through the underground headquarters spinning, flying, and firing in all directions at high speeds, well, I have to admit I was on the edge of my seat brimmed with fervent anticipation, wonder, and bedazzlement!
I would highly recommend this movie to anyone with a pulse; or rather, NOT to those with weak pulses!  Spectacularly visionaired (apologies for the flagrant use of poetic-license)with vibrant setting, a staccatic yet perfectly blended score, and an apparent limitless budget...in the words of John Hammond, they "spared no expense."  I rarely purchase movies as I normally don't watch them over and over again.  In order for me to do so, its got to be somewhat of a classic like, ironically, Shawshank Redemption (the irony being that Morgan Freeman obviously is in both...hmmm, can irony be obvious? Squirrel! Sorry for the Attention Deficit Disorder!), the GREAT Resident Evil, Back To the Future, or the before-allusioned-to Jurassic Park series, etc.  But I can promise you I will be purchasing a Blu-Ray copy of this one.
In summary:  GET IT!
Enjoyed Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman in this future apocalypse movie. I wish there was a more detail, but who knows maybe there's going to be sequel to answer all my questions.
Saw the movie in theater. Pre-order the movie very early. Saw it again after received it. I will recommend it to everyone.
Kept me interested throughout, even when you think you know where it's going there is always something you weren't certain of coming
A lot better than I thought I couldn't figure out where they were gonna go. When they went there I was pleasantly surprised.
Without giving any spoilers, lets just say this movie is well thought out, has good action and suspense, and ends positively.  Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman are great!
I felt like it was a mesh of Alien, Reign of Fire, Star Wars, Star Trek: First Contact (the one with the Borg).  I thought it was a great sci-fi movie.  Check it out.  I think you'll enjoy it.
Wonderful intricate story and plot line, horrible delivery. What a waste of time... even for a girl, way too slow...
I like science fiction movies so this falls into that category. It could have shown more about earth but the movie is already over two hours long.
This movie was not what I expected. There was a great plot twist and the cinematography was incredible!. Don't want to give anything away....go watch it and enjoy!
Overall, an interesting movie, but not necessarily one I will watch again.  Fairly similar to the Matrix, with some plot twists.
Oblivion is oblivious.  I expected a more entertaining movie with the interaction of the two very good stars and a good supporting cast.
One of the best Sifi movies I've seen in a long time. Music was also excellent.  Tom Cruise was at his best.

Temporal dislocations and historical misrepresentations combine with overly subtle cloning themes to make a simple tale barely discernible within the awkwardly assembled footage. Good effects. Nice locations.
I wanted to know more about the other planet; what they used; what did they do with the humans?  Maybe I missed something...

This was and is my favorite SciFi movie so far for 2013. I of course enjoyed Man of Steel, Star Trek, Iron Man 3, World War Z ,etc. But this one was a bit different and I thought it was well done and visually stunning. Wish I could see it on the big screen again. Oh and it has a killer score and interesting enough, the Blu Ray has an option to watch the movie with no dialogue and only the score playing. Pretty cool if you are a movie score lover. The other Blu Ray to have this was also a Tom Cruise move - Jack Reacher.

Another really great movie by Cruise.  Premise and screenplay were outstanding and should be noted by Oscar nomination.  Cruise seems to have the ability to pick out great story lines and then make them believable.  His personal life effect how he perceived in the movies but he seems to make us forget that part of his life as you a drawn into the story lines of whatever he is doing

I personally don't care for Tom Cruise, but you have to hand it to him, most of his movies deliver the action in a big way and Oblivion follows suit.  I found Oblivion highly entertaining, and unlike a lot of current sci-fi flicks today, is not as predictable as I expected.  While character development is on the thin side, the action and suspense will help you overlook it - and just when you think you know how it's going to end - Bam! - it throws you for a loop.  I appreciate that in a film.  Morgan Freeman delivers his end of the bargain and is a good addition to Cruise as far as star power goes.  I watched this film on a 2 hour flight and didn't once look at my watch. Accordingly, I give it 4 stars as it delivered exactly what I wanted - action, suspense, and great special effects.  If you are looking for something more, you'll probably be disappointed.

Glad I didn't see it in the theater it was an ok rental
It could have been better
Once you understand what is going on it is very predictable
slow to get going. The ending helped make up for things but it was a snoozer. Cruise is a formula actor.
This movie had a lot of promise but ultimately the script was a muddle mess. A real waste of $5.99 to rent this one.
Spent too long building up to what the movie was about, last half hour was absolutely confused, and I'm still kihda confused even after seeing the end.
Dialog was stilted and action predictable. But I was content to watch. My wife on the other hand went to sleep

where did the the shack in the country come from?  just happened on it?  and with the radio and music there? too confusing.  waste of Morgan Freeman's talents and the other actors too.  thought we would really see something when MF showed up, but no.  big waste of talent all around.  For pure escapism, okay but nothing to write home about.  Cruise is not bad however but he's a professional and get's mucho bucks so he has to perform.
Great movie, I really enjoyed the action. You should watch it. Like right now. or tomorrow. This is dumb that they make you do this

Lousy plot, influenced by Scientology. Wooden acting. Not enough action to justify entertainment value. We're fighting Aliens with technology indistinguishable from magic, using high powered rifles. And we win? And the Alien/aliens are what? Machine? God? a pissed off female from outer space? I would have given it 0 stars, but I liked the flyers.
My husband and I enjoyed this and all the twists and turns of a complex plot. Great story and the acting was excellent.
I very seldom fall to sleep during a movie, but my wife had to wake me up twice on this one. I'd place it at one of the 10 worse sci-fi movies I've seen.
Was expecting a sci-fi action movie and got a long boring movie.  Highly not recommended.  Plenty of other movies that would rank well above this one.
Will watch  again... Good content and story. Special effects were fantastic and the acting was also good. Maybe a sequel ?
Original movie making at one of its greatest. Tom's acting is superb as usual. Can't wait for either a sequel or prequel.

I love scifi and Tom Cruise, with whom I believe is a wonderful actor in anything he does. I just wish people would see the person and not the religion he lives by. I am a Christian and we are not to judge people rudely or fausely.
The movie I felt was slow moving, but still a wonder to watch. I will watch this movie for many years to come.
We loved watching Oblivion. We had no problems accessing the  movie. I will recommend it to all of my friends.

I enjoy most of TC films but this movie was just terrible! I tried watching this, got towards 40 minutes and walked out of the room. Long, boring with no action. I guess after I left, that's when the action started. Come on, at least catch my attention with something. The dialogue was bland, nothing was good about this. Oh yeah, the scenery was great, that's about it. Oh one last thing, why was Morgan Freeman on the cover???? He was hardly in the movie.
Stupid and a total waste of time.  We got half way through it and couldn't stand to watch it any more.
I liked it.  It's certainly worth your time and money to rent.  Has some really interesting/clever twists too!  Mind blowing ones.  Also, well cast and acted.
Like so many Tom Cruz films now it just doesn't quite hit the mark.  Not bad but lacks the emotional pull to really bring you in.
This movie was pretty good.  I love Tom Cruise and I LOVE anything Morgan Freeman is in.  I would watch it again.
The movie had plety of plot "holes" that defied logic, but it also had sufficient action and unexpected plot twists to hold my interest until the end.

The idea was great but the execution was poor. This flick just had too many scifi-flik innuendos. It had many opportunities to break out from the shadows of over worked cliches but failed miserably at every turn, just to end up becoming highly predictable and almost boring. Watching this film for the first time will leave you feeling as if you watched it dozen times before.

Wouldn't recommend it and wouldn't watch it again a very bad story line kept waiting for more action, suspense and drama, wasn't sure of the story line at times and kept waiting for something more, but it ended with no ending to the story
There's little worth remembering in this movie.  The movie Moon does a much better job at capturing the drama of this ilk.

I watched this under duress at my brothers house  --I am not a fan of TC  --  This movie was long boring confusing at times ---  we start off in one direction and then had off into another --  The only thing I liked was the scenery and I could have watched that for two hours  --

What an overblown stinker! To be completely honest, I have only seen the 2D version on Pay-per-view. It's probably better in 3D. The visuals are stunning but haven't we become blase about this sort of thing in this day and age? I know I have. I still want a story that I can follow and one that will hold my interest. This movie is L-O-N-G, so long and so dull that I had to watch it over two days because it was putting me to sleep. Morgan Freeman gives us another elder-statesman type part. Didn't I just see him in Olympus has fallen playing the same character? Well, I guess at his age, he needs the money. Tom Cruise is getting OLD! They try unsuccessfully to squeeze tears out of you by using such touches as Procul Harem's "Whiter Shade of Pale" and several shots of Andrew Wyeth's CHRISTINA'S WORLD. I'd rather stare at the Wyeth paiting for an hour or two than sit through  this turkey again.

This movie was a somewhat typical Tom Cruise flick. Some action, but the story was pretty predictable. I lost interest no long after the start. I honestly wouldn't waste my money on it. The last 30 minutes of it were the longest - I couldn't wait for it to be over.
Just when you think you understand what is going on, bam! You get the shock of your life! It leaves you with wonder and awe!

Was fairly good movie, but it was Tom Cruise. I really mean Tom Cruise. Wish he would go back to making movies and not so much Tom Cruise. If it was not for Morgan Freedman I don't think I would have bought it. It was just to much Tom Cruise and his scientology.

The movie had entertaining parts, but was so sloppy that it just didn't deliver.  I'd have to watch it again, which I won't, to mention all the parts that either didn't make sense or were unnecessary, impossible, or unbelievable - yes I realize this is sci-fi, but you can still make the story believable by doing some homework.

I will mention three things that bugged me without any real spoilers.
1 - Why in the world would Jack (Tom Cruise) ever need a motorcycle in this environment when his bubble ship could go anywhere the motorcycle could?  The only reason is so that TC could see himself on a motorcycle on the big screen yet again (Top Gun, MI-2, et al).  Unnecessary and stupid.
2 - The protection inside the transparent pod on his bubble ship didn't really provide much protection other than the seat-belt harness.  There were several scenes where the one or two people inside would have never survived the shock/forces on them.  Poor physics.  (Yes, there were plenty of other physics issues with the movie, but this was my biggest beef.)
3 - The ending was the main sloppy part.  Too many unanswered questions.  They really could have made a nice story out of this, but it was a little more than half a story.  It should have been an hour longer with more development and more loose ends tied up.  What a waste!

A bit predictable and not a fast paced blow-em-up but it was a good story and done well.  I really enjoyed watching it and I think Tom Cruise was perfect for his part. As for Morgan Freeman: he is a good actor but I am tired of him playing the same type character in so many movies and having him in any movie actually detracts from it for me now.
SciFi fluff.  Well shot and good effects. But nothing groundbreaking.  Good way to kill and evening. Tom Cruise was his usual character.
This movie was so good and the ending was not anything that I thought it would be, I would recommend it to everyone

i only gave it one star so people wld read my review- it deserves 5- i realized watching the features w the commentary on- which one must do these days- making what used to b 90 minutes into 180-that these guys DID NOT know how to tell a story. The story is so complex one has to listen to the features commentary to "get it"- what w 2 jacks, etc.- but the movie holds yr attention and is intriguing in its difficultness.
In the commentary one gets too many self congratulatory remarks abt how great the movie is, how great we are, how great Morgan Freeman is- awesome, unbelievable- does this generation have any modesty?
But over all- they did a good job.

After looking at some of the reviews I never gave this movie a chance. Happened to be at a friends house and we watched this and we were both pleased beyond imagination. Tom Cruise is just rock solid. Simple little part I know but if you get this pay attention to the part where he is trapped in the hole trying to fix the drone and watch how he handles the scene with the assault rifle he uses. Guy prepares for these movies like few do. Morgan Freeman as always top notch. Loved the story and was a little shocked at how some reviews just didn't get it. The movie is actually really easy to follow and will bring you through the complete emotional cycle and do it well which I really enjoy in any movie. The living pads in the sky were a nice touch and the harrier like jet was pretty damn cool. Should have figured out some things much sooner than I did but I loved it well done.

Good story line, good acting, imaginative.  Most of todays Sci Fi is all about CGI and very short on story.  This is a very good balance between the two.  I agree with others, the ending is cool.  Although not a chick flick, they will love the movie.
I enjoyed every moment, very stark and thoughtful. Well worth a watch. Reminded me of Moon (w/Sam Rockwell) which is one of my favorite movies.

I thought this was going to be a fast paced science fiction movie.  Instead, it felt more like a silent documentary.  The entire premise could have been edited to 20 minutes and been a nice twilight zone episode.  If you are having trouble making up your mind just wait and rent it for $3.

Whenever Cruise's name is attached to anything like this, I automatically assume that it's crap, but this one turns out to be worth a look.  No doubt that whatever quality exists in Oblivion is due to the fact that director Joseph Kosinski was permitted to direct his own graphic-novel source material, and thus stay true to the sci-fi heart of the story.  I feel that discussing much of the plot very quickly gets into spoiler territory.  The set-up: Earth has been attacked by aliens, but humans have won the battle--at the cost of the Earth's habitability.  Remaining humans are being offloaded from the planet to a giant space station, while a few "techs" (Cruise) hunt down the last aliens (savages or "Savs").

Special effects are more than acceptable for a current product.  The casting is successful:  Cruise doesn't repel;  Morgan Freeman is onscreen much, much less than his costar billing would tend to indicate.  Andrea Riseborough is notable as Cruise's "tech" assistant-lover.  And Olga Kurylenko has navigated the path from teenage model to talented movie actress suprisingly well; she's improved, bit-by-bit, in each movie she's appeared in recently.

This was a good movie. IWithout giving away the ending it has a different twist on things. Pay close attention to it. I am a SyFy and 'End of the world' movie watcher with a bit of Zombie Apocalypse thrown in and this held my interest.
The visuals were great! The story line, not so much. It was underdeveloped, as were the characters. Even the music in the movie didn't seem to fit quite right.
A very nice new scifi movie, some very nice twists in the plot. Tom cruise did a good job in the movie. Its a very great scifi movie, well worth a watch!
nice, why i have to write so many things i like and that's it, 19 words is for nuts. lol

Planet Earth has supposedly been devastated by a war with 'aliens', and most of humanity is living off world on Saturn's Moon 'Titan'.  A few stay back to watch over and protect the 'power generators' sending the power back to the Titan Station.  You see transmissions between the maintenance crew and Titan, protecting and maintaining these power generators, and then these few are looking forward to joining 'Titan Earth' people.

This movie has many refreshing twists.  I won't give them away.  Morgan Freeman pops up a little later... :)

Overall, this is a wonderful remembering of what humanity is, was and how much we (I) appreciate the beauty of the Earth as it is.  Another aspect of this movie is that our memories and who we are, are much more than a mechanical, chemical, or robotic program.  Our being or spirit is instead a 'wholographic' and spiritual being, of memory... sorry, better not say more :)

There are fun twists later in the movie... This is a movie to me that says "yes" to our humanity, care, empathy, and appreciation to the beauty of earth,... no to transhumanism and post humanism.  (Look it up)

Beyond that, if you don't want to think about 'meanings' or 'morals of the story', it is a great movie of 'empowerment' facing massive odds.
I loved this movie.

Let me first say that I thought director Joseph Kosinski's Tron: Legacy was abysmal. And apparently, a sizable portion of critics and audiences shared my opinion. But there were moments watching that I could not help but be impressed. Kosinski has a great visual eye, and shows mastery of lighting and framing. There are scenes in the film of startling beauty, like, "Wow. This movie is actually not ALL bad." Colour me intrigued. What else could this guy do? When he was coupled with arguably Hollywood's biggest movie star - Tom Cruise, a great supporting cast - including Morgan Freeman and Olga Kurylenko, a bigger budget, and a promising script based on a six-page graphic novel treatment he penned, I was ready to give Joseph Kosinski a second chance. I saw Oblivion. Let's see what I thought below. Movies live or die on their casting so let's talk about that first. I understand the doubts about Tom Cruise, but really, there's no need for that. Put aside your thoughts about his personal life; the couch jumping, Katie Holmes, and all that. The role of futuristic drone repairman Jack Harper is quite possibly among his finest. Cruise shows he has a real screen presence, which, when combined with his roguish charm and charisma, results in a surprisingly sympathetic and impressive performance. Cruise's character is onscreen 90% of the time, so his performance is a big factor in the film's power. I can safely say that Jack Harper managed to be interesting, cool, and emotional without being over-the-top or sappy. Kudos to you, Tom. You might not be the finest of actors, but you're always fun to watch. Olga Kurylenko and Andrea Riseborough both give excellent performances as the films two female leads: respectively, the mysterious crash-landed astronaut Julia, and Jack's conflicted co-member Victoria. While Kurylenko's character brings the love interest and the mysterious flashbacks, Riseborough's Victoria is much more interesting and strong, plotwise. in the supporting cast we find Morgan Freeman, who is his usual awesome self as Malcolm Beech, one of the few remaining humans on earth; and Nikolai Coster-Waldau, who brings the muscle and the beard factor to the game. Fine roles, all round! And here's another reason to watch Oblivion. Oblivion has the finest cinematography I have seen in a film this year. Echoing Lawrence of Arabia and 2001: A Space Odyssey, the stunning landscape of Iceland comes to vivid, awe-inspiring life with a minimum of CGI and a maximum of practical effects, camera tricks, and good ol'fashioned location shooting. Crumbling volcanos, vast mesas, winding canyons, valleys, endless plains, shifting deserts, dizzying peaks, and open sky are all beautifully shot, and, with a bit of CGI touch-up, become the alien-ravaged world of 2077. Seriously, see this in IMAX and you will not be disappointed. Oblivion is a veritable FEAST for the eyes. The costumes and tech and equipment are amazing as well. Kosinski chose to go for a more practical route here, and the extra work pays off. The world of Oblivion reminds one of an Apple Computer or the Star Trek (2009), but there are telltale signs that this is a lived-in, breathed-in, realistic world. Jack Harper's white costumes bears stains and grit; his chrome gun is scratched a little bit; his baseball cap is faded. Malcolm Beech's leathers are functional and weathered, while the garb of astronaut Julia is pristine grey and follows the clean lines of NASA. Form follows function, as Oblivion designer David Simon says, and so Oblivion's equipment - the drones, the planes, the guns, the motorcycles, the clothes, the beds, the electronics, even the sound of the tech, is all designed for maximum realism. But that's not to say it doesn't look cool. It does. I applaud Joseph Kosinski for his restraint when it came to CGI, and his use of practical sets and props. Here's to more in the future. Now, shall we talk cons? Oblivion borrows from too many movies to list. I see a bit of Moon here, Logan's Run there, a little of Star Wars there, is that a Solaris reference I spy? As original as Oblivion may seem, it may all be superficial - just on the surface. The story has been done plenty of times before, just not with this incredible cinematography and eye for detail. The climax was slightly "out there", and didn't reeeally fit the rest of the film tonally, but Tom Cruise's memorable one-liner is enough to make it worth it all. In conclusion, Oblivion is one of the best science fiction films to come out this year. But it's a good thing not many sci-fi films DID come out in 2013, because Oblivion is not as epic or original as it might want to be. That's not to stop the great acting, explosive action, great sets, costumes, and cool tech, and cool M83 score from letting you have a great time at the movies. My rating? Four and a half drones out of five. But why don't you watch it and see for yourself? P.S. Remember, the like/dislike buttons are NOT for saying whether you agreed with the reviewer or not, but whether the review helped you decide to buy the product. If you do not agree with the reviewer's opinion, use the comments section for that. Cheers!

I apologize but find it necessary to comment on a film which will probably gross 4 hundred million dollars or more in "its " lifetime. I promise not to give any plot give aways but just read some Bradbury or Ellison and you are almost There.
