 The locations were wisely chosen but with many graphics added to show the decay of war.
Many film lovers like to go back and THINK about the film from time to time . Not all great films need that all important message but please let our minds run a little wild with imagination from time to time after viewing a block buster with a fine cast and new visions of the future.
Think about a film such as SILENT RUNNING. You saw the near future with a cast of three humans  and two robots. We were given an actual view of the importance of inter species relationships. Humankind to nature. We saw and hopefully still think how reckless we have been  with land development and its long term impact on OUR planet.
A film may leave us with hope and compassion such as ET. Its a classic .Much simpler sets .Its greatness is in the fantasy left for the audience to dream and wonder.
 In Oblivian its not there. This film is just another clone of somone elses images of a possible future. Oblivion does not churn any new thoughts for me which has not been shown before in other forms. As I stated earlier its just 2 hours of entertainment and its gone. Please do not misuderstand me . Some films are just that ,pure entertainment. When it comes to the sci fi genre Im hoping for more. Lets rattle the cages ,stir up strong feeling we have for a brighter future or how to prevent global catastrophe. I did not get a whisper from this film . I watched this film three times wondering when am I going to get it (didnt finish round three and just gave up.
No loss to the producers though . Much money and time spent with possibly a great $ return. Why not it is Mr. excitement himself. He just missed this time . Please show me what I have missed. Is this a film from a graphic novel that was  just too subtle for me to get all the physical metaphors ?
Truly, I know many films are a disappointment when you expect more of whatever. Grossing the national debt on a film that did not provide much in.entertainment or lacked  a thought provoking idea in anyway is sad. Especially when there is much to that we can think about if presented differently.
Stop here the rest is a spoiler
IF YOU LIKE THE PLOT (FROM READING THE OTHER REVIEWS) THEN I SUGGEST THE FILM "MOON" . IT ALSO DEALS WITH THE VERY IMPORTANT CONCEPT OF CLONING . Is memory also retained in the genetic composition of the newly cloned cell? If it is then an individual never really dies. All that he/she was is still there and will be there in all future generations of that genome. Its a type of rebirth or reincarnation of the human essence.
Moon is a more personal film. Oblivion is an actioner that depends so heavily on graphics to create the atmosphere . In Moon the character(s) really pull you in to their dilemma.  The computer generated graphics are no where near that of Oblivion but relies more on character development to feel the pain or shock of human replication for economic advantages. The CONCEPT is so deep and thought provoking that simple sets work just as well. Its not about what you see on a screen but with what thoughts you leave the theater or your set at home. There is a concept here that certainly deserves some thought.

I found the movie interesting, the plot however was not original and rather "borrowed" from the previous classic syfy movies... I liked the dialogues, pace of the movie and photography. Of course, Tom Cruise was great and the ladies: Andrea Riseborough and Olga Kurylenko did very well. One thing that annoys me is that every commercial and/or trailer for this movie shows Morgan Freeman along with Tom Cruise as the main characters. BUT don't be fooled: Mrs Freeman's name (whom I adore) is there only to attract more viewer, I guess. To sum, I liked the movie but it is not in the category "never to forget".

If you enjoy good stories with a bit of mystery and action, sit back and enjoy this movie.

This is a well told story that takes its time, the actors are good, the story and plot is nice, the effects are well done but do not overshadow the story.  This is a movie more for adults than tiny kids.  This movie does not spoon feed the audience every detail, the movie drops you into a situation and tells a story.

On the actors... great job!  Some of the actors just weirded me out and I never quite knew what they were going to do.  Others were just solid performances.
On the effects... I loved the drones.  The way the movie portrayed them, I felt nervous when they were in a scene.
Overall..  this movie is head and shoulders above much of the utter crud that is out there.

I personally don't understand why this movie got bad reviews in the beginning. This was really a very intelligent and well done Sci-Fi Affair . No, it wasn't a action movie and I loved the fact it wasn't. In Fact it was a very intelligent complex well written story. I thought Tom Cruise's perfomance was one of the best he's had in along time. He actually had emotion and did seem vunerable and unsure of himself. I think any person that is intelligent and like challenging stories should see this. What it basically comes down too everything he knows is wrong. And why is everything in the state that it is in today is one big question. But as the movie progresses it give us all the answers we are looking for. The film isn't set up in a heroic type nature or action adventure type. Its about a man that is a technician and honestly just has bad days at work. And his quest to find the truth and to deal with the situations as they come up. Which is a rare style in this day in age for cinema. M83 did a great job with the music score it brought the film out. Instead of just playing as background music like most films. The score made the scenes more emotional and important. The visuals were astonishing and very uniquie like a tron or ridley scott affair. Joseph has his own style like Ridley Scott which is rare in the industy of todays american cinema. I really can't wait to see what he comes up with in the future as well as the next Tron adventure.
----------
Excellent movie! There were so many twists and turns and surprises! I love when a movie surprises me! And Morgan Freeman is great as always.

The plot was interesting, but spoiler alert...I knew they were clones for the early scenes. For such a hyped movie, it was only fair. Of course...Tom Cruise was good, but that scientology stuff is always in the back of my mind whenever I see him.

Cover is misleading.  Not much screen time for Morgan Freeman, but any time is good.  Tom Cruise and other characters convincing.  An intriguing possibility.
I enjoyed the movie, great effects, the sound cuts out on a part, not a big deal as no one has a dialog during that section.

The story line and acting is fantastic. Some unanswered questions are forgotten as you gravitate to predictability in this otherwise awesome visual experience. I like most every turn in the plot and highly recommend to ardent sci-fi fans.

OBLIVION, with Tom Cruise. It's very much about working for The Machine. I won't elaborate the story further, other than to say that the RottenTomato rating is seriously off on this one, giving it only a middling score. Beautifully filmed, well paced, solid performances. I can see why Cruise bought the graphic novel from whence the story originates (considering his denominational worldview) - but then, I could care less about his "theology".

Considering the NSA revelations about our own gov't spying on us, repeatedly lying to FISA Court, hounding journalists ("Journalism is not terrorism!"), keeping secrets under penalty of death - while citizens are denied the liberty of unbreakable encryption to secure our own private space, this really surpasses The Matrix, and I Robot, in many respects. Stimulating storytelling.

Wake up America. Read WHY AMERICA FAILED, (by Morris Berman) if you're up for an honest challenge. Much in both products to ponder!
I was expecting the worst, it stars Tom Cruise after all, but it really was quite decent...definitely worth watching, and a very interesting storyline...
I enjoyed watching this movie.  The plot was ok but you can see what's coming if you pay attention.  All in all, it was good and I would watch it again.
The special effects were fantastic but the story line was predictable. I found this to be very similar to The Matrix.

Thought the movie was okay. Tom Curise has always done good in action movies. This isn't a Mission Impossible but does have a good bit of action. Would have liked to have seen a lot more of Morgan Freeman here.

Tom Cat saves the human race...again. His dream girl is anorexic. The only black man alive gives his life to save the white people.  Barely an original word spoken here. Also , I had the keep turning the volume up and down because the soundtrack was give times louder then the acting.
Overall the movie was very entertaining and would watch again when it comes out on cable TV!  All the BEST!
I thought the casting and acting was really good. The story was engaging even though the plot holes are huge (lots of poetic license given to the writer).
Excellent futuristic movie.  At the beginning it is a little slow but once the action starts the movie kept my attention all the time.

Despite some fairly critical reviews and only middling box-office performance, I found this to be a perfectly enjoyable, and occasionally surprising sci-fi film. I doubt it will ever be considered a classic but it has great actors, the now-commonplace amazing special effects, and an engaging story line. It is well worth a couple of hours to watch.
This movie was very interesting and full of twists and turns. I did not forsee what was to come in the end.

If you are a Sci-Fi lover then you will enjoy this movie. I thought the acting was very good, the visuals and sound were excellent, and the story was good. My biggest complaint would be that I thought the story could have been expanded on and had more depth to it where we saw more of who the aliens were, more of where they came from, and more of what they were like. You really never get a sense of this and it is a little disappointing. Overall though a very good movie.

There is standard: aliens occupy earth and one nicely delivered nuke solves the problem. I really liked visual effects tho. Nice cinematography. If you don't expect a lot than a movie can offer laid back pleasure (you can text mes and talk on the phone in the same time without loosing part of the plot).
I was very pleased with this movie. I felt it turned out to be significantly better than I was prepared for.

Classic Sci-Fi film from a director with a fantastic eye for the genre. Clean, crisp cinematography and a real character with simple central problem (beyond the usual "save the world in 90 minutes" story) elevate this movie into another class. Way more heart than I was expecting. It's a shame Hollywood doesn't make more films like this.

Not sure what I was expecting going into this movie, but I'm thinking because Tom Cruise is in it, it looked like another action movie of his it has to be good, right?  Not so much. Maybe it was just me but I didn't really "get it".  It was just okay for me, couldn't wait for it to be over.

I want to give this 2 stars because the story is choppy at best, it is hard to follow at times, and I find Tom Cruise's acting painful at times.  Once again I got fooled into renting another Tom Cruise Action movie from a great trailer and being left disappointed.  I went with three stars however because some of the special effects are great and I love the actual plot (which I won't share since it is a big spoiler).  Better actor and smoother story and this easily could have been 4 out of 5 stars.

Sadly my wife could not understand it.  One particular problem is with the female roles.  None of the them speak clearly and project their voices such that the audience can understand their words.  The problem may be with the producers not understanding speech quality and thus producing poor quality sound (voices) and sometimes coupled with loud background music.  This problem seems to be typical in many movies today but certainly not all of them.  This one has a lot of big noise scenes but the voice only ones stink.  Overall, if one understands the intent the viewer can watch and be entertained but many people will be lost.
I enjoyed the futuristic movie. It keeps you in plugged in the whole time. I would suggest this movie for any family.

We really enjoyed this movie. You understand, going in, that this is a science fiction movie, but it appears to be a post-apocalyptic movie. Actually, it is both. Without giving away anything, the enjoyable part is that there are a few twists to the plot make it just a bit suspenseful but also answers questions you have. The acting was solid and the special effects weren't overly done and only used as necessary.

I like Cruize and I like Morgan...together you think this would be great...They both took the money and run in this deal...this movie was terrible from beginning to end...The droids were the only cool thing in the movie...Sad...

I am not a Tom Cruise fan but he is outstanding in this movie. Very good story line and something new for Hollywood. Tom Cruise's Scientology joke of an issue withstanding I would recommend this movie.
From trailers you might think it is an action movie, but it is pretty straight forward scifi, if you are a scifi fan you probably will like this movie.
I actually like almost any thing Tom Cruise does and Morgan Freeman adds to it.  Cool action and great twists!!
This movie could have been so much more...action..plot builing was weak..characters were weak...just not the best movie.  but passes the night easily...

A mish mash of a lot of sci-fi movies and ideas, but in a totally entertaining and quality way. Highly recommend.
Excellent movie. Tom cruise did an excellent job. Beautiful setting. To vruise did an excellent job portraying so many characters.

Oblivion was very action packed with a lot of awesome  FX effects.  The story and actors was entertaining  as I'm a sci fi  fan from way back enjoy watching this. The only thing missing was the popcorn..

It is a generally entertaining movie.  Just don't think too hard regarding the plot holes and you're fine.  Take it for what it is, a summer turn off the brain popcorn movie.  It was way better than Prometheus.
Good movie starts out slow but pay attention to the details.  Good action and story line.  I would rent it again.

What can I say. I like Tom Cruise & Morgan Freeman as actors. But this movie is really not something I expected to  see either of them in. This movie definitely left a lot to be desired. My opinion is, you have two wonderful actors and no story or chance for the actors to use their numerous skills.

Pretty good movie. I like that the plot changes towards the end. Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman should do more work together.

I would have to say this movie is great! Definitely for anyone who is into some future end of the world sci-fi type of movies, its orginial and makes u think

This movie was moocho bueno!!!! Good stuff it gave me a boner 'specially that Olga chick!! Whoowee!!! The ginger was pretty juicy to. Buy I love the other chick. Id drag her into a dark alley and beg her to have sex with me.

A well made movie with a good story and satisfying ending with enough action and plot twists to be engaging start to finish.  Tom did a great job being a fix-it guy and being believable.  Great performance and interesting cinematography for the flashbacks, well done.

I wish I could get a refund for my purchase. I have a fairly high speed internet connection and have no problems streaming high-def music and videos from other websites, but the quality for this rental was atrocious.

From the very beginning of the piracy warnings before the movie even started, the poor quality of the stream rendered the viewing experience impossible. I tried resetting my connection and rebooting my computer to no avail. The video was extremely low-quality even when I wasn't viewing on fullscreen, not that it should matter.

I wish I could get a refund for my purchase. This low quality video was not worth $1, much less the $5 I paid for it.

I tried several different ways to write up this review and ended up deleting them all because I can't express the right words.
But here is my direct to the point personal opinion:

This movie is awesome.

Great entertainment and performances by the cast (regardless of how you feel about Tom Cruise he did an excellent job).
If you love sci-fi, action & adventure I highly recommend this film.
It even has a nice love story that isn't cheesy or useless.

The only thing that kept me watching was the cinematography and CGI/A - Morgan Freeman was a draw but his time and talents were wasted on this film. Tom Cruise is boring and typical - every role he plays is the same. Don't pay for this movie in any way - wait for it to come on cable.

The trailer for this movie was akin to Cruise's previous sci-fi work 'Minority Report', but is not on the same level.

The story line took long to develop, and the premise is intriguing, but there were lags between.

The visuals were okay, but not groundbreaking or innovative.

An okay watch for sci-fi buffs......

Hmm. I am Tom Cruise. I can ride a motor cycle. I can fly my flying machine. I can fix drones. I am pretty. Could this be anything else but a statement about Tom Cruise by Tom Cruise?
Premise of the movie and the scenery were interesting but everything else was lost on me.  Why did Morgan Freeman even associate himself with this one?
If you like sci-fi this movie's for you, but don't expect too much. I enjoyed it although it was very predictable.
Great movie. I highly enjoyed this one and would recommend. Tom Cruise does this one justice. The story, special effects are awesome.
it was a very good movie for tom cruise was more meat to the story... only problem I had had was sound quality wasn't good had to have the volume on the tv turned way up

Well acted, good twists. Beautiful sets and special effects. Paced well to develop suspense. Normally I am not a huge Tom Cruise guy, but he did not overact in this one.

Beautifully done effects, hinting at the destruction of Earth with major landmarks making cameos throughout, gives you the feeling of emptiness, even though the supposed civilization is a few thousand miles away. Morgan Freeman gives his usual role as the "father" of events to come, which I(don't know about you) never, ever get tired of. Tom Cruise doesn't let down, as he pushes for answers as his current reality and questions come to pass. As the story continues to march forward, you find yourself linking events slowly together, even as a major plot is revealed rather early in the movie. That is something that most movies fail to accomplish. All the way to the very last scene, I was satisfied. Watch this if you haven't.

As a teenager in the 80s, I never understood the Tom Cruise (and Brad Pitt) phenomenon. I think that Tom Cruise had gotten a lot better as he's gotten older. And for me that says a lot; I wish I could say the same for Brad Pitt (Note: I hated Brad Pitts version of World War Z, I mean whats the point? If you're not going to stay true to the book, why not just hire a bunch of screenwriters to write a zombie movie and slap a title on it?.....) Sorry....

I enjoyed the storyline, and unlike other boys and girls out there, no, I did not wonder why Morgan Freeman wore shades throughout the entire movie. I am perturbed that people have many questions they feel were unanswered, so I'm going to answer some of those questions:

if the aliens have the technology to build enormous universe-traversing spaceships, build and deploy hundreds of enormous factories from that ship that are capable of draining energy from out oceans over the course of decades, and deploy hundreds of nigh-bulletproof drones armed with laser cannons to protect them, why in the hell did they need an army of Tom Cruises (TC) and Emily Riseboroughs (ER)?

Well, boys and girls, in this instance it was one super-brain narcissitic alien running the show with a lot of drones. Do you really think a narcissitic alien would allow its own kind to live and rule along side it? No. "Sally", was the only alien. It deployed numerous clones of Tom and Emily because it couldn't leave it's triangular vehicle without putting itself in danger, and enter earth's atmosphere to fight, it's too large and it would be vulnerable.  It required an army of humans to defeat humans. Just like we have antibiotics....(what is happening in our education system that this question was even posed?)

what happened to the other at-least-50 Tom Cruises and at-least-51 Emily Rossboroughs?
The ones in the ship? they died along with "Sally"
The ones on earth? Well, who knows?  But it must've been hell waking up that morning.

* Why Does "Tech 49" Have Jack Harper's Memories if He's a Clone?
That is a good question and I'm glad it was asked because that means a majority of the population see clones as individualistic, having their own personalities and souls. My only answer is because it's fiction.

I would recommend Oblivion, I found it entertaining and afterwards, like many, asked many questions that had nothing to do with the movie. Let's remember that this is fiction, and most screen writers do not have a technical degree, that's why it's fiction.

As Im a fan of these two Stars, plus the previews ( Some can be misleading as we all know) I decided on getting this. My Wife and I really did enjoy it, there is a lot of action parts and some intense parts as well. I would buy it again. - Chris .

I have mixed emotions about this movie.  I was a little disappointed with it the first time I saw it, but watched it again several hours later and found that I appreciated it more and was able to ignore some of the holes in the plot (and it would be hard to describe them without giving away too much).  The main things are these:  It's handsomely, even spectacularly, made with an interesting premise, a lot of fascinating action between the characters, and a thoroughly satisfying resolution.  And I feel that those who rip this movie apart do so because it wasn't what they expected.  I hate to label it a thinking person's film, but to some degree it is, which is surprising, since it is based on a graphic novel and some of the action scenes seem straight out of a high tech video game.  But that's just a small part of it and most of the film revolves around intriguing characters. The director has created an amazing world here, with very good acting and some spectacular effects.  I went back and watched it a third time and liked it even more and intend to add the Blu-ray to my collection.  This is an excellent movie, and I just don't understand some of the hostility that has been directed towards it.  I think that it's a triumph for director Kosinsky and his wonderful crew.

Follow-up: I did indeed buy it here on Blu-ray, and think of it as just short of 5 stars -- and I swear that my eyes fill with tears during the final moments every single time I've watched it! This is sci-fi with a heart, and a triumph for all involved in the making of it. Every time I see it, I like it more than I did the previous time! And I strongly recommend ALL the special features!

I would like to start by saying I love science fiction.  I was raised in the heady days of Apollo and my literary tastes eventually included the entire pantheon of speculative fiction from Asimov to Zelazny.  I saw Star Wars 16 times in the theater after I got out of boot camp.  I was never a Trekker, but I watched the first series and Next Generation.  I even liked Wall-E.  The first time, that is, not this version.  This is a pastiche of plots from a wide swath of SciFi, and not a tasty one.  Cruise is and will always be a bad actor.  Good directors shoot his emotional scenes using shots of his back because his face never matches his vocal delivery or body language.  He may have embraced his faith as a way of explaining the weird somatic separation in his acting.  In this dog he is on-screen nearly the entire time, trying to be dramatic and achieving elevated levels of boredom.  If you like predictable garbage, this turds for you.

Best sci-fi movie I've seen in a long while. (Of course, that's damning with faint praise considering the lowly state of most sci-fi these days.) Despite a few shortcomings, most aspects of Oblivion are a cut above the standard. First, the storyline is genuinely intriguing, even if it ultimately fails to generate that ineffable sense of wonder that the best sci-fi is capable of. (I give it points for an earnest attempt, though.) Second, the movie is visually stunning, especially during the first half. Sunsets bathe the characters in a moody radiance; the vistas of a ravaged Earth are close to breathtaking; camera angles immerse the viewer in the action in inventive ways; and the tech is both totally believable and pretty darn cool. Third, the film displays an intelligence that is increasingly rare in Hollywood and therefore most welcome. The only real downside is the reliance (as is so common these days) on a multitude of action set-pieces, one after the other. However, the pacing leaves sufficient room to breathe between each fight/chase sequence that the viewer doesn't feel overwhelmed. My biggest gripe about the movie (and it's an admittedly small one) is the payoff line Tom Cruise's character utters at the climax. He literally just finishes quoting Tacitus or some similar Roman poet-historian, only to follow that with the most cringe-inducing of vulgar epithets. If that's the filmmakers' idea of an inspirational sound bite, then they sorely miscalculated. Aside from that misstep, though, Oblivion gets most things right and proves to be a wholly enjoyable entertainment that respects the audience's intelligence. Recommended.

Bottom line:  This is your typical Hollywood attempt at a big budget science fiction flick.  It has good initial primary character development, good plot, then sort of fizzles out at the end.  If you've seen the indie sci-fi flick "Moon," you'll likely end up underwhelmed.  Read on, ONLY if you're not afraid of SPOILERS.

Now to the nitty gritty- The movie gives you a place to start, a premise for the story, and throws in some  amazing special effects to wow audiences.  Tom Cruise's character is a "yes" man who spends the first hour of the movie discovering there's more than meets the eye  (Sort of like George Clooney's "Solaris"- There are unanswered questions.  The second half of the movie is spent turning a good sci-fi theme into an action flick.  A woman from a dream, his wife, joins him on the roller coaster of a ride, again more showy special effects.  In the last twenty-five minutes, the movie seems to rush, running out of time to wrap everything up into a nice, neat package.  It doesn't quite do the plot justice.

The end of this movie is just too "live happily ever after," without the emotional attachment- All the surviving, underdeveloped minor characters come together after the heroic salvation of the human race, and the movie ends.

In short, this movie is a story turned mediocre Hollywood.
I love sci-fi movies but only those with a convincing story and plot. Although the plot is simple, still holds a few surprises. It is a bit slow at the beginning but still very enjoyable

Still for his second only movie Kosinsky is a very talented Director with a great team.  Let's have more like this and not the usual shoot'em up disaster types.

The first three-quarters of Oblivion wasn't so bad.  I found it intriguing enough to hold my attention and keep me interested.  By the end of my first viewing, however, I was completely stumped.  What was I not understanding?  So...I watched it again.  I even enjoyed it more the second time than the first but wham! Got to the end and was again completely baffled.  I guess I'll have to consult someone much smarter than I (not hard) to help me understand what in the world is going on because Oblivion isn't providing any obvious clues.  Why the unnecessary complications?  The rest of the movie was enjoyable to watch but was also fairly standard sci-fi stuff when it comes right down to it.  I doubt that I ever want to watch it again simply because of it's confusing nature.  I have to ask: Why mess with the audience that way?  Why not write a script that clearly explains what's going on?  Too much is simply left dangling which ultimately destroys the entire movie except for the fact that the graphics and other aspects of the movie are quite stunning and interesting.

I was somewhat loathe to give Oblivion 3 stars; it really deserves a weak 2.5 stars.  Oh yes, just as a side note, one other aspect of this movie that I just couldn't understand:  Victoria/Vika's eyes were so dilated throughout most of the movie that it was as if she was on LSD or something.  Actually, when she first appears, I thought she was meant to be some kind of android or something.  Her behavior was also very unhumanlike; more robotic than human.  And the very obvious fake eyelashes of hers in the year 2077?  I mean, here they can clone humans and develop all these high tech gadgets and weapons, but can't come up with a more realistic looking fake eyelash?  And again, what's with those eyes of hers?  In addition, anyone who's ever had their pupils dilated that much knows how sensitive to light your eyes become, often forcing the person to wear sunglasses.  Again, there is never any reason or explanation made apparent for this.

In the end, there are just way too many plot holes and logical inconsistencies to truly "sell" this movie to me.  I was on board for the better part of the movie until the end.  Sorry, the director, writers and producers failed to close the deal with me on this one and yet made a film with some saving graces as well.  I just wish I knew what the hell was actually supposed to be going on.

Oblivion is an interesting and refreshing entry in the Sci-Fi genre.  Lately the Sci-Fi films that have come out are mainly style over substance.  The Transformers films are ones that quickly come to mind.  I am a big fan of science fiction!  Oblivion and the new Star Trek movie are the two movies that I wanted to see most this summer.  I was not disappointed with this film!  Oblivion is a film that makes you think.  When I watched this film in the theater I did not fully understand what was going on.  When I thought about it more on the way home I began to piece everything together.  I like science fiction films that can do that.  This film reminded me of films like Blade Runner and 2001: A Space Odyssey in terms of the atmosphere and tone.  It also reminded me of films like Wall-e and I Am Legend.

The special effects of this movie are fantastic.  This film is able to create a beautiful looking world, and immersing the audience in it.  The action scenes, when there are action scenes, are very well done.

The character of Jack, played by Tom Cruise, I found to be likable and interesting and wanted to know more about.  Morgan Freeman's character is also likable.  The other characters though are pretty bland.

Oblivion is also quite slow and has a slow build especially at the beginning.  There is not much action in this movie either.  The common movie viewer might not like this film, because there is not a ton of action in it.  The trailer built the movie up as an action-packed Sci-Fi film with Tom Cruise, but that is not what this is.  However, I find Oblivion a very refreshing and enjoyable Sci-Fi film.

This film is a post-modern take on "Mother issues", masquerading as the sci-fi. Freud had argued that the original sexual object for both sexes in the mother. In this film, our couple receives the orders from Sally, played by Melissa Leo. Sally is their commander and is stationed on a space station that orbits the Earth (or so it seems). Sally is an older woman, a thinly-veiled representation of the mother. The ordeal of Jack (Tom Cruise) is to go through tests orchestrated by Sally and to become a man. He is to become Vika's "rescuer". Psychoanalysts know that a man can lose all sexual attractiveness for a woman from the moment that he shows some sort of complicity with her mother. Vika's case is complicated by a love triangle, but the essence of the movie is this: Jack had to quit any compliance with the mother (plus mother-in-law, Sally was actually both) in order to become a man and a husband, albeit to another women. I recommend this film.

This is not really a review - many previous posters have done fine work in that area. What I wanted to comment on, since so many have commented on its lack of originality, is what I felt the protogenic sources to be.

Here goes - in no particular order:

Independence Day - ending's almost a rip-off - nuclear weapon smuggled into the alien mother ship for big bang ending. Not as much jaunty camaraderie as its precursor, but replete w/ verbal jousting vs.the captor(s).

The Time Machine - remake w/ Guy Pierce in which the moon is destroyed, causing all sorts of natural calamities.

Star Wars - the living quarters "Towers 49 & 52", are somewhat reminiscent of Bespin, the city in the clouds. The "scavs" are reminiscent of Ewoks w/ their distorted voices, and the Jawa, w/ their illuminated eyes; also evocative of the Tusken Warriors (Sand People) from Tatooine.

Alien/Aliens - Ripley was in cryosleep for 57 years; the Odyssey crew was in cold storage for 60 years.

I'm sure other viewers will see other antecedent films; maybe some Star Trek, Terminator, and of course, other Tom Cruise films, wherein he plays a similar character.

One brief comment about a somewhat confusing scene - having already met her, why does Morgan Freeman bother to introduce himself to Julia after his second-in-command, Sykes, in a previous scene, has already held a gun to her head, in Freeman's presence, and seemingly w/ his approval? Did this simply not make it to the film editors' attention?

I almost didn't get this movie, because the critics tore it apart.  However, after reading the reviews on Amazon, I decided to buy it.  I am glad I did.

Everyone agrees that this movie is visually stunning.  It is, but let's get past that.  Right off the bat, you are made to think about what is happening.  You have the strange feeling that something isn't quite what it appears, but you don't know what.  Funny, but that is exactly the feeling of Tom Cruise's character.  Throughout the movie, it takes twists and turns that you didn't expect.

The video and audio are excellent.  The casting was great.  Look, if you need a guy with an intense stare that doesn't quite know what is going on, Tom Cruise is perfect.  If you need someone to project that he really does know what is going on, Morgan Freeman is the natural choice.  The rest of the cast Was excellent, each portraying their characters to a tee.  Special credit to Melissa Leo for adding some incipient creepiness which was fun to watch.

Now, why did I ignore all those one-star reviews?  First, those who said the movie was bad because they didn't understand it, put the blame in the wrong place.  Second, those who cried, "bad science", need to understand that the movie is entertainment, not education.  Sure, hydrogen is the most available element in the universe, but that does not prevent some visually interesting ways of obtaining it.  Yes, the story borrowed from other works.  The final destruction of the orbiting platform was straight out of ID4, but it made sense in the context of this movie, and that is what really matters.

I will be the first to admit that I have been put off by reports of Tom's personal life. However, this movie proves he is indeed a very talented actor. I was immediately drawn into this movie and the gorgeous scenery, and the story line that Pulled you along for the ride. The story was revealed at an appropriate pace and there were intense scenes scattered throughout that had you on the edge of your seat. One of the most enjoyable movies I've seen in awhile.
I really like this sci-fi action flix. It's a great thrill ride of action and story. Tom and Morgan really set the stage and make Oblivion an enjoyable world to see.
lots of action that supported the story line. A plot that was quite interesting and clever to the end. my second viewing was just as exciting and answered a few questions.

I managed to finally view this film On Demand one evening through my busy work schedule, I was looking forward to it because most of my friends gave it positive reviews. This film is absolutely beautiful, the films backdrops and settings are gorgeous, the plot (while kind of predictable halfway through) seems quite original to me even though many critics have panned it for being derivative of other science fiction works. The musical score is absolutely brilliant, great blend of bombastic brass sections and electronics (M83 is to thank for that). I highly recommend this film to science fiction fanatics and just movie goers who are interested in action films, it's quite an energetic ride and as always, Tom Cruise delivers a very good performance and so does the remainder of the supporting cast, especially Morgan Freeman, whose character is quite an interesting one. Enjoy.

Truly outstanding! Not so sure about Olga who played Julia. Though it is highly unlikely, a prequel would make the pair an effective team.
The movie stands alone as an impressive total package: sound, production values, imagery, acting.

When your sci-fi story starts with a man who has odd dreams about a woman he's never met and who also acknowledges that his work requires a routine "memory sweep," then it's a safe bet that viewers with their heads on straight will be able to have a general idea where things are headed. At the very least, it is clear from the get-go that this is one of those stories where "nothing is as it seems."

Very much a Tom Cruise vanity piece, Oblivion follows Jack Harper, a man who is stationed on Earth with his co-worker and lover, Victoria. At some point in the past, aliens called "Scavs" attacked Earth for its precious resources. They succeeded in demolishing the moon, but humans won the war in a sort of petulant "if we can't have it, no one can" move by detonating all of their nukes, turning most of the planet into a radiated wasteland. The humans now live on Titan, getting most of their energy from huge devices that remain on Earth, sucking up what's left of the oceans for cold fusion. Scavs remain on the planet, mostly just being irritating and trying to destroy the water suckers. These Scavs are normally dealt with by a series of robotic drones, but like all things mechanical, the drones occasionally break. It is Jack and Victoria's job to monitor the drones, fix them when they need it, and otherwise just hang out looking impossibly sexy.

Of course, things are not what they seem.

The story is actually very well-constructed and shot beautifully, and although the tale's secrets are parceled out much more slowly than is necessary (the movie could've been about thirty minutes shorter), it does lend the film a classy sober quality that might've otherwise been made cartoonish with its almost too-slick sci-fi sleekness. Every performer does a great job, although the flick doesn't ask for a whole lot from its cast, and the story lasts longer than its credits. It's a movie that lingers in the mind, which is rare these days.

There are a few rough spots, but these come mostly at the end. The movie gets a bit pretentious as it nears its close, seeming to think it's deeper and more meaningful than it actually is. There's also a pretty significant plot hole when it comes to our Good Guy finally defeating our Bad Guy, and the movie engages in a last-minute, unsatisfying cop-out in its (unnecessary) bid for a completely happy ending. These things aside, the movie is truly engaging, and although it sometimes feels like just an excuse to show off how freaking amazing Tom Cruise looks (the phrase "for his age" doesn't even apply), it's still pretty good fare.

For the first 40 minutes or so it was sort of dole,and plain it starts off tom cruise telling that there was an alien invasion that tried to take over the earth,and the humans won. Then as always something comes falling from the sky then it gets interesting be the lest.things start to fall into place and the truth what really happened long ago is not what he thought or told. There are some twist in the film and some surprises.
It's all about Tom Cruise as usual. If your a fan of his you will love it. I thought the story line was just ok.

A miss from start to finish. We kept waiting for something to happen, but it played out with a boreing predictability.

I'm not a Tom Cruise fan but I am a sci-fi addict so needed something new.  This one is great - nice twist at the end, Morgan Freeman is great (as always) and even Tom managed to be believable and not too cocky like most of his movies. Recommend this one.

After watching GI Joe yesterday, this was a refreshing, uplifting and thought provoking movie.  The story was slow to build; and I really did not know where it was going to take me.  Of course, I did not read any reviews since I would have liked it for the most part since I am a Tom Cruise fan.  However, I was captivated by the story.  Oblivion was better than Jack Reacher and I thought to date that was Tom's best movie after Mission Impossible III.  Now Oblivion has moved to the top of my List for Tom Cruise movies.

Decent Acting, but then, it wasn't that much of a challenge.  Decent story, and to me, there was a metaphysical, deeper meaning.  Great special effects.  Very hot leading actress.  The ending was interesting... I don't want to spoil that for you!  If you like Sci-Fi, Watch It!!!

First off, I enjoyed this movie. Why? The environment provided, and the acting as scripted in the situation provided. I saw all the plot holes and the problems with the film, but the redeeming quality is the smoothness the characters glue this film together with. I was not looking forward to action scenes,the movie provided for the imaginative of the viewers. The movie provided plot twists that justified my attention and being there. I try not to ruin a movie for myself, even if the plot suggests an outcome. I sit back and repress the ideas I have and let the movie present them as they see fit. The thing this movie did for me, as compared to others is gave me room to think about what was going on between scenes. Yes, this was a movie that was a compiled bunch of ideas from other movies and such, but that's a management issue,and not the movies fault. I think the actors did the best with what they were given(sloppy mess maybe?) and executed well. The main problem and I've mentioned this before is that to present a good sci-fi, you must adopt a written work and then massage it. This was not done here and it shows. Still, this is light years ahead of Transformers, Battledshit, and Pacicifc Rum. I still ask producers with deep pockets to look at real stories like Tau Zero, The Mote in Gods Eye, and the Giants Novels specifically 'Inherit the Stars' for a blockbuster, major budget production that will leave the audience contemplating the ideals of the plot for weeks is not years. I am looking forward to Enders Game, although I don;t really consider that a real sci-fi masterpiece, but it should prove better than things like Pacific Rum and Battleship(aka stupidity). Of course the demographics show a really stupid populace and until that changes, we may be in store for more mind numbing nonsense.
Movie aptly named.  It feels after 15 minutes like it will never end.  If I could rate it -1 I would.  Cruise should be paying you to watch this.
Visually a feast but poor plot line. I had to watch it a second time to figure out exactly how the story all fit together.
This was a slow moving movie and lacked quality special effects. It almost reminds me of a old Star Wars movie, it might be the guns that they use, they look like something a storm trooper would use.

Extrapolation basis: I like: Alien, 2001, The Matrix, Dark Star, Terminator, Trigun...

Unlike most movies advertised as sci-fi, Oblivion is a genuine science-fiction story in movie form. As opposed to such staples as the war movie (with aliens), the horror movie (with aliens), or the western (with ray guns).  Unfortunately I personally didn't find any of the characters really engaging, and the plot holes were impossible to ignore while watching it (and they multiply every time I think about it).  So as story-driven sci-fi I would give it only three stars, but I give it another star for its beautiful & constructive use of CGI, landscape, architecture and equipment.  If Ikea made sci-fi movies, they might look like this.  Uh... except for the costuming of the scavengers: Cliche, ugly AND implausible, and they double down on this mistake with a lame explanation in-movie.

My thought as the ending credits rolled was that Oblivion is a sci-fi short story, or at most a novella, trying to support a large-screen full-length movie, and it just doesn't have the lifting power for that job. "Moon" in some ways works the same territory but seems better scaled to its material.  Nonetheless, if you like science fiction, Oblivion an enjoyable 2 hours of very nice looking science-fictiony stuff happening on screen.

I expect "Are you an effective team?" to be an office joke among nerds for a while.

Running time approx. 2 hr.  7.1 HD-DTS. This move gives subtle spoofs on Tom Cruises late movie (TOP GUN), and is a (half-baked) twisted modification of the late (2001 Space Odyssey). This movie is both stunning and disappointing at the same time. I think this movie could have been a huge hit, if it was more hardcore, bloody, and had strange creatures in it. Furthermore, the drab, dull and boring love story portrayed in this film did nothing for the movie, accept destroy it. Morgan Freeman is way too powerful of an actor to be in a movie like this. This is why his roll was short lived. Morgan Freeman practically cancelled out Tom Cruise, and seemed out of place in a movie like this. Overall, the cutting edge CGI effects in this movie were stunning! And the sci-fi (futuristic other worldly) panoramic sky, land, and sea scape's were also very stunning and brilliant. There are some dull, dry and boring areas in this movie; however its sheer sophistication will hold your attention. Based on the impact of the high quality production of this movie, I have to give it a solid (5) star rating, even though its really a disappointment in the end. The storyline has numerous holes, and leaves you with more questions than answers...in actuality the movie really doesn't make any sense at all, and will leave you scratching your head. However, for the sake of pure entertainment, its great. This movie has NO similarities to Star Wars, Tron, and Transfromers...at all! But you (WILL) see profound influences from 2001 Space Odyssey...I can promise you that. Those are the facts. Thank you.
Interesting twist that I didn't see coming and a unique plot, more special effects would have earned this a five star rating.

From beginning to end this movie was just one big cliche after another.  There was nothing unique about it at all.  The video quality was okay but not outstanding for an HD picture.  At best is seemed to reach an acceptable 720 but it never seemed to display the sharpness of a 1080 picture.

Slow getting started and sometimes a little confusing.  Overall an OK picture.  Glad I did not pay for this at the movies.  I am not a big Morgan Freeman fan  but luckily his parts in the movie are minimal.
If you like sci-fi, watch this movie.  Fantastic and original premise, plot, and ending.  Those who give it a low review should stick to other genres.
I have no idea what I just watched. This movie is boring and Tom Cruise is terrible in it. The movie made no sense. Is there a colony on Titan?

The imagery alone is enough to like this movie but it also has a great plot, one where you think you know what's going on but what you think isn't what's real. I don't like Tom, but he did a fantastic job and I'll watch anything with Olga in it.
Came in and played just fine and is a fantastic movie with a great storyline. Sci Fi fans would Love it!!!
Well, Tom Cruise got his pound of flesh out of me. This was a total disappointment.  Tom ought to go full time with Scientology.  What a waste.
Action-packed movie, good entertainment on a Friday night with a bowl of popcorn. You guessed it, I really liked this movie.
All I can say is that I was left confused on this movie. I could not really even follow the plot. Just a strange movie......
I was hoping for a better story line but this did not reach my expectation and I was quite disappointed.

The concept had legs but the execution and character development stalled.  Not worth my time and I have a lot of time.... so doubtful it will be worth yours.  Mass marketing made me watch it.....  I want my 2 hours and 6 minutes back.

I was hesitant when I saw the ads for this one.  I am glad I rented it.  I am not a huge Tom Cruise fan, I think he is overrated.  But this is a bit of a different role for him.  Morgan Freeman is always good.  Great space action movie.  Great twists and turns, not as predictible as I thought it  might be.  Worth the rent, or buy.
Twist and turns, makes you think a lot, and makes you think about it after for awhile. Love IT!- KR

Very good graphics and space scenes. Very week story and predictable outcome. I wasted my time!
Tom Cruz is always good but the movie had no purpose.
Tom Cruise is truely an over-rated actor and the storyline SUCKED!  The movie was no-good in my opinion and it did not make any sense.  What was it about?

Awesome movie! Great special effects was digging Tom's mini spaceship car & glass house in the sky plus the killer drones were cool too! Tom Cruise still looks good for 51 !  See this! This was better than Olympus Has Fallen!
Got a rainy day and nothing to do. Watch it.  But don't plan to engage your intellect.  Plot is obvious and the flashbacks are distracting...

Love science fiction, but this movie fell pretty flat. Special Effects, which were very good in this film, cannot make up for the wooden performance of Tom Cruise. Morgan Freeman couldn't even save this movie. An interesting premise that got so convoluted by the end of the film you just didn't care anymore. Not the wisest $4.99 I've ever spent but I'm glad i did not pay to see it in the theater!
overall good movie great effect, scenery are very beautiful, some of the effect are a little far fetch,  worth buying
Cruise and cast good, but slow to develop story line - how did earth get that way, not really explainded or clear.
Not sure why this movie took such a hit in the box office.  It is not great, but all and all a good action flix.  I would recommend it.

I am not one to write reviews of movies that try to emulate professionals critics.  I just write about what I like.  Tom Cruise has not been one of my favorites in the past, but he played a great role in this movie, as did everyone else in the movie.  This is a great, not good, great science fiction movie in my humble opinion.  The effects were great, scenery was amazing, and the story was damn good.  As usual with A list movies, there was great production values (lighting, cutting, music, dialog, etc.) and honestly, this story was intriguing and very interesting.  If you like good Sci-Fi, you will like this movie.
My husband and I both watched this movie together and we both enjoyed it very much.  It took some unexpected twists.

This is a good film, primarily because it seems to borrow from every other sci-fi film I like. You like terminator? Check. You like Blade Runner? Check. <fill in about a dozen more movies here> ... the Roeper review said it was like a talented cover band ... not original, but well executed. I agree - CGI was really good, acting okay. Plot dragged in spots, ending was a little empty, and I felt they could have made a better movie if they edited down ~20-30 minutes out of it.

But overall, I enjoyed it.
I watched it but need to re-watch it.  Not sure whether I liked it or not.  I'll decide on the second time around

Saw this movie in the Theater, and it was amazing.  As soon as it was available as a pre-order, I ordered it.

Glad it finally arrived.  I need to stop using the free whenever it arrives it arrives shipping.

Interesting twist on the alien invasion of earth idea, had me going with a few twist plots and questions through most of the movie.

Visuals and specials effects are top notch.  Audio is expertly matched to the moods to help drive home the feels behind the actions.

I highly recommend this movie.
Not sure what I liked so much about this movie so a review will be difficult. Clever plot, Cruise was great, and the movie was serene, interesting, and nostalgic.
I'd give it 5 stars, but it has a little bit of unnecessary nudity.  Not much really, but it kinda killed it for me.

Great concept poor delivery.  The movie was interupted due to download spooling that I turned it off.  At one point, it completely went dead and I had to reorder the movie.  Was not happy with the service and I would probably stick with Netflix or On Demand video.  I price was attractive but I wouldnt recommend it.
This movie was well paced, good plot twist and fantastic action scene! i would deff buy it on blu ray!

This movie wasn't bad.  It could have been 30 minutes shorter, but it is entertaining.  The movie moves at a very slow pace, but not because it is building the suspense, and giving you the feeling of being in the movie.  Just because it is way too long.

The movie was actually a little boring.

There is one part, when Jack discovers the plot line, and you are expecting the action to start from that point, and become interesting.

However, there is a litte action scene, and then back to the dramatic dialogue between the man and woman, and more of the love story in a secure place.  It just didn't make sense.

There is no sense of urgency in the film.  Urgency first to discover sinister plot is going on.  Then once the plot is discovered, urgency to fix the problem of peril. Those are the types of things that keep you on the edge of your seat, and interested in watching a movie.

Jack and is partners characters aren't developed in the time before the plot becomes known.

I like Tom Cruise movies a lot.  I find MOST of his movies very good.

This movie could not be called an action film, nor a thought provoking flick.

The storyline is an intersting idea, but execution is very bland.

There are no unexpected plot twists, which you would expect from such a slow movie to unfold.

A sharp contrast to this film would be one of my favorite, Vanilla Sky.

Some of my favorite Tom Cruise movies have been Vanilla Sky, Magnolia, Jack Reacher, War of the Worlds(although it really fizzled out at the end), and Minority Report(a little corny, but watcheable)

If you want to watch it, there aren't any major holes in the story, just that the movie doesn't envoke much in the viewer.

OK, this movie confused my girlfriend - and she's a PhD graduate. Being an engineer, I've seen some loose ends and reverse-engineered and debugged some seriously messed up code, but this almost takes the cake. (Mmmmm, cake) I finally put a good couple theories together by the 1/2 of the movie, and by 2/3 of the movie they were confirmed; but, sweet Jeebus, was this convoluted. Yes, the tech displayed was superb, but some of the acting was a bit cold fish in my opinion.

As Colin Ferguson said in Boston's Wilbur Theatre a while back (paraphrasing here) "that's 6-foot crazy in a 5'2" body"
Good cast and acting. Good storyline. Plenty of action and kept you on the edge of your seat but a bit long of a movie.
I liked the movie. I liked the plot and the implementation. Don't want to spoil anything for those who did not see the movie, so will stay away from specifics.

I don't understand why this did so poorly at the theater, but if you like Science Fiction, this movie is pretty good

Oblivion, the first thought a lot of people had was that it was video game based. Or so most of the people who I knew, that had seen the trailer.

I really didn't think this film would pass the test but it certainly did. Beware: this film has a plot, a couple of twists, and a solid ending. Tread carefully.

Who wrote that Editorial review? It has to  be a Cruse relative...

This movie is a mess. I got lost, no the movie was so pointless that halfway through I gave up trying to find some thread of redeeming social value.

Then the movie tried to make itself interesting, still with no decent plot line and then they tried to inject a plot line and then they raced to make the injected plot line relavent and then at the end they raced to patch together an ending and to be quite honest I never understood what the heck was going on at the end and I'm an educated person. This movie was very beautiful most of the time, but the producers spent so much time making it pretty that someone forgot they needed to tell a cogent story. This movie is a mess... I might buy it when it gets to $.01 for the beauty of the first half after that, forget it.
Give it a chance.  I was pleasantly surprised with this movie.  A lot better than I thought it was going to be.  I found myself thinking about it days after we watched it.  Very good.

In all a fair SF movie.  Was surprised that the writers and technical (graphics) people actually put in scenes that had major plot implications right at the beginning.  I thought at first they had made the usual technical mistake I often see where the words don't match the pictures (HISTORY CHANNEL should be considered famous for this) but quickly realized about mid-movie that they hadn't.
No, won't spoil the plot.  Probably too confusing for most if not all movie reviewers, I don't remember a lot of reviews on the radio or in the papers and apparently it had a short run time at the theaters.

Recommend if you haven't seen it.
A little tough to follow at times but was good. Too bad Morgan Freeman didn't have a bigger part though.

Having watched this and past Cruise SciFi, I now know why he is so good in these way out there's, how could a Scientologist not stray far from the oak tree. Cruise is a consumate actor  when he develops himself as himself, not a disciple, and pours himself into these fantasies. One wonders how Cruse would have fared without RLH perhaps a star ranking with Woods and Gorcey.
Tom played his part good the show was a way out show .I had to see it two more times to get it All Funny I would see it again

The movie was made well, although I thought it was tad bit puzzling how the transportation aircraft could be knocked out of flight by lightning (??). Especially, given the technology that one would expect in the setting of the movie. Aside from a couple of inconsistencies of that same nature, everything else was good. The effects were innovative and added to the intensity of the action. The plot had a couple of interesting twists and the ending tied it all together. All in all, I would recommend this movie.

If you're into New World Order stuff, freemasonry and numerology, you can get very interesting messages through this movie. If you are also someone that understands how our 'matrix' system works, how Birth Certificates define the way our society is structured, you will also understand why the creators of this movie have chosen the clone theme.

Some messages and 'wink winks' you might or might not have seen in the movie:

1) His number is 49. 4 + 9 = 13 -- 13 is a sacred masonic number

2) Mission communications screen has always the number 33 -- another masonic number

3) Drone 166 is the one who survives all the way to the end of the movie. 1 + 6 + 6 = 13 -- you get the idea.

4) Mission space base shaped as a pyramid capstone, but it's upside down.

5) Mission "brains" inside massive ship has an "all seeing eye" that is red.

6) Julia tells Jack "You don't know who you are" -- (If you understand the Birth Certificate scam, you know what this means)

7) Victoria, when confronted with reality, shouts "I don't want to know!!!" -- Is Victoria a reference to the population in general?

8) Mission says "I created you Jack, I am your God" -- You can take this message anyway you want.

9) Jack Harper at the end is number 52. 5 + 2 = 7 -- A sacred number in the Christian Bible.

There is more, but I won't spoil. If you watch the "making of" section, you'll also notice Freemason hand shakes when they meet in the music studio.

All in all this is an excellent movie, I'm glad some producers out there have done their homework when it comes to explaining (for those who want to hear about it) how this world really works.

If you're into New World Order stuff, freemasonry and numerology, you can get very interesting messages through this movie. If you are also someone that understands how our 'matrix' system works, how Birth Certificates define the way our society is structured, you will also understand why the creators of this movie have chosen the clone theme.

Some messages and 'wink winks' you might or might not have seen in the movie:

1) His number is 49. 4 + 9 = 13  --  13 is a sacred masonic number

2) Mission communications screen has always the number 33  -- another masonic number

3) Drone 166 is the one who survives all the way to the end of the movie. 1 + 6 + 6 = 13 -- you get the idea.

4) Mission space base shaped as a pyramid capstone, but it's upside down.

5) Mission "brains" inside massive ship has an "all seeing eye" that is red.

6) Julia tells Jack "You don't know who you are" -- (If you understand the Birth Certificate scam, you know what this means)

7) Victoria, when confronted with reality, shouts "I don't want to know!!!" -- Is Victoria a reference to the population in general?

8) Mission says "I created you Jack, I am your God" -- You can take this message anyway you want.

9) Jack Harper at the end is number 52. 5 + 2 = 7 -- A sacred number in the Christian Bible.

There is more, but I won't spoil. If you watch the "making of" section, you'll also notice Freemason hand shakes when they meet in the music studio.

All in all this is an excellent movie, I'm glad some producers out there have done their homework when it comes to explaining (for those who want to hear about it) how this world really works.

Oblivion is a wonderful film with some great philosophical elements to ponder. In many ways, it is a parable that mirrors Genesis, where a "perfect" couple Jack and Victoria live with little worry in an Eden like state where all of their needs are supplied. They are ruled by an authoritative voice, telling them how to live and what to do, in the form of Sally. Their "sin" is that of curiosity, as Jack sought knowledge of the world, instead of his simple task to live well and perform menial tasks. His command is to perform Sally's bidding in obedience, ignorant of the past or even future.  Of course, the wakeup-call of that knowledge leads to rebellion, and ultimately expulsion.

I find it interesting with the analog that Sally is shown to be an incredibly powerful AI, instead of the expected alien beings, with a singular voice, even proclaiming to be Jack's creator and God. Sally shows some concern for Jack and Victoria, though, Sally is an angry and vengeful force when disobeyed, with her  drones sweeping in like angels from above to smite.

It begs the question if there was a different undertone to the story beyond the simple "aliens invade and exterminate everyone". Perhaps as an intelligent being, Sally chose two of Humanity's "best" to start the Earth anew, while whipping out the "evil" of the old world with floods and fire. Perhaps Sally was both malevolent and benevolent, instead of a simple destructive force as seen in the eyes of the human survivors fighting their war. If Sally had succeeded, would she have left Jack and Victoria to repopulate the Earth after she had gone?

All of these stars are for the visuals because they are magnificent. I wish I could say the same for the rest of the film. The story is a mashup of MOON and DEJA VU without the suspense of either. Tom Cruise plays the same character he always plays, only flatter than usual. We never get to see the aliens. Bummer. Be sure you see this film on a big screen because the visual element is the star. Kudos to the folks who make this film look so good.

As someone with a design background, who loves graphic novels and video games it's virtually impossible for me not to see some value in this film. For me this is a gadget lover's movie; in this case the bubble ship. Never mind the story-line, it is paper thin. This movie is like one of those automobile ads where the vehicle for sale is shown in a variety of settings to show off its capabilities. After watching this film I wanted a bubble ship!!!

I'd like my ship to come with the cool sky-house, female not included. If possible, sky-house should have a real color pallet- all white is too bland and pass. My craft should have the motorcycle pull-out bay option, and if possible throw in a killer sound system. No bobble-head figure desired. Not to mention throw in the get me out of earth's orbit and into space package; ya know- for weekend get-away to Mars.
Awesome movie good enough to watch it more than once :-) love the special effects great that its two hours long

It is overlong, and familiar, and never quite hits top gear -- it's never especially bad, but neither is it especially excellent, beyond the visual wow factor. But there's still a lot to admire in the film, not least that it's engaging from the first moment to the last. Better as a Reader!
This ain't your normal sci-fi just trying to make it work with blood, guts, horror and special effects. Nice plot twists will make you think.

The first 50 minutes of the movie is basically Tom and his "girlfriend". She sends him out on missions and he comes back. Nothing much more than that. Around that 50 minute mark, others appear in the movie and this is where it gets confusing.
