This is not a great movie. It is a fairly interesting concept with really spectacular visuals and Tom Cruise acting as Tom Cruise, but it is the overly ambitious script that leaves the movie wanting.  It was just too derivative of too many other movies (warning Spoilerish):  the Matrix, Reign of Fire, Planet of the Apes, iRobot, and even a hint of The Truman Show with too many strands to pull together via too many plot holes to really be a cohesive project.  Morgan Freeman, perhaps too frail and old, is underused.  The ending is contrived and hoaky a la (Spoiler again!)... Independence Day.  The movie does a great job of immersing you in this new world and the thin mystery behind it is slowly, if not deftly, revealed over the course of the film.  It's fun escapism, but the film does not have much to say really, about the human condition.  Neither did Aliens I or II or Star Wars but great sci-fi films either introduce something entirely new and make a fictitious world very real with a great story to tell, or use that world as a backdrop to comment on something about mankind (Signs, for example, where the new world of aliens was used as a backdrop for how a torn and hurting family could come together and renew faith in each other and God).  One or both of those elements need to be present in sufficient quantity for a Sci-Fi film to move from "Fun!" to "Amazing!"  "Oblivion" had some neat elements of a new world with very effective visuals and it had a little something to say about what makes a person human (memories? love? the will to survive?).  So that makes it a somewhat disappointing:  6/10. This film was fun and not amazing and a little bit of a missed opportunity.  Worth a rental for sure, but not in the pantheon.  Those who gave it 5 stars leave little room for actually great science fiction.

As a life-long fan of SciFi it is virtually impossible not to love Oblivion as a state-of-the art visual treat. My only dilemma - is it really possible to like it as a film? For many reasons, I remain conflicted. Without question the SFX are nonpareil, offering a visually stunning depiction of a circa 2077 discarded, dystopian earth now being harvested for its remaining natural resources. The population long since decamped to one of Saturn's moons Titan, leaving a skeleton crew of Sentinels to monitor the extraction machinery and exterminate the rag-tag remains of the "Scavs" who had invaded earth in the 2020's setting off our doomsday spiral. So far so good, especially the performance of Tom Cruise who as "Jack," the sentinel with soul, has remarkably shed his trademarked action-hero disaffection and glowering for something they used to call acting back in the 20th century.

Honestly, I'd be engaged as well if Jack's George Jetson meets Paul Blart blue collarness allowed me to survey the planet from the ultimate, coolest penthouse ever conceived for film - a 25,000 foot suspended aerie complete with an infinity pool that is literally just that.

Consequently, the first 45 minutes of the film is pure CGI perfection. Desiccated Super Bowl stadia lie in ruins, Petrified, post-nuclear city scapes abound, drying sea beds are littered by rusted husks of oil tankers and cruise ships taunting us with the smug nostalgia of how great we had it back in 2015....

...now comes the hard part, telling a story that can stand-alone from the visual pyrotechnics. In the case of Oblivion, the narrative skills of the director, Joseph Kosinski and screenwriters, Karl Gagdusek and Michael Arndt, conspire to near failure, all too frequently relying on story elements that seem arbitrary and implausible.

Forget the Scavs and the political machinations on Titan, in an out of nowhere twist, "Jack" has discovered a radiation free, paradise valley that he regularly visits to lay back on the grass, fly-fish in a lake fully stocked with trout and boogie to an epic but very ancient stereo system whose turntable is constantly fed by a huge collection of near pristine 1970's classic rock vinyl that must have once belonged to Cruise's pal Cameron Crowe.

All around him the steel and rock from a wrecked civilization have been fused into apocalyptic sculpture but please be assured that the 110 year old Pet Sounds album cover is completely intact. An unforgivable stretch in logic even for a film that constantly begs it from you.

While I suspect this device is utilized to anchor the story for a contemporary audience, seeing Cruise in his Adirondack chair, sporting a faded Yankees cap while getting off on the Allman Brothers is a WTF bridge-too-far for a story-line that is already crammed and conflicted - in fact this entire arc was so strange, I fully expected Gene Kelly to show up in the next scene asking for directions to Brigadoon.

All in all Oblivion is a VISUAL masterpiece that must be seen. However, with the exception of a haunting score by M.8.3 you could just as easily lament that this deeply flawed script was ever made into a Talkie. Too bad, because Tom Cruise actually tried in this one.

Coming from a life long sci fi fan I can tell you this is exactly what I wanted and the sci fi community needed. I like how it had a feel from several other movies that seemed to be an influence on this film including: Independence Day, the 6th Day and even a little of Disney's Wall-E. Great movie and it's safe for little ones with just mild violence and one "F" bomb at the end.
Some movies are predictable this isn't.  I really enjoyed it even though I'm not a huge Tom Cruise fan (I think he's gone a little off the deep end with that Scientology).

But I am a Sci-fi junkie.

I really felt that this movie had a great mix of emotion and action. Well done!

Now for the bad news.... The Blu-ray will not play in my Sony BDP-CX960 or my Sony PS3, both with their latest firmware. After the menus it just goes black. Anyone have any ideas or updates on this issue, sounds like many are having this trouble.

It wasn't the greatest movie I've ever seen, but it was enjoyable.  Science fiction fans would probably enjoy it.  It did keep my attention enough that I watched it straight through without pausing for anything.  It has a 'Matrix' kind of feel to it although it isn't as action packed as The Matrix movies.  SciFi fans, give it a try.
Great movie with beautiful visuals and a great performance from Tom Cruise.  Morgan Freeman was also a great addition to the movie.

Expected a 3 but ended up with 5 stars. The story was typical- boy loses girl, people lose planet, boy gets girl back, people get planet back (spoiler?). But what I loved was how it was told. The cinematography was beautiful, perfect editing, great acting, amazing script, and very cool tech toys!! TC might be crazy in real life, but I tell you what... he's a damn fine actor.

It's rare to see movies anymore where you can't predict what is going to happen, have crazy twists and are somewhat complex. The graphics and special effects are superb. The acting is very well done as well. I do wish there were more quality films out there like this!
great story line and a shocker towards the end.  Never expected it to evolve like it did.  Super entertaining, especially if you like SciFi

I watched the trailer for the streaming video and thought if they had played that when the movie was released I would have seen it in the theatre. It had just enough action without being overkill, the elements that make sci-fi fun, and a story that kept you guessing and thinking. If all you are interested in is mindless plots and non-stop explosions then this one is not for you.

This is the best Sci-Fi I've seen in decades. I don't often hand out praise. This movie was enjoyable to watch a dozen times when I received it and is highly recommended. An excellent cast although there was no chemistry with the actress who played Julia. Olga was not right for the part. She lacked the on screen presence and appeal and simply did not mesh with Cruise on screen. It wasn't any lack of acting. They simply lacked the chemistry needed for the role she played. They needed someone who stands out in a crowd and has sincerity in their eyes. I also think once the background story was known... it should have emphasized the fact that their marriage was kept secret from their crew and aerospace command center at the time which is why she wore the ring around her neck. It also should have included the fact that Vika had interests in him at the beginning and did not know about his marriage. Those two issues were not made clear.

I was delighted that there was no blood and gore for a change other than a stain on a shirt. So thank you to the director, writer and producers for not subjecting the audience to violent gore.

This was clearly the best set design I have ever seen when it came to the sky house. I found their front projection quite effective and visually stunning for both the audience and cast.

The story had some wonderful new ideas... and it might have been nice to have seen some scenes of the thousands who came to attack 50 years earlier.

This movie did have a unique story. A wonderful clean, futuristic design of architecture and high-tech devices. The intent to bring Sci-Fi back out into the sunlight is a concept I agree with. Over the years it had become dark and dirty and violent which is a turn off and most of us are sick and tired of those other grungy sci-fi's. While this did have some drone battle scenes (which were a bit long for my taste... but that's what fast forward is for) but some of the most important scenes were cut in favor of useless, prolonged drone battles inside a power plant and unnecessary CGI expense. Battle scenes are boring and monotonous & the audience is quite tired of them.

Hasn't anyone noticed that the blockbuster hit movies all had good personal stories, limited battle scenes and no dark, dank or grungy... hit movies like Independence Day. This movie is also one of the best movies in recent years.

In general it is the depth of the story, the characters & interaction, the cast and visual technologies which are important. Movies need the audience to invest their emotions. This movie aced the technology and clean futuristic architecture. The relationship with Vika was quite unique. She did a superb job of acting and nearly stole the entire film. The cast was excellent. The designs were beautiful as was the concept. I thought the writers approach to selling the story was a refreshing change from their usual antiquated script formats. I'm amazed it worked. I think more should have been done with Tet and we are more interested in seeing additional scenes of the condition of the cities and survivors survival attempts (like the grain crop concept in The Host) than barraging us with battles. This movie was very sparing about that so it was appreciated. Only 2 significant battle scenes which were fast forwarded through.

The 3 most glaring errors were the deleting of the archives scene where Morgan showed him the book of his career. In fact, there should have been more scenes of the archives and more on what they had salvaged. The second was a simple blunder in the script dialogue. Vika told Sally that she needed a drone to scout grid 17 and Sally responds that she is sending a drone to grid 22. Clearly... Sally should have sent the drone to grid 17. Grid 22 wasn't even mentioned in the conversation. Someone should have caught that either on editing or at least when prescreening the movie without talking through it... and someone might have heard the mistake. It was pretty glaring. And finally, to hear Morgan talking about waves and bedrock in Chicago was a bit ridiculous. While New York and San Francisco are on bedrock and next to an ocean for tidal waves... Chicago is not on bedrock as far as I know... I've drilled in all three areas... and certainly would not be subject to Tsunami's from the great lakes. Some wave action perhaps... but would not bury Chicago... so that was the third glaring error.

It was also obvious that Sally wasn't quite right in the first few minutes with the constant asking about being an "effective team". Her Texas accent was also waaay overdone. Plus, I would have waited a few minutes and established the future before doing the dream sequence rather than opening the movie with it. There also should have been more lighting in the lower level workshop. Most workshops are brightly lit. His should have been no different in that respect. But the set for their house was fabulous. I'd like to see all Sci-Fi's use projection screens like that.

Unlike some people who judge actors on their personal lives, those issues are of no interest and should not be an issue in regard to the success of a movie. I only care how they do on screen and I must say they were all terrific with the chemistry exception I noted.

However... we could have done without the cigar and the goggles on Morgan Freeman. It was not only ridiculous that he would still have access to Cigars after 50 years considering the planet was a wasteland... but it is about time to stop pushing tobacco products on our films. It is a gross affront to the audience especially when it has been banned in practically every building in the country... so what makes these filmmakers think we want to see some nasty cigar... especially Sci-Fi fans who usually have backgrounds in science, technology or engineering. Most of us know better than to smoke and don't enjoy watching it either. Prometheus did the same thing. It was offensive both times. Find a technology company to finance your sci-fi films. Microsoft or Sony or Toshiba, Apple or Verizon. Not tobacco companies. They should know that watching someone smoke only repulses people these days. It doesn't work like it did in the 40's. It does not make anyone want to smoke unless they are already addicted.

We probably could have done without the scene of the 3 drones in that dark, dripping, dingy power plant. I hope the Director and producers realize you exposed your crew and cast to dangerous PCB's and lead and sulfuric acid left behind in that abandoned plant you chose to film in. It can't be cleaned from the concrete floors. It seeps into the concrete floors and then rained down all over the cast and crew during filming. That particular dark, grungy site  also contradicted your intention to bring Sci-Fi back in to the sunlight.

I find it disturbing when the directors expose the cast and crew to hazardous and unpleasant conditions. What purpose did it serve to place that poor girl in a tank top in Iceland where she was freezing? It certainly didn't add to her appeal. And why would you allow your high dollar star to become injured? That knee or neck injury could affect him for the rest of his life. It was clear he was having great pain and difficulty walking on it during the library scene. The audience does  not require nor appreciate the actors being injured or subjected to miserable conditions. I think any directors who do this should be banned for life from working on any more films, regardless of how well the movie may have done. Injuring an actor is inexcusable and unnecessary. Their contracts should spell out that they are prohibited from engaging in precarious behavior which may result in injuries. In addition to the damage to the actor, it could bankrupt a studio and infuriate an audience over the gross inconsideration shown to the cast. NO movie is important enough to cause harm or discomfort to a cast... such as filming in 100 degree weather as Star Trek Generations did to 3 star actors who could have died from heat related heart attacks as did Clark Gable and John Candy under similar conditions... or like this movie... putting their actors on top of a mountain Cliff in Iceland. Cruise is over 51 and shouldn't be running up cliffs and high sand dunes if he doesn't want to end up like Ritter, Gable and Candy... despite how energetic he feels. Guys who go overboard to overdo everything to prove their youth are prime candidates for fatal heart attacks.

If you want Iceland... then green-screen it. We won't know the difference. Many of us have a long memory about damage to actors and stunt crews... Harry Potter's stunt double who is paralyzed. Vic Morrow and 2 children dead from a helicopter crash on set. Elizabeth Taylor in National Velvet age 12 caused a life long back injury. William Shatner with Tinnitus. Ida Lupino, Wayne and crew from cancers after filming in fallout Nevada. I didn't look up any of these incidents. We do remember these incidents and it definitely needs to stop.

I'm willing to bet Cruise will require arthroscopic surgery on that knee in 5 years and will end up with stenosis from the neck hyperextension in less than 10 years just from that one library scene in this movie. Frankly, I don't think any movie is worth it.
OK, could some one please explain that ending to me?  He died, and three years later, all those people show up and find that little cabin in the woods, and THERE HE IS?  HUH?
Weak script, too many holes. Constantly questioning what's what and why? Not engaging nor interesting enough.  The only good thing is the special effects ....
Good science fiction movie reminiscent of the Matrix. However there is a lingering feel that this was based on book with more complexity and story than is offered in movie format.

I liked the post nuclear devestation beautiful CGI and landscapes.  Strong on action and relationships.  Especially the mystery woman in his dreams.  Morgan Freeman was great.  Cloning make up an interesting twist at the crucial time and later towards the end.  Plot believeable.

Movie starts off good, but at some point towards the end the story annoyingly leaves out important details about the the hell is going on. I had to do online research to figure out what the hell was going on. Turned out it's a pretty common search topic.

Not very good,  ok to kill some time, but nothing special.
It looked like it had great potential but fell short
Would have rated a 5 but not quite. Good movie. Could have been a little more action, but I like hardcore.
I liked the unexpected plot twists.  It's one of those movies that you try to get your head around at the ending.;
If your interested in a good action sci fi movie, avoid this one. All of the action is in the trailer
Tough to follow. I watched it twice in order to understand some of the storyline. As is the case with this type of movie, the special effects were the best part. Still worth seeing though.

I really like the special effects and the action.  I had a little trouble toward the end, keeping the flash backs and the present action separated.  It switched back and forth a lot, you didn't know if it was present Jack or Past Jack.  Otherwise it was pretty good, I love scifi ,just keep the flash backs to a minimum.
Great movie with some nice twists and turns. If you have a evening to relax choose this movie. You won't be disappointed.
Interesting story line to include some pretty typical sci-fi plot holes. Standard work for Mr. Cruise but a somewhat odd fish out of water appearance by Morgan Freeman.
I saw it at the theater.  To me, it was one of the best sci-fi I have seen.  I'll put it in the same category with Blade-Runner, The Matrix, Terminator and the likes.
Now this is a movie. Pacific Rim, movie where the acting wasn't all that great was hyped up more than this masterpiece. Great movie. Definitely will buy the blue-ray.

Tom Cruise saves the world (yet again) but it's a bit off the radar even for him.  I didn't particularly like the whole scenario of the world being sucked dry by aliens but there were a few moments that I enjoyed.  I found Morgan Freeman's character totally useless to the whole of the film, but I guess he was cast well with what he had to work with.  There are many Earth shattering moments in this film and the overall premise is OK, but I don't think Tom Cruise needs to continue making these types of films.  I mean, how many times can one man actually save the human race?  I prefer him in more realistic characters but it seems his bigger than life star status makes him think he has to be in bigger than life world saving movies.  This is a bleak film and totally unrealistic but I guess that's what we escape to the movies for.  I just think Cruise should be a real person in a movie about real life for a change.

Stayed true to the story. No over the top stuff. Liked it a lot.
Would Recommend to Sci Fi Lovers
Hard to find truly original stories out there, but Oblivion is refreshing in a summer full of sequels!  LOVED IT!

The story is intelligent with surprises of a mystery and possibilities and wonderment of sci-fi framed by great CGI and photography. Too bad I was forced to watch on my mobile device w/o option to use large TV screen.
I thought Oblivion was a good movie.  It's the best movie I've seen from Tom Cruise in awhile.  The story line is excellent and I loved the special effects.  Really good!

Slow moving and boring. Morgan Freeman's part was small.  It irritates me that most of the dialogue between Tom Cruise and his leading ladies is "whispering".  Why can't they talk like normal people ?
Acting was super along with special effects. Watched it three our or times in the 48 hours. I would recommended it to everyone.

I am a scifi buff, so I tend to enjoy this genre. Great plot, writing, acting, visuals. What more can u ask for? No it's not Transformers or Armageddon type action, but for me I liked it so much I watched it 2x to catch some of the things I missed first time.

All of the very bad reviews of this movie almost made me pass on seeing it. I'm glad I went ahead anyhow. I thought this was a very good film and couldn't find anything to validate the faults others found in it. Cruise and Freeman were perfectly casted and the script was tight and and actually original in its concept. Plenty of action and some very unexpected plot twists. Also a good though understated soundtrack. I've already recommended this film to several friends and will no doubt watch it again myself. I won't offer spoilers but the ending caught me completely off guard. That's what made this movie stand out for me - it wasn't predictable and formulaic. Which is more than you can say for 90% of big Hollywood films these days, especially in the sci-fi genre.
I liked it.  Well written.  It had a good ending too for once.  It is been a while since I have seen a decent sci-fi movie with an original story.
Just amazing unbelievable best movie since avatar just mind blowing, cruise at his best. Ties into current conspiracy's that we have today. this movies like a riddle.
Reminded me of the Matrix mixed up with the Terminator. Has great action and characters but this plot has been done already.

I have no idea if this movie is good, the stupid Amazon site downloaded it to my Kindle Fire for me to watch on a long plane ride, but when I tried to view it, the Kindle kept wanting to go the internet and said I needed an internet connection to watch a movie I paid for and spent 20 minutes downloading to my device.

Stupid and frustrating!

I am so disgusted with the latest crop of 'Blockbusters' that they can sink so much into a movie and come out the other end with such disjointed mediocrity.  Sure, there is some good bang and zoom; great CG and good technology animation; however plot wise, kids in the back yard with a hand held camera and some Star Wars figures might have done better.

The addition of Morgan Freeman to collect Deli Money for his quickie appearance as leader of the resistance makes one wonder if these people had anything better to do with their money.  Not to mention the Matrix rip off at the end.  Lord help us if this is the best Hollywood has to offer.
Wont go into details but I absolutely loved the film. I love a good sci-fi movie with some unexpected twist to it. This one fit the bill.
It was okay. It moved a little slow for me. I would only rent it. I would definetly not buy it.
This movie was beautiful picture. The story however left much to be desired. Morgan Freeman is underutilized and Tom Cruise was unchallenged.
hard for me to understand need to watch it again good graphics and  action , but could't keep up with what was going on
Ok movie. I figured out most of plot early in film. The action was pretty good. The vehicles were pretty awesome too.
i didn't want to say i was surprised by the ending because i thought i could predict it. then i did. but i still got a surprise.
Definitely worth a rental, but glad I didn't take the family to see it in the theater.  Morgan freedman only has a small role

Plot twist and surprise endings don't always work.  This movie reminds me of M. Knight Shyamalan's "The Village."  In the end when we find out the creatures aren't real it isn't a cool surprise it's a disappointment.  I felt the same with this movie.  However, the concept of this futuristic, post apocalyptic earth is really cool.  The special effects are great and the sci-fi elements are very unique and original.  My hat goes off to the writer.
I like movies that are not predictable, it wasn't until near the end that I started figuring out what was going on.  It does go a bit slow at times but the special effects and overall movie are good.

I'm a fairly big sci-fi fan, though I'm far from hard-core. My favorite recently has ben Prometheus, and while Oblivion isn't up to that standard, it's not bad either. It definitely seems to draw elements from other major films in the genre, but honestly, it's getting pretty difficult to be truly unique. Oblivion weaves together a number of common sci-fi elements, and does a good job of it.

Acting was good, Cruise was great as always. Morgan Freeman was a good choice as well.

If the negative reviews are getting you down on this film, and you're not a sci-fi superfan, I'd give it a shot. It's one of the better ones of this summer...

I like it best when the story is told at the right speed; this movie revealed the story in a believable manner with just enough realism at times to avoid complete suspension of belief. My imagination was captured by the terrific cinematography and the concept of "question everything" is relevant here.

Something about when you have that "gut feeling" must be connected to the universal equalizer...enjoy!
Good movie with good twists and turns. The plot wasn't cerebral by any means. Still though, it was a good watch.
Good story, great cinematography, and good acting but unfortunately slow.  This is a movie only to be watched at the cost of at most a red box.
Loved the twists and turns in this movie. Action packed and Tom Crusie was terrific. Rent the movie it is worth it!
Perfect for Sci-Fi enthusiasts. Cheesy plot line with a nice twist to mix it up. Easily worth a few bucks.

For people who enjoy sci-if action this movie delivers it all! Don't listen to those critics who panned it..they are 'oblivious' towards true entertainment. This movie is compelling, tense, and has a pretty good twist to wrap up the end. Cruise is in fine shape in sci-fi and I look forward to his future endeavors in this genre.

I really liked the film as it didn't fall victim to the modern sci-fi movie tropes, and was more story-driven then most sci-fi films these days, which seem to rely too heavily on special effects to drive their plots forward. Coupled with a great soundtrack by electronic duo M83, this made for an enjoyable movie that dares to be different.

It certainly is a pretty movie! It's entertaining too, not a bad story and has some good twists...if you don't guess too hard. There are some pretty major holes in the plot, but hey! It's fun.

The acting is pretty good, the effects are stunning. Things are pretty well paced and interesting. Tom Cruise isn't just "Tom Cruise" in this movie either (which is good!)

I don't regret renting it at all.
The movie had good special effects, acting decent, plot ok.  The movie did seem to move slow for an action movie.  Overall it was decent, but I wouldn't call it a must see movie.

This is one of the best Sci-Fi movies I've seen in years. I rank it right up there with The Matrix & The Book of Eli. I enjoyed it so much I watched it twice in my 48 hour viewing period and will have to buy this movie on DVD as soon as the price drops a bit. This is a Sci-Fi for the thinking person and has more than a few extraordinary surprises built into it. For some it may start a little slow (no big booms or starship battles) but stick with it, it's a hell of a great story. I cannot help but wonder about the fate of Vicka 52?
Oblivion turned out to be a pretty good movie, a lot better than some of the critics gave it credit for.

No action-adventure movie should held to the standard of a "Citizen Kane."  The genre is akin to a roller coaster ride: it provides entertaining thrills. There are of course minimum requirements for performances, dialogue, plot, and special effects. Oblivion achieve all in a workmanlike manner.  It may not be the finest of its type and it's not 100% original, but it's entertaining and far from the worst.  The CGI's are stunning, and the action proceeds logically.

Rottentomatoes gave it a 54% positive rating, marginally failing to achieve their "fresh" rating.  Perversely, Ridley Scott's muddled and illogical creature-feature, "Prometheus" was rated a 74% positive.  That should arguably call into question the reviewers' credibility.

Best Sci-Fi I've seen in years, maybe ever!  This one is original, not just a copy of someone else's premise.  Avatar was of this sort. I'm a fan of Sci-Fi, have been since I was a little boy, but I'm not impressed with only special effects, though this movie has plenty of stunning S.E., the story is so compelling that I had to watch it twice to pick it all up... and I plan on watching it again.  this is a good one.
I was a bit confused, I had thought I was ordering thwe actual DVD but it never came.  I was able to watch it on my computer though. Please e mail me to clear up this confusion.

This is a glossy scifi flick with the obligatory twist toward the end.  Tom Cruise gives a standard, decent performance, and everyone else is fine.  He's of course far too old for his work/love partner in the movie, but that's standard Hollywood protocol.  (A female actor of his same age would be considered far too "old", for some reason).  Morgan Freeman, despite earning a spot on the poster/cover, has a very small role.

Everything looks great, the movie moves along at a pretty brisk pace, the twist isn't exactly jaw-dropping, but it provides something to do in the last third of the story. (if you've ready any amount of scifi short stories or pulp novels from the 60s - 80s that owe any kind of debt to Ray Bradbury or The Twilight Zone then the twist feels very standard, but I don't hold that against them).  I also don't think the purpose of the twist is to amaze anyone, it's just a plot point.

This isn't a bad movie at all, and I'd say it's pretty enjoyable.  I love big spectacle scifi flicks, so for me this one was good enough that I'll probably watch it again at some point.
I did not see this at the movies. I wish I did it was surprisingly good. I enjoyed it. It was confusing at the beginning but It all made sense toward the end. Excellent mind bender.

THE MOVIE WAS GREAT, AM AN ACTION JUNKIE WHEN IT COMES TO MOVIES.
I MISS BULLET TO THE HEAD I DONT KNOW IF IT WAS MY LABTOP OR MY NET SERVICE.

This movie was a good one. We are getting used to high tech movies with stunning graphics. What sets this movie apart is that it actually had a plot, something that seems unique lately! I have enjoyed Tom Cruise's movies and feel that the critics tend to be really harsh in their reviews of his work. I liked his Mission Impossible movies, so I decided to watch Oblivion. Without spoiling it for other viewers, I'll just say this is a movie worth watching. It has unexpected twists in the plot that may surprise you. Make some popcorn, sit down and prepare to be entertained.
I thought it was a good science fiction movie Oblivion made you think anything in the future could happen very good
I don't write reviews - but this movie was surprisingly good. Good enough for me to take 2 minutes to write this review ;)

never saw the twist coming. Cruise might be a little "different" in real life but the man makes a great movie almost every time.
Definitely a watchable. Good pace nice story well done.

I was very disappointed with Oblivion. I was looking forward to the movie being a huge Morgan Freeman fan only to find he only had a few scenes. It seems like any movie with Tom Cruise is all about Tom and how great and tough he is. This movie was all about Tom... It started out great but seemed quickly became drawn out. The story line was very interesting only to fade into scene after scene of Tom Cruise being a tough guy. This could have been such a great film and the effects were great. But it takes more than Tom Cruise to make a movie great, like building other strong characters into the story.

I totally didn't expect this movie to have so many layers.  If you can suspend logic for a couple of hours, this movie has something for everyone: action, suspense, passion, love.  I only noticed a couple of things that didn't make sense.  It's the perfect date movie: something for the guy as well as the girl.  I know that sounds sexist, but you know exactly what I mean.  Don't  you?

The introduction was great but as the movie dragged on there was no storyline at all really. Where are the aliens??? Where is the climax? The conclusion was poor!! The trailer was better than the movie will ever be. Overall, DISAPPOINTED.
My blu ray DVD does not play. It just a blank screen when I play it on my PS3.  The bonus DVD played fine. I need to return it
I thought it was a great syfy movie. The cinematography and CGI is beautiful. The music scored compliments the movie so well. I love the story and Tom Cruise and other cast members did a great job!

My expectations were somewhere in the middle but I really enjoyed this movie.  I would rate it 4 1/2 stars if that were an option.  The movie was fast moving, interesting and keeps you guessing a little bit while not being overly complicated.  And the effects and creative use of technology reminded me of Minority Report.  Definitely worth seeing!
Fantastic film! Tom Cruise was truly at his best. Special mention to Drone 166! You will watch this film over and over, just to soak up the story line and the CGI effects.

I don't purposely go see Tom Cruise movies, nor do I seek out sci-fi movies, but I thought the trailer was interesting and gave this one a chance. Absolutely loved it. Visually awesome with the right amount of action and romance.

The ginger can act but, the world is really doomed if there are three bazillion Toms cruising over head.

But really folks, Tom destroyed this movie.  He couldn't play a love scene if (you fill in the blank)...

AND even if Morgan Freeman was only in the movie a few seconds (they should have called it a cameo), he was unbelievable.  Really, you can't believe it's even him much less the character he's playing.

It is however, no wonder they didn't develop his character.  I mean, all Tom Cruise movies must have TOM CRUISE in every moment of the flick.

Three stars for the adaptation of the Moon plot for Tom.

Yes, here is yet ANOTHER "apocalyptic flick" in a long list of other apocalyptic themed movies this year.

This movie is strange.  Set in 2077, on a "war ravaged earth", our hero Tom Cruise (Jack) and his partner Vicka have the important job of harvesting water and other ecological necessities for human's new place of residence, Titan.

Jack is the one who has to do the "dirty work" - going down to the ground to battle the "Scavs" that have taken over earth.  (The scavs are the aliens that waged the war on humans to begin with)...while Vicka, on the other hand (a woman who is way too neat and sexily dressed to really be believable in this type scenario, but oh well...) never leaves the tall luxurious tower they are stationed in.

Yes, they are romantically involved.

Is this movie interesting?  Yes, in it's own way.  It is certainly VISUALLY interesting, and Tom Cruise does a great job as the main character.  (Some men may find Vicka visually interesting, as well).

But is it INTERESTING?????  Well....sort of.  I mean, the movie does suck you in and holds your interest - although I did feel, at times, that there could have been "more" - more character development, more emotion...just "MORE".  However, I do feel the movie is worth watching ONCE....now would I watch it again?  Since I know all the little secrets and interesting twists (which I will not divulge) I can't see myself watching the flick again, any time soon.  It did seem to drag a bit in places too, unfortunately.

Over all, though, I would recommend seeing Oblivion at least once.  It's worth it.  Perhaps watch in on Pay Per View as opposed to purchasing.

Kind of confusing if you look away or don't hear a part.  lol

Had a good twist which took me awhile to figure out that happened.

The story builds slowly as we follow Tech 49 on his rounds and he battles the Scavs. After about 1 hour I got bored and started playing solitair with the movie as background noise. By this time I knew how it was going to end. The movie is really about Tom's ego as he found a venue that kept him on screen as the only actor for most of the movie.

Bought this movie and sec I tried to play it would freeze. Found out if your having any issues turn off BD-LiVE!

Other then that great bluray, movie!!!!

One must ask: doesn't Cruise get bored with playing the same over-the-top character? This isn't a film; it is a two hour plus advertisement for sleek cars, six-pack abs, and a wardrobe out of Banana Republic. It's like watching an issue of Men's Fitness. Yawnnnnnnn

For those of you that enjoyed Tom Cruise in Vanilla Sky, and also enjoy action/adventure, this is your movie.  It has multiple layers of meaning that anyone can enjoy.  I don't agree with the statement at the end, (I can't really discuss without spoilers), but regardless, I still enjoyed it tremendously.  The female heroine was a nice touch.  Good casting all around.  Nice seeing Jaime Lannister from GoT too for a small part.  He had a lot of gravitas and presence in the screen time he did have.  Overall: great movie.  Only wish I had bought it instead of spending $7 renting it in HD.  Ah well such is life.
Good story, fantastic scenery, and for once Cruise died (kind-of) in a movie.  Excellent supporting cast and good explanation of who/why/what happened to create the story
This was slow, and very predictable.  Only worth watching at home, once.  Not as good as a normal Tom Cruise movie.

Won't run on my older PS3 (and apparently some other players). Get a couple "Universal" splashs, and then it freeze's. Did a little research and apparently it relates to some Internet connections it's trying to do on some players. Don't pick this up, unless you want ot mess up your settings on your machine. In about 5 yrs, this is the first Blu-Ray that has been a problem for me. I returned it... perhaps someday they will produce it without this issue.

I will now be leary of any "Universal" produced Blu-Ray.

I think now Tom Cruise flicks get a bad rap, just because you either love him or hate him.  However, this movie is more than Tom Cruise.  It was a great Sci-Fi flick, with all the right stuff. (space pun intended)  It was not as predictable as others have stated.  I was surprised a couple of times.  Worth the rent, or if you're a 'love him', then buy it.
Not the best movie of the year. But it was entertaining. I got the plot have way through the movie.
Tom Cruise was his usual realistic self, great special affects, good plot, over all a very entertaining flick i give it 4 stars. Ed Koller

Finally, we get to see Tom Cruise not doing another Mission Impossible, but a science fiction movie.
And because of his acting experiences, it even makes the film better. Its a good looking film, with just enough
action, a good story and and great musical score.
Recommended, and a keeper for your collection.

It's just a bad movie. The way the story is told is odd, starts with Tom Cruise giving you a 2 minute summary of whey things are the way they are and then the story plods through an hour of crap before getting to the damn point. Then, from there, it's just bad. There are plenty of better sci-fi movies to choose from.
Excellent movie, very underrated - received DVD in excellent condition - packaging was very good.  Must watch several times to get the true understanding of the movie.  Loved it.

Enjoyed this movie start to finish.  I found a few issues with the plot(some things didn't add up, the reasoning for some things didn't make sense), but nothing to keep me from enjoying the movie.  Decent twist at the end.
Nothing special.  Pretty dumb plotline towards the end.  So many issues being tackled at the same time and they are not even relevant.  Cool visuals, though.

To little of this movie was spent explaining what, to me, was the central plot point - the conflict between the humans and the aliens.  Instead, that juicy morsel was just a backdrop for a slow and disappointing love story.  Needs to look at matrix trilogy for a lesson on how to do this.

The trailers wee the best part of the movie.
The plot was confusing; the special effects were over the top.
Not one of Tom's shining moments.
Frankly is a quite boring movie. Story was something already seen. There is this twist in the middle but...nothing special really.
I've always liked Cruise because he has the ability to deliver on screen. This was no different, and Freeman's role was just as important. Great entertainment within the sci-fi arena.
For a rental it's okay. Typical TC role as he  introverted and haunted. Morgan is totally wasted in this film. Story line is not too predictable and is somewhat interesting.
Interesting movie.  Good story, good special effects.  Don't like the idea of a child at the end.  Why would the aliens create fertile clones?
Loved it from start to end. If you like sci-fi movies you will not be disappointed at all with Oblivion. Tom Cruise does a excellent job. Amazing scenery throughout movie.

This was an amazing movie, not just the rich visuals but also the story.  I absolutely loved this movie and I cannot wait to see it again.  The only thing is I wished I had seen it on the big screen when it came out.  The entire cast was wonderful, and especially the venerable Morgan Freeman and Tom Cruise.
not his best work, but the plot line was nice and the graphics was great in places, I enjoyed it, glad I waited until the DVD came out.

This was a great movie. My only wish was that it was a little longer. It was well thought out and executed though. Like I said, I wanted more. Hopefully, there will be an Oblivion 2 or prequel. Tom Cruise is on his way back up. The graphics and special effects were also very well done. I would recommend to all Sci-Fi fans.

Excellent movie that I was unaware of until browsing Amazon for something to watch, read the synopsis, rented and watched..... superb!!!! Sci Fi is a genre that has been lacking lately; this and Prometheus tie for the 2 most thought-provoking and well done movies I have seen the past few years. Both make you think and ask questions, worth a buy, or rental at the least.

Loved this movie!  I meant to watch it on the big screen and never got around to it, I wish I had as this movie was so visually amazing!  This movie kept me wondering what was going to happen next and threw me off on how it would end.  Even though I've streamed this movie, Im defintely going to own it as a bluray!  Best Sci-fi in 2013 next to Pacific Rim.

What a cool apartment...or outpost for them .Tom Cruise play a repair man for robotic weapons. Human survivers thought to be terrorist's try and get into his head after his capture. The truth is not really what it seems...he has to then question everything. Can't say anymore or i'll ruin it for you.

Feel asleep watching this twice.  Interesting story.  Played out poorly with no pacing.  TC is no Tom Hanks.  He can't carry a movie with limited Dialogue.  He's not the problem, but can't save this film.

I consider myself a fan of both Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman.  I was disappointed with this film.  It was very slow moving at the beginning and by the time there was a little more action, I had lost interest in the characters.  There were a few surprise twists in the plot with a predictable ending. I should probably give it 2 stars but I'm a fan of the lead actors :)

Well, let me by saying if you like science fiction, you will like this movie, plus it has a surprise ending and many tiwsts and turns that make the film alone interesting.  But I digress, this movie not only has its twist and turns but the tech part is really cool, and there is alot of tech in this film.  The acting is typical Tom Cruise, no complaints here, but being a fan does make a difference, needless to say if you like scifi, then I would recommend that you see this movie, it will not dissapoint.
I've seen a lot of scyfy but this will be one of those that will stand out for many years.
Really great movie with lots of action, fantastic scenery, Cruise and Freeman at their best. And a really nice ending
One of the best movies I have seen lately, the story behind the story is awesome. Highly recommend it, is a must see.

I really enjoyed this film, it's a fun & unique movie! Good moderate action, solid story line, with sweet computer graphics making the film the whole family will love! Only one scene with questionable visuals, but nothing any worse you'll see on regular TV these days! It kinda reminded me of Classic Star Trek with great intelligent story & characters to add if you are a fan of the film genre

Not a big fan of Tom Cruise but he makes it work in this picture.  Both the females leads are believable and exciting to watch.  I enjoy SciFi movies so perhaps I am biased but this movie was very good. The cinematography was well done, as is the sound track...I may be dating myself with the music.  The subject matter also may be a little over done - Planet of the Apes, Matrix, others but I still found a new feel to the plot, which had an Excellent twist.
Enjoy!

I enjoyed the movie, it's a fun & unique film! Moderate action, great computer graphics, very solid story line, hard to guess or see the ending! A movie for the whole family, to love, only one scene of questionable visuals for the young ones, nothing any worse than regular TV shows these days!

It's not often that I fall asleep in a movie and decide that it's not worth rewinding. I got bored and fell asleep the first time, but I figured it would hold my attention when I had company. Wrong. I woke up and my friend was looking at her phone instead. There is very little character development , if any. It's not good sci-fi at all. The drones are Star Wars throwbacks at best, and his hi tech bike is lame! Only Tom Cruise can fall several stories several times in a movie, but not even break a bone or limp afterwards. This is shallow nonsense. Just throwing Morgan Freeman in a movie these days is supposed to give it gravitas! Wrong. This was so predictable and lame -take a bit from Star Wars, Total Recall and The Matrix, take out the imagination, great or at least interesting dialogue and characters, and you get this plodding attempt at filmmaking. There are so many excellent sci-fi movies around now to settle for this lukewarm drivel. Determined to get my money's worth, I tried again, and forced myself to watch it. Oblivion begins with a mystery and ends with a bang, but also a satisfying coda. I saw Oblivion in the theater, but did not fully appreciate it until just now at home. The audio has soft parts, with little more than soft wind blowing and bird chirps. In other places, there are combat explosions and gun fire. The multi-track audio includes the default 7.1 DTS HD Master Audio (48 kHz), other languages in lesser, lossy formats, and a music only track in Dolby TrueHD 5.1 (96 kHz). The modern classical music track is another form of enjoyment that BD can bring to your A/V experience. I found the music wonderful, but for the dialog and effects, one must listen to the main audio track. In the theater, the audio was very loud, while at home, one may choose a pleasing volume level to hear the quality in both soft and loud passages.

The story spins out in bits. The main part starts with the two main characters, a drone repairman [Cruise's character] and his female comm officer. As it progresses, you come to understand the situation and characters more, although there are apparent dream sequences and/or flashbacks that are not explained at first. Near the end, in a flashback/blackbox replay sense, the arc of the historical story becomes clear. I have a sense of Bob Seeger's words in "Against the Wind", "what to leave in, what to leave out" about the pacing and content of the film. The extras include several omitted scenes that are interesting for what they additionally disclose about the story, from which one may consider why they were omitted. The director, Pete Hammond, also directed" Tron: Legacy" and was a producer for "Rise of the Planet of the Apes", to give some sense of the quality and sensibility of the movie.

The superb story starts simply - perhaps even a minimal, mystical sensibility, with the two main characters. Later another female character is discovered, after which the story starts snowballing. To avoid spoilers, I'll add little more. Yet, in how many movies does a quote from ancient Rome, from "Lays of Ancient Rome" by Lord Macaulay, "how can man die better than facing fearful odds," serve both to educate or remind viewers of ancient Rome and advance the story line? This is a smaller story, rather than a grand tale with a cast of thousands. Yet, this is far more than a summer fun, sci-fi shoot-em-up. From the excellent video [note- the palette is somewhat subdued rather than bright Technicolor, to match the story and dystopian, post-war theme], through the fine story and excellent audio, this one is a keeper in my view. Sci-fi is best when it makes one think of possibilities, and this movie has it in spades.

Spoiler - This turned out to be a tale of one man and two wives. One was not a real wife and wanted to live in a small artificial and isolated world, the truth pushed out, where she hovered over her man, only allowing him the occasional escape to his man cave...cabin in the woods. With her as a partner, he was less than he was...more boy than man. Second wife was a true wife that he could bring into his man world and though not controlling, he was at his greatest with her in his world. He was man/hero in that world. She readily became part of his world and even after he was gone she remained there.

Oblivion is only a imaginative, more expressive enemy boss away from being a certified classic. The visuals, sound fx, acting and score are all first rate. Even the idea of Cruise as a lone patrolman/repairman is well conceived, as his character slowly evolves from an optimistic boy scout into a reluctant revolutionary. My one gripe with the film is that after spending much of the movie building toward a confrontation with the enemy and the truth, which happens to be one and the same, the director elects to represent the big baddie as a faceless, featureless, expressionless machine. Cold, calculating logic is lethal to be sure but it's also not very interesting and does not give us the memorable villain that this movie desperately deserved. From the previews I had hoped that Freeman was the bad guy since we never get to see him in such roles and I can't help but think that this plot twist is probably what begin to calm my wild expectations. The "scavs" are human? Really? Wow. That could only mean that the real aliens must really be repulsive, menacing, mesmerizing and unforgettable. Right? Wrong. 2001 was a great movie but the whole computer/robot/intelligent machine as the villain is a let down of the lowest order.

PROS
-Strong actors (I don't just mean Tom but, Morgan Freeman, Andrea Riseborough, Olga Kurylenko, Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Memissa Leo -- they were all fantastic actors in this)
-Strong characters
-Storyline that keeps giving
-Cool concept
-It's got Tom cruise (I'm one of those people that don't want to like Tom just because every second of his real-life life is examined under a microscope and marketed to the ends of the world...in end I do like the actor....he's a talented hardworking actor and deserves the A listing)  This movie brought me back to respecting the actor.

And Victoria, wow, she and Tom have to carry a good third of the movie alone and together so she does a tremendous job here -- best supporting comes to mind.)

CONS
None

No spoilers here.  You really have to watch the movie. The aliens invade, we push them back, Tom cruise is some kind of drone repair guy.

Are there unanswered questions in the Movie?....yes most certainly but the movie is very good at helping you suspend disbelief with its strong visual portrayal, sound, strong acting.  To me two phrases are very important in sci fi: rational acting and plausible reality ---

- Are the actors doing rational things in the movie?  YES (If you're ask yourself during a movie, "why did he do that? that's dumb! Then the actors are not acting rationally)

- Is the story plausible?  YES (it's science fiction but yes it's plausible and yes you have to suspend disbelief just a bit)

Some have compared this movie to Prometheus, a science fiction "mess of a movie" and it takes a lot for a guy like me to hang such a label on a movie....in Prometheus the actors are not doing rational things and the story is not really plausible (it makes no sense, the plot is not rational).  So it is categorically unfair to compare these two movies simply because both of their opening sequences are "pretty" in the visual sense.

Oblivion's actors by contrast are strong rational, a tight story & plot that keeps giving (and the story is plausible), that is a huge difference --- couple that with Tom Cruise and the Cast's strong acting & beautiful filming and you have quite literally a masterpiece of science fiction.

One final thing, some people critique that they figured it out pretty fast but I sincerely don't think the movie is meant to keep anything secret from the audience, a la sixth sense, I think it's a journey of discovery for Tom Cruise's character.  He's the one figuring things out.  We, the audience, are just along for the ride.

The best of standalone Tom Cruise has all been sci-fi in the last 10 years. Think about it. Ignore MI, which is a franchise. Now we are left with a string of hit-or-miss movies featuring old man Cruise struggling to look 25 after thousands of dollars invested in plastic surgery. Starting with Minority Report and continuing with War of the Worlds, Cruise has evolved into a sci-fi icon of sorts, very much like latter-day Charlton Heston. With Oblivion, which is essentially Top Gun plus 100 years of high-tech breakthroughs, the actor has come full circle.

The SFX are what you would expect from a movie with a $120M budget and two A-list stars. A visually stunning earth home that sits right above the clouds is where most of the melodrama takes place. Jack Harper (Tom Cruise) and surrogate wife Victoria Olsen (Andrea Riseborough) exchange smooches, awkward glances, and plenty of scenery chewing dialogue before Julia (Olga Kurylenko) intrudes to form one dysfunctional love triangle. At this point, I could only hope that Jack would throw Victoria off the side of their home in a sort of futuristic nod to Captain Stabbin, but the soon-to-be ex-surrogate wife is dispatched via droid instead.

Gaping logical flaws abound. Again, the home that is the setting for 2/3 of this film is situated above the clouds. With no guard rails. What if a strong gust of wind came and dragged one of the main characters off of the improbable structure? Also, I am pretty sure that in the next century, Earth's Stratosphere will still be pretty freaking cold! The surrogate couple swim around butt naked in their attached pool, while the accompanying outdoor temperature is likely below -60*F. Ice skating in Eskimo gear would be more reasonable.

There is some business with clones that I could not understand. Morgan Freeman fails to impress. Olga keeps her shirt on. Combine Moon and Prometheus and you will arrive at Oblivion, which is ultimately too milquetoast to leave a lasting impression. This is "conservative" sci-fi. Nice haircuts, just-ironed uniforms, and staunch patriotism give off a Jetsons vibe. But the overall flick carries as much depth as a puddle, which does not make for good post-apocalyptic cinema.
people might say this wasn't a good movie but it isn't bad either.  i enjoyed it and thought it was clever.  may not be perfectly executed, but it was original and compelling.
Lots of good action, good effects, good soundtrack, good story with a little twist but it was slow and I found myself wandering of to do other things for a while and then coming back to it.

To those who might wish to avoid a film by the maker of Tron: Legacy, it should be stressed that Oblivion is a more interesting work by a good distance, an imaginative speculative piece set some six decades hence that always engages serious attention, even if it doesn't convincingly jell. In mood, a certain delicacy and the sense of isolation both on a depopulated Earth and somewhere above it, the recent film that this most strongly recalls is WALL-E, except with violence and without the humor and charm of the Pixar classic.

I loved it. I love post apocalyptic stories and this is yet another slant with a lot of twists Some of the concepts are hard to wrap your head around but interesting. As usual Morgan Freeman does an excellent job and Tom Cruise is well Tom Cruise action hero.

Its a great movie at many levels. The plot is complex, but not too complex. The twist and ending are perfect, its an enjoyable movie for anyone.

I also liked how real most of the movie felt, with an exception or two. Sally was really quite the contradiction. Everything wasn't explained, nor did everything make perfect sense, but I still enjoyed it.

I really enjoyed this movie, which surprised me, because I am personally not a big fan of Tom Cruise. That note aside, it is a very striking movie! Visually it is very captivating, and I ended up watching nearly 1/3 of the movie with just the M83 soundtrack enabled (off the Blu-Ray version) and no dialogue. Kosinski has produced a very believable environment and story. In the extra features Joseph Kosinski says something to the effect of, 'Science-Fiction has been pulled into the dark, I wanted to bring it back into the light again.' in reference to the feeling/setting of the movies. I think this is why I enjoyed it so much more than I expected too. It had a brighter, futuristic feel to it. It wasn't dripping wet with unnecessary action and explosions just to keep it going. If you're even thinking about watching this movie and are unsure, I highly suggest you at least rent it, otherwise you'll be missing out.

Tom Cruise plays the last man on Earth, a high-tech janitor of sorts who's left to mind the planet's robotic chaperones while the rest of the species lives it up on one of Saturn's moons. It's slow, predictable and riddled with holes, but the production's cache of slick, attractive future tech and constant visual revelations make for excellent diversions. Cruise's sleekly designed equipment is a real science fiction goldmine, visionary in the same sense as Minority Report's giant touch-screen UIs, and the first hour is an outstanding lesson in world-building. The plot eventually falls into too many Cruise / mainstream Hollywood pitfalls, though, and borrows too liberally from other films. Duncan Jones's excellent Moon, in particular, is robbed of all but its subtlety, performances and locale. Still, such faults are hardly surprising by this point and if you were anticipating something more... well, maybe an adjustment in expectations is in order. Perfectly acceptable as a conceptual exercise, but make sure you swallow that grain of salt before viewing.

Nice little twist at the very end (not giving it away). True, you sort of saw it coming, but you weren't 100% sure until the final scene. The fact is, his character was purposely understated in the plot and not the prime focus of the film anyway -- sort of a transitional but still key character none the less.

I LOVED that little jet-copter-thingy Cruise flew throughout much of the film -- way too cool! Kinda reminded me of that cool car he drove in the film Minority Report.  Whenever Tom Cruise is on the screen you can be assured there'll be plenty of cool gadgets & high tech stuff.

If you like solid sci-fi sans the soppy social messages, then I think you'll enjoy this film.
Epic. This was the most unique sci-fi film ever made. Morgan Freeman in a sci fi movie, I couldn't ask for any thing better.

Reviewed by: Amanda Jane Volovik "Chava" I am not a fan of Matrix Sequels or Inception. I am, however, a fan of 2001: A Space Odyssey. That being said, the multiple dimensions, duplicate beings, aliens or humans question, time/mind travel galore and related ambiguities of 'Oblivion' irritated me. On the positive side, the reason I didn't give it one star, but rather two stars, is some of the visual and plot similarities to seventies space movies, such as A Space Odyssey.

To be fair, if you like to be left guessing at what is real or not in the movie, and are a fan of the movies I mentioned above, you may like this. There are parts that are comically far-fetched, and I must admit, I didn't need to understand those because they must have known it would be funny (we should hope).

****SPOILER ALERT: The thought of thousands of Tom Cruises roaming the earth is a plot twist that I would not like to ever see in real life -  as one of him is enough for the world to handle real-time. Also, Melissa Leo as a coquettish southern space-station monitor who is actually a hologram for a hexagonal space god was a bit over the top (not a good use of even slightly hinting at 'HAL' in 2001: A Space Odyssey) :P

"Good" - the special effects, including their skybase and the jetcopter, were visually stunning (which is expected from Hollywood).

"Bad" - the props and the thin plot. Tom Cruise' uniform and his rifle are cheap and phony to the point of distraction. The uniform Tom Cruise wears is right out of The Day the Earth Stood Still.... the 1950's version, and the rifle is obviously light plastic as he throws it around like a wiffle ball bat.

By design, the setting was one of isolation and loneliness, unfortunately this was combined with a thin, uninspired plot which exacerbated the movie's weaknesses. The visuals were striking, but once I adjusted to this I was looking for more substance and plot, which were only partially delivered. Under the circumstances, a deeper, more intriguing plot was necessary.

The pace picked up somewhat near the end, with some nice twists, but even these were recognizable themes that leave you with the sense of "I've seen this stuff before". This movie needed more Morgan Freeman and little less Tom Cruise.

It is not a bad movie. I enjoyed it...somewhat, but it never grabbed me. I was initially amazed by the visuals, but as this wore off, I was left with mild indifference to the simple storyline. I've been on a multi-year rant about Hollywood blockbusters that spend countless millions on special effects and big name actors, but apparently spend very little on writing, and in my opinion this is another example of my gripe. This blockbuster movie that could have and should have been much better with relatively little effort.

REMEMBER HOW EXCITED you were to see "Prometheus" last year, the would-be prequel to "Alien"? Remember the disappointment? Now check out Universal's "Oblivion" for a better story, characters we can like, and terrific visuals.

Yes - Tom Cruise adds another admirable science fiction film to a list that includes "Minority Report," (2002) and "War of the Worlds," (2005). "Oblivion," from Universal Studios, plays to a smarter audience, requiring us to pay attention and think. I like that in a movie, no matter what the genre. I also like the co-stars - Morgan Freeman, Andrea Riseborough and Olga Kurylenko.

Directed by Joseph Kosinski of "Tron: Legacy," (2010), "Oblivion" is based on his story that was originally intended as a graphic novel. A sample chapter was handed out at the 2008 San Diego Comic Com. Cruise got a look and approached him to develop it as a film instead.

The story blends character with mystery, outstanding effects, and futuristic toys set in a "beautiful desolation," as Kosinski calls his world. In the five-part making-of feature, he explains he was, "inspired by shows I liked as a kid like "The Twilight Zone," movies like "Silent Running," "Omega Man" ...  [`70s films] with a small cast of characters, but big ideas."

The year is 2077; the moon has been destroyed by invading aliens and, while the humans fought back and won, Earth has been destroyed by tidal waves, tsunamis, volcanoes and nuclear blasts. The surviving population now lives on Saturn's moon, Titan. Cruise and Riseborough's characters, Jack and Vika, have stayed behind to repair security drones and safeguard fusion converters emptying the oceans for transport to Titan via a massive mothership. Scavs - surviving aliens - are the problem, trying to sabotage these efforts. The two have been voluntarily mind-wiped to focus on their jobs, but Jack continues to experience flashbacks to a pre-invasion New York City and a woman he can't put a name to.

Kosinki's images were used by "Oblivion's" design department. One of the most important is a glass house, the Sky Tower, set on a very delicate foundation structure 2,000 feet above the Earth's surface. It took five months to figure out how the metal-supported design could be constructed, even though it was never built except as a set onstage.

The crew used front-screen project, a technique Stanley Kubrick developed for "2001: A Space Odyssey." By using this instead of green screen, cloud formations filmed 10,000 feet above sea level in HD, were front-projected on a circular screen surrounding the Sky Tower set. Glass and reflective surfaces, even the actors' eyes, reflect the skyscapes during scenes, creating an even deeper sense of visual authenticity. It looks perfect on the 1080p transfer. Detail throughout the film is absolutely flawless; it's definitely one of the best pictures to be found on Blu-ray this year.

Location filming was done in Iceland, where more of Kosinki's imagings, such as a Bubble Ship and streamlined motorcycle that fits inside, were created. A pilot, Cruise helped design a functioning interior for the gyro-spinning cockpit of the ship. The actor, who turned 50 during filming, received an "Oblivion" motorcycle to keep.

An immersive DTS-HD Master Audio 7.1 mix utilizes surround speakers to their best effect. Dialogue, ambient sound, effects and a great score by M83 blend beautifully. One of the extra features is an isolated track in Dolby True HD 5.1 that allows us to watch the movie with its score alone.

Additional extras include four deleted scenes, which further explain a few movie moments, and a technical commentary by Kosinski and Cruise. Most of their information is covered in the splendid making-of series. As usual, don't watch the extras until after viewing the movie unless you like spoilers.
-- Kay Reynolds
