Amazon replaced it but I got the same results on the second disk as well so rather than go to the trouble of sending it back too, I guess I'm stuck with it.  Caveat emptor.

Universal Studios Home Entertainment brings "Oblivion" to Blu-ray and DVD for those who didn't get a chance to see it in theaters. Many people find Tom Cruise to be an acquired taste these days after his couch-jumping antics and Scientology beliefs became public knowledge. However, this beautiful sci-fi gem shouldn't be pushed away solely because he's the lead actor.

Jack Harper (Tom Cruise) and his partner, Victoria (Andrea Riseborough), are the last remaining humans on the war-torn Earth. They're assigned to watch over powerful machines used to collect what's left of the planet's natural resources for use on a moon being colonized by the survivors of an alien invasion. As the job is wrapping up and it grows closer to time for them to leave and move on to their new lives, bizarre dreams and occurrences awaken Jack's suspicions about his mission and who he is.

Although the story isn't completely unique, "Oblivion" manages to borrow different concepts from several classic sci-fi films and blends them together to create something new and entertaining. Director Kosinski does a great job of paying homage to the genre, bringing to mind the visually stunning films of the 1970s and 1980s such as "2001: A Space Odyssey," "Alien," and "Outland."

"Oblivion" is rated PG-13 for violence, adult language, and sexual situations. There's really nothing too horribly objectionable to be found. The box art states there's some nudity, but I didn't see where any actual body parts were shown.

The audio and video presentations for "Oblivion" will leave home audiences stunned. The crystal clear picture shows off the different landscapes and familiar monuments which have been laid waste by war. M83's score brings every sequence of drama and action to life through an immaculate 7.1 surround sound mix.

There are a few special features found on the Blu-ray version of "Oblivion." Audio commentary is provided by Director Joseph Kosinski and actor Tom Cruise. "Promise of a New World" is a 5-part "Making of" documentary that clocks in at 48 minutes. We also get four deleted and alternate scenes. A 5.1 surround presentation of M83's isolated score is included as well.

"Oblivion" is an exciting mix of blockbuster action and sci-fi intellect. It's well-acted and serves as a tribute to the groundbreaking genre films of the past. An elegant audio and video feature presentation coupled with some satisfying special features makes this a worthy purchase for consumers.

Minor Spoilers through out:

One of the biggest complaints is that "Oblivion" borrows a lot from other movies. It's true, but a rather hypocritical reason to trash a movie when in fact just about every sci fi movie has been significantly influenced by its predecessors. The fact that it borrowed from other movies didn't bother me- "Oblivion" still has its own voice and unique look.

For all the critics who declare "Oblivion" is superficial, all style and no substance, I couldn't disagree more. "Oblivion" is an intelligent, symbolic and gorgeously filmed story. Like most intelligent sci fi, "Oblivion" explores age old philosophical questions of the human condition- do we have souls, do we have free will or are our fates predestined, etc.

One of the major themes of Oblivion is that the voices of authority may not be as benevolent and as trustworthy as we' like to believe, and that individual thought and scrutiny are crucial to preserving freedom and humanity. The TET is a physical manifestation / representation of that power that influences us: religion, politics, the mass media - depending on how you look at it.

Meanwhile, Jack and Victoria portray different ends of the power struggle: where he is eager, wants answers to the unknown, and is open to exploring new paths and breaking free from the chains that bind him, she is more concerned with doing what she is told, not rocking the boat, and sticking to the path that is set out before her without question or deviation. You could even take it a step futher and ask whether Jack and Victoria are merely acting the way they were MADE to act, or if they CHOOSE to act the way they do (the free will vs. predestination aspect). There is much beyond the surface story to enjoy and ponder on, for those who like that kind of thing. I can't wait to listen to the commentary for additional information.

Also this movie is very pleasant on the eyes and ears. One of the most stunning HD movies I've seen to date, with a beautiful musical score by M83 to match. The entire film, from story to soundtrack to visual f/x, all pulls together like an eloquent poem, something that few films successfully manage to achieve. Movies like Oblivion certainly won't be liked by everybody, and not everyone will see the "eloquent poem" that I saw: Some of my friends were as disenchanted with it as much as I was mesmerized by it. As for me, I think it's one of the better pure sci fi films I've seen in awhile.

I picked up the latest Science-Fiction epic Oblivion. Sometimes I get a little worried buying  a movie sight unseen but this time it certainly did not disappoint! The movie stars Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman and was directed by Joseph Kosinski and based on his graphic novel of the same name. The movie is one of the apocalyptic films which displays the planet earth after it has been destroyed by aliens.

I have decided this will be a spoiler free review because I think this is a movie you really need to see for yourself and to see it unfold before you. I will give a basic synopsis of the plot. It is the year 2077, 60 years after earth was invaded by aliens. Jack Harper (Tom Cruise) and his partner Victoria "Vika" Owen, played by the beautiful Andrea Riseborough, are the only ones on  after the invasion and they are there to repair drones that are fighting off the residual alien resistance. The surviving inhabitants of earth are living on Titan one of the moons of Saturn. Harper meets up with Malcolm Beech a resistance fighter played by the legendary Morgan Freeman (one of my very favorite actors) and he also begins to have flash backs to a time he was with a woman on the Empire State Building prior to the alien invasion. Things begin to unravel and we begin to see that appearances can be deceptive.

Pros: The cinematography and special effects are stellar. This movie is great eye candy but you do not get an overdose of it. The acting is great and two of my favorites, Cruise and Freeman, are in this film and do a fine job. This is my first time seeing Andrea Riseborough and I enjoyed her performance. She portrays a sense of vulnerability while also wanting to stay in denial concerning the things Jack is discovering. I do like the story. Some of the criticisms I have read that there are plot elements that we have seen in other movies. While I can agree with that assessment, I can also see that this is common in Hollywood movies. I am fine with movies that may have similar plot elements to other movies as long as it is executed well and that is the case with this movie. I also enjoy the story. The movie mixes romance, mystery and action adventure into a tale that will keep the viewer engaged and caring about all the characters throughout. Despite great special effects this is a very character driven movie.

Cons: I really have only one minor complaint. Director Kosinski wanted this movie to be an homage to the science fiction films of the 70s and in many way he succeeds in that endeavor. The movie is paced more like a film from the 70s and it is slower than the more kinetic pacing we modern viewers and grown accustomed to. Is that a fault of the directors or is it a fault of the viewer? I will place blame on myself. We live in a fast paced mircowave society that wants instant gratification. So it was hard to slow down and get absorbed into the story. I just wasn't used to it. So really this is not a con, it is just something that the viewer needs to be aware of when going in to the movie. It is an old-fashioned movie and as I think more on the pacing, it really does work even though some viewers might not be used to it.

This movie does have some good re watch capabilities for me. As a mystery there are clues throughout the movie and on more than one viewing you can pick up on these clues. In an era where science fiction films are heavy with CGI and are like cotton candy for the mind, this one is not. It will make you think and keep you on your toes.

I thought it was going to be a five star movie considering Alex Jones called it an Illuminati tour de force.  It is true that is the potential we face in the future (and now):  government deception and a war on humans and terra farming a planet for resources.  I and others liked the film, but something was missing.  Something I can't put my finger on.  So, I'll give it four stars.

I have no idea why this movie didn't do better in theaters. Unless of course people are just getting dimmer and can't grasp the films concept. Maybe that's why Sci-Fi in general has to try really hard to find an audience.

Big action filled blockbusters appeal to a large audience. But, fanciful stories with emotional content that require some level of contemplation on the part of the viewer? Good luck finding a handful with the intellectual energy to track it.

This film struck a good balance. It had brilliant special effects and the action sequences were well paced and appropriate to driving the film forward. The acting however is what made this film. Tom Cruise may be a few almonds shy of a full candy bar but good lord can that man act. His character, Jack Harper, is real, you want to relate him. I found myself ( I'm kind of a cynical person by the way) choked up at the end of the film but in a good way.

While Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman are obviously the money draw in the picture they don't overshadow the supporting cast who also do equally well in driving the picture.

I started out renting this one. After seeing it, I know I want a copy. Rent it if you must but it's definitely worth the cost of taking up shelf space or memory on the hard drive.

I thought this was a good movie, to me it was similar to the Matrix with some Tom Cruise spin to it. IT had a good balance of action, it kept my attention. I would recommend it to those who are into SciFi like movies. I bought it to watch on a train ride, viewed it on a Kindle, didn't kill my battery watching it.

You have got to be kidding me. Well, I thought I couldn't go wrong, after all it IS Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman. Not !!! No way was this a typical Cruise movie and Freeman's role was nothing more than an extended cameo appearance, they must have needed the money. Even though I knew the plot beforehand, it took a while to see where this thing was headed. It was dullsville for the first 30 to 45 minutes into this movie and took a while for the plot to actually present itself. It wasn't until Freeman's appearance that the direction of the movie actually unfolded and started to make a modicum of sense. My wife fell asleep halfway through. And she loves both Cruise and Freeman.

I was not sure what to expect with this because I came into it not knowing anything more about the story than we had another future-earth-aftermath-of-some-event movie.  Generally we find what makes a movie "unique" within the first third so that the last 2/3 can be packed with action, chase, and very expected twists.  In this case the movie may seem slow but they are really making us work for the twist and it's pretty great when it lands.  Very solid flick.

This is a great SF movie that kept me guessing to the end.  The story line is compelling and the visuals are stunning.  Sound effects are amazing!  I have no idea why critics on rotten tomatoes knocked this one:  I guess it has more to do with Cruise then the film.  Go ahead, rent it but you may want to watch it at least a second time!

considering that the film did not seem to get much media attention. Great effects, good acting, good directing, good production values, violence not too sickening- for me what's not to like? The script is derivitive, but i enjoyed this take on invasions, cloning, love, politics, philosophy. Warning, though, Morgan Freemans scenes are brief and Tom Cruise looks old to me for really the first time. But all in all, "Oblivion" is fun!

This movie is absolutely beautiful to watch and a delight to hear.  A new home theater demo-disc to be sure.  It is Sci-Fi but not necessarily an action movie.  There is a difference!  There are very action heavy scenes but the movie focuses more on the character and mood not the whiz bang action and explosions.  Tell me if this sounds familiar;  a movie comes out that is action based sci-fi and people complain that its vapid and soulless, then a sci-fi movie comes out that tries to be soulful or character driven and its panned as boring, yet if it succeeds as either of these it's called derivative!  I'm sick of sci-fi-nerd-hater culture!  If you like sci-fi without being an overly critical nit-picking hater then you should be able to find plenty in this movie to enjoy.  The cinematography alone is worth the price.  Is it perfect? No, but it is certainly not terrible or cringe worthy.
I enjoyed the movie. It makes you think. always good in a sci-fi. there is a lot of recycling of old scripts these days but Oblivion was a new concept and was a very refreshing watch. recommended.

I had heard all the reviews about how this wasn't very good, so I waited until I could rent it.  I found it to be a very good sci-fi movie.  Gorgeously shot.  I was very surprised at how much I enjoyed this movie.  Once again I found that you can't believe everything you hear until you see it for yourself.

I did not like this film. It was disorganized, very confusing, bad writing. One should not have to watch it more than once to try to uderstand it better. I really respect and enjoy these actors, Cruise, Freeman, but just not in this film. In this film they are tru heros with heart, but if I may, there was at least one segment where Freeman's character goes on a long speech like talk, solo, and all cast remain quiet as a mouse. I thought, this character is full of himself and likes hearing himself talk. It was similar to listening to him narrate a documentary. The producers should have cut that piece out to make him more likeable. The brunette actres, Olga, is so very pretty, her face and hair especially in this one, but she had very few words, it left me thinking perhaps she needs to work on her acting skills. In another film she played a silent warrior woman, I forget the title, it was pre middle ages timeline, she starred with Michael Fastbender, she nailed that role, great acting despite no words. She was good in that Bond film too. The plot in this Oblivion film to me was poorly done, too hard to follow, you had to work hard to understand, leaving you tired, with headache, wondering if this was a time and money waste to watch. In fact, on several occasions I often thought the film was about to end and it appeared to be winding down, and also it was dull, I think I was hoping it would end, it dragged on and on. If I knew what it was like, I would not have seen it even if for free. There was only one segment I liked, when Cruise was driving a small aircraft and was being chased by other craft, there was shooting between them, that was very exicting, but ended with an impossible scenario leaving me as a viewer insulted by the writers. The two main female characters were very easy on the eyes. Oh, and to top off the not so good on this film, was a silly female character with a southern accent which sounded very fake. She was somewhat of a manager role, wizard like, only seen on a tiny screen, calling the shots, but very unlikable, worse acting; again, if this film is very futuristic, it made you think, since in this film, earth is not the earth we once knew, then how in the world can one develop a southern accent if there is no such thing as the south; in fact, no East Coast community, no accents at all, because it is not the same USA or world for that matter. Someone else wrote, "there is an explanation for that 'female wizard TV monitor screen bossy character', I thought, there should not be an explanation, we should get it, the first time. However I agreed, there is probably and explanation for everything in this film, but why bother, I do not want to dream up or think or create a book a story in my head while I watch it, if I did I would be a writer, instead I thought i would see this film for entertainment, that did not happen. There seemed to have been segments cut which left you with more questions that answers. It gets worse, the film seems to go back and forth in time so often, there is even a double or twin of one character, how did that happen?; so you need to figure that out too. You need to figure this out, that out, etc. and so on and so on. Such so it leaves your headache feel like your brain is being blown apart into " oblivion." So at least they picked a perfect title. I am still stunned and I am ashamed to admit to anyone that I saw this movie. I think I need to keep this secret to myself. Buyer, beware. Be kind to yourself, do not see this film, or else you will regret it. One final scary thought, as I began to write this review, I saw some folks gave it high stars ratings, liking it. I cannot imagine how or why, that was scary to me. I thought this film was more bad sci fi, not at all horror. Signed... -- Not smart enough for this film.
We enjoyed this si-fi. Cruise played a good part in this one. It had a little bit of everything you would enjoy in a movie. With a twist.

A *real* sci-fi movie!  Not the dumbed-down stuff we normally see in a movie of this scope.  Very, very refreshing.  Great cinematography, very well acted, all around just such a nice change.  Also, major points for not being overly graphic.  This movie was very story-driven but at the same time really draws you in with its visuals.
this movie was badass...plain and simple just badass i almost didn't rent it but im glad i did because this movie is badass

I missed seeing this movie in the theater where it would have been the best viewed but the blu-ray is stunning. If you are into sci-fi, you will enjoy this movie. Also, if you are a Tom Cruise fan, you will love it as he dominates the screen throughout the movie. The story is good, the acting very good, and the cinematography and music is outstanding.
As we enter the digital age, we may see the end of blu-ray, dvd, etc but if Hollywood wants to continue to sell physical medium, then this is how you sell a product. The blu-ray menu is nice, the features very good but what makes this blu-ray standout is the isolated soundtrack. I love that feature and I have only one other movie like this which was a dvd. You won't get this with a digital copy. The movie studios should continue this and if they could bundle the soundtrack on CD with the movie and charge an extra $5.00, I think that would be a great idea. One of the Ghost In The Shell movies came bundled with the soundtrack CD and I was impressed. This movie is diffiently worth the current $20.00 price.

I'm going to be succinct here.  This movie was just terrible. Don't rent it.  Don't buy it.

Watch an old time sci-fi movie from the 50's instead.  This movie was ill conceived and poorly thought out.

A Tom Cruise vehicle and not much more.  The cgi is good but the story is thin at best.  Independence Day redux and not very well redux.  Even the clone angle was apparent early on.  I'd title this vid "Obvious" instead of Oblivion.
There wasn't enough action to this an action flick.  It had long interludes of boring that didn't reach into the soul or move you.  This was boring.

This is a fun 'popcorn' science fiction movie with just enough substance to keep it going.  It's not deeply entrenched with dialog and heavy a plot line.  I wasn't expecting this to be very good but I was quite surprised how much I liked it.  You could get lost in the atmosphere, visually stunning with a sense of isolation.

Give it a rental, grab some popcorn and have a good ol' fashion sci-fi for dinner.
To really appreciate this film one must watch in a big scree HD TV. The visuals are great plus the story is pretty good. I don't want to spoil the film so I won't say much more.
I love sci-fi and Morgan Freeman, but this was not an action movie. It was more like drama with a little science fiction added.  It was just Cruise, Cruise... What a let down and waste of my money.

Another boring SiFi movie. Take parts of Blade Runner, The Matrix and Screamers; make it look like Prometheus; give Tom Cruise some sex scenes where he can emote and prove that he is hetro, than you have Oblivion. I felt I was in oblivion watching this movie.

Rented this movie, trailer looked good.  Disclaimer - I like to mock movies, if this is fun for you then that may be where the five star reviews are coming from.

Tom Cruise is hard to buy as an action star at his age.  People in the movie are continually doing things that make no sense, kind of like the people who run upstairs in the horror movies.

Without giving away the plot, you will constantly be asking yourself "How did the bad guys get into their superior position when they can't think of the simplest way to solve problems?"

+5000 to comments about a poor script, not a bad idea for a movie but just so very very bad plot execution.

If you must, please please please only rent this forgettable catastrophe.

Well written story with great cast all around and good ending. Certain people have said this was a mashup of other sci fi flicks but that can be said of any film in any genre. I think it was an epic movie and in my opinion had a great soundtrack of classic rock and r&b music. Cruise rarely disappoints and can make even the worst writers look genius and olga K. from the bond film was great as well. As far as sci-fi goes, this film brings the genre back up unlike Prometheus which was an overall disappointment for most fans. I would buy this movie and that is a rare statement from me so give it a try for a movie with the perfect mix of action and storytelling that is just over 2 hours long and well worth your money!

This is really a great movie.  Just watched it 3 times on Direct TV.  I will be purchasing this film on Blu-Ray for sure. The characters are developed, the story and script are well written and intelligent, and the music and cinematography are amazing and rich.  Tom Cruise does a fantastic job in this role and brings an emotional and endearing human side to this sci-fi film, a film that has many insights into what could actually become a reality for the human race and this earth.  My husband wanted to see this film because sci-fi is his favorite film genre and he was curious about the film, I wasn't so sure I would be watching it with him, but since Tom Cruise is in it, I decided to watch it too, and I totally enjoyed it.  It's the kind of movie to discuss afterwards and then watch again, it's a very intelligent movie.  If you liked Solaris or Vanilla Sky ( with Tom Cruise) you will like this one.  But this, unlike Solaris, has a lot of action and fighting, so "guys" will enjoy!
This movie is destined to be a Sci Fi classic.  Tom Cruise gives a mysterious performance.  This movie has its own look and feel.  Waited for release and got a great price here.  Thank you.

I'll make this short and sweet :- the similarities in plot devices and parallels between Oblivion and Moon (2009) struck me immediately. They are not identical, but their premises are oblique - which is not meant as criticism as much as its meant as comparison. Where one features a presumed man isolated on a mining base on the moon, the other posits a presumed man on earth following an alien invasion. Both have memories of people and situations in the past which they can't quite identify. Both come to confront replicas of their own physical beings. Both discover that they are androids. Both "sets" of androids die. Etc. Their are other, rather fundamental differences. Oblivion's Hans Zimmer-like score is maddening and distracting in the extreme. As usual, where this kind of thing is concerned, the minimalism in the music should not be the pounding, ostinato-driven repetition - but the MINIMAL use of music so as to ENHANCE its effect when its presence is required. When the score is nothing but another layer of unchanging sound, it ceases to be music and becomes noise -  it destroys, utterly, the purpose and real magic of music. Moon is much more recondite in its use of music. All this said, the best comparison of the two films would be by way of musical simile: where Moon is like chamber music (small in scope - restricted in range), Oblivion is operatic. Both are fine in their own ways - and, my objections to the score for Oblivion notwithstanding, both films work in their own, distinctive ways.

Instead I received The Bourne Legacy!  Can't rate what I didn't receive.  This was a gift and as it turns out my brother would like to keep it but now I am afraid to re-order for fear of getting another wrong product.

Ok. I will not rehash the plot of the story, as many reviewers before be had already done so. All I can say is that I loved the movie.

Now, in regards to the BluRay disc. Depending on the type of player you have, and the speed of your internet, might want to disconnect your internet from the BluRay player before you try to watch the disc. I have high speed internet access, high enough that I can stream HD movies from Amazon without buffering, but the disc took almost 10 minutes to load, as it accessed the internet to download more bloody trailers, and being a Universal Disc, it would not let me bypass the previews by pressing Top Menu or Title Menu. However, I found that by removing the BluRay player from the internet, the disc started to play right away with no delays. Hope that this helps anyone who ends up with a blank screen for more then 5 minutes on the Universal titles.

It wasn't great by any stretch of the imagination, but it was definitely a solid B+. Good visual effects, interesting storyline (although it's already been done many times), good acting and direction. I liked that it didn't have a single cheap jump-cut scare scene. Don't expect lots of character development or tearjerker scenes. This is strictly a story-driven movie. In the end, it held my interest for the entire runtime.

I'm still glad I held off buying the movie until rental became available. I don't think this one has lots of re-view value.
I'm a fan of both Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman.  Although I enjoyed the actors, I found myself watching the clock to see how much longer before this futuristic scifi movie ended.

The borrowing of themes and memes from other sci-fi movies can't be ignored. Thus deduct a star for lack of originality. But the special effects and beautiful cinematography are (to use a clich) truly visually arresting. (That it's not completely CGI makes a huge difference. Are you reading this, Mr. Lucas?) The acting is actually really good. (Cruise gives a great, nuanced performance ... for once.) I regret missing seeing this in the movie theaters or Imax. The "extras" in the Blue Ray are not overwhelming. But they are interesting. It's not clear why the deleted scenes were deleted. They all should have been left in. If you can overlook the borrowed thematic elements then you will love this movie.
P.S. Almost forgot -- the sound track by M83 is fantastic. It adds to the overall quality of this movie. I've got it play-listed on my Spotify account. I have actually been listening to it all summer since it came out.
This movie was awesome. I just wish it was more about the "tent" or whatever it was called cause i'm curious about the war and how it started.. but overall I loved the movie.. great film.
I am not much of a Tom Cruise fan, but he did a pretty good job in this one. The special effects were top notch. Definitely a movie that I have to add to my DVD library.

This is visually stunning SF. While I was watching it I was so grateful someone actually invested the money to make this film because it is that rare film you can just turn the sound off (or play only the soundtrack) and give the eyes a feast.

Tom Cruise gets a bad rap, and I think unfairly, because of some of his 'antics' and his religion. I don't really care about either. His antics have never hurt anyone and, so far as I know, his religion hasn't either. Yes, I know there are allegations of abuse but that is true of any religion and any atheist group, as well.

But he delivers yet again another terrific performance, something he has done more consistently than any actor over the past 30 years. The rest of the cast, but I have to point out maybe the most surprising performance in the film and right up there with Cruise, that of Andrea Riseborough as Victoria.

I think the 'scavs' were a disappointment, however, and that is why I take off half a star.

Yes, Morgan Freeman is good but they never seemed real to me within the confines of the universe the director had created. Small criticism since they really aren't as prominent as they should have been but no spoilers here. I was able to watch the film without any foreknowledge and I enjoyed it as such. I wouldn't want to ruin that for anyone.

The ending? There are great and surprising moments leading up to the penultimate scene in the film. It is an odd scene which is by turns stunning and somewhat pedantic. It didn't rise up to the level of the expectations I had built. But I enjoyed the ride so much getting there that I didn't matter. And I have to admit I did enjoy the very final scene even though I saw it coming.

The extras are very good. Tom Cruise is always interesting in his commentaries as he is here with the director. He is not just an actor playing a part. He puts real thought into the film and has great appreciation for everything involved in making a film as a skill.

Tom Cruise has a reputation for super action.  This movie is not that.  Don't get me wrong.  Stuff does splode real good but this is a more cerebral sci-fi.  It isn't perfect, though I couldn't tell you anything that I would recommend changing.  Perhaps it is the certain level of bleakness inherent in the tale that leaves an after taste.  I am glad that I watched it and I can recommend it wholeheartedly if you enjoyed movies like Blade Runner, Matrix or the early parts of The Island.  Tom Cruise is making some interesting moves these days.  I wrote him off. . .for reasons that don't need to be expounded. . .but after Jack Reacher, Rock of Ages and Oblivion I'm now more of a fan interested in seeing what kinds of choices he makes next. As an actor and a brand he has a lot more life left in him.

I almost did not watch this movie due to some of the reviews I read on rotten tomatoes website. I am glad that I decided to watch this movie after review good reviews on Amazon. I am also very glad that I didn't read any of the plot, so the twist and turns in the plot added to the development to the whole story.

My ten and twelve year-olds watched it with me and my wife and both loved the story. I told them this is what a good sci-fi movie is about, and I just made two believers from this movie.

Great movie, and the ending is bitter sweet. We need more movies like this. Great job!
Completely boring.  It was extremely hard to watch and I haven't seen the end even now.  Two people to defend the universe water conversion...please.

Great Movie, best I've seen in a long time! Loved everything about it. From the Sci-fi theme, to the romantic storyline that grew stronger as the movie progressed. Great effects and cinematography and the surprising twists and turns had me at the edge of my seat until the end.
5++ This movie will go down in history like like The Crow or Empire Strikes back with HOPE for humanity.

I've been waiting on a great sci-fi film since District 9, and this one is real solid imo. Great acting, music, story, special effects...an awesome package. Cruise and Freeman really nailed their parts and what a twisting plot. I like that this movie makes you think for yourself rather than spoon feeding everything to you.

Hard to just echo what everyone else is saying, but it's true.  That was one great movie!  The plot was a little hard to follow, and I had to back it up once or twice to catch up with what was happening.  Whew, and wow too.  Mind blowing twists and turns, and then a fantastic ending.  I hardly ever am moved to write a review, but for some reason I wanted to for this film.  I give it very high recommendations.

The trouble with this item is not the item itself but the delivery from Amazon Instant Video.  The movie froze at least 3 times (once going to a black screen), requiring in 2 of those instances a return to the Wii menu.  My Wi-Fi signal is not the issue because I don't have this problem with my Wii (for Netflix) or other electronic devices in my home.  Charging a $4.99 rental fee in this case, Amazon should do a better job with the delivery or at least reduce the fee.  This is the second time I've used AIV and I had trouble both times.  Very disappointing.
I got it...but my wife fell asleep. Not well structured. Mediocre movie with great stars. Must have run out of money with the special effects.
The movie is a very imaginative science fiction entry.  Although a bit long, the acting and story line are both good and the movie is worth watching.

Thank you brother for keep making the kick ass good ones. Sci fi forever!  This movie is great. special effects really good. plot is solid and first rate. the special effects make this movie, along with Tom and Olga, and the whole cast. As a sci fi fan, and action fan, it is up to par. the director did a fabulous job here. the surface of the earth is what blew my mind most. very well done.
watch movie without interruption to follow plot. good story line, with a twist. the visual effects were very good enjoyed in surround sound.

Not sure how they promoted this movie and whether maybe it was just the timing of it's release. So with that said, I wished I could have seen it on the big screen and not on my 42 inches LCD. Tom Cruse did a great job as always, I know some folks may not be Tom Cruse fans, but he makes you believe in the movie.
Great Movie!

As of late I have had trouble watching any Tom Cruise movie. His reputation as a complete a**hole and his $cientology connections. I dislike him as as person but he is a decent actor and his sci fi stuff is alright, still he always seems to be an "intense, focused" a**hole in everything he does , he was okay here.
How ever I felt that I was watching a movie set in the land scape of Fallout3 without the best parts of that game. The plot was engaging while still predictable and I felt the love story was forced. The best actor, Morgan freeman did not have near enough screen time.
The special effects were pretty good but not mind blowing.
And while somewhat enjoyable, almost an hour and 20 minutes in I still wasn't sure if Morgan wasn't the real hero or the main villain.
Borrow a friends copy rather than buy this one

Star Wars-Matrix-Blade Runner-Wall-E hybird that is not at all fractionally entertaining as those other films
A big steaming pile. But shame on me. I should of known better.

Oblivion is a mashup of several science fiction movies.  Tom Cruise is the same old Tom Cruise.  I'm going to go reread some classic science fiction now since  it is far more imaginative than this movie.

If you love Sci-Fi movies you will love this one. It makes you think too. It has everything a great sci-fi movie should: robots, cool vehicles & aircraft/spacecrafts, cool guns, good battle scenes. Does it have aliens? Watch to find out!
Great visuals. Interesting concept. Great on Blue Ray. If you saw it at the show, you'll like even more on your own big screen.
This pic delivered! I always have reservations when looking at Cruise's movies.  But, this one was very entertaining.  A little bit on the cooky cutter side, but good otherwise.
Great mind blowing ending. Never new that it was coming. I would recommend this movie for friends to watch. Suspenseful!
Great visuals, good action and suspense, but too many "what the?" moments when trying to understand the plot line.  Suspend reality and enjoy the movie.

I believe this may be the very first time I have not been happy with Amazon.  Normally you guys are the best on everything !!  When I brought this movie up and purchased it, I thought I was buying a DVD at your usual great prices.  I had no idea I was actually purchasing something that would be in some kind of Cloud Library, that could be recalled at a later date.

It could very well be that this is the wave of the future and I will be happy watching this on my iPad when I am out of town or something but the marketing is unclear.  Well either the marketing is unclear or I am just not very smart.  I will think long and hard before I spend 15 bucks for something to be stored in the Cloud.  Is there a way to see what all you have in there?

Other than a hick-up at the beginning of the movie when I had to reboot and start over it was a very good movie and I really liked it.

Mike Mayberry

Where Oblivion succeeds most is as a pure sensory experience.  I suggest you watch this film on the biggest screen possible with the volume loud - very few movies look or sound as good as this one does.  Three elements make this movie worth watching (and owning on blu-ray):

1. The Design - the technology and architecture is amazing.  You can tell that the production design was given a great deal of care (in fact, many of the designs come directly from the director's graphic novel).  I think the Bubbleship is an amazing vehicle and a great design.  Movies like this present exciting possibilities for what future technology might look like - and that's something I enjoy contemplating.

2. The Locations - I love when movies take you to places that you might never get to visit in person.  A lot of this movie was shot in real locations (in particular the amazing landscapes of Iceland), rather than on soundstages with bluescreen.  It's also interesting to see recognizable landmarks (the Pentagon, the Washington Monument, Empire State Building, etc) deserted and destroyed.  Of course, the destruction is all thanks to visual effects, but it looks very realistic.

3. The Soundtrack - the original music for the film was written by M83, and it's the best movie score of the year.  The soundtrack perfectly compliments the visuals.  In fact, the blu-ray has an isolated score so you can watch the movie with only the music (no dialogue or sound effects) - watching the movie this way illustrates how much of the story can be conveyed through the music alone.

A lot of the criticisms of the movie deal with the fact that the movie is derivative - that it borrows ideas from other films.  I would not dispute that claim; I would just say that not every movie is going to be groundbreaking in terms of story or plot.  I think there are enough ideas in this movie to keep it interesting - even if I've seen it all before, I haven't seen it quite like this.
I don't like Tom Cruise much but I enjoyed this movie so much he didn't bother me for a change. great fx and an interesting idea.

They're running out of ideas.
They put anything and everything out there and call it a movie.
We suckers pay to see this junk and the actors, the "1%" laugh all the way to the bank.
Seriously?
Anyway, the movie is boring. I agree with the comment that Prometheus is a masterpiece compared to this. At least Prometheus could be followed. This film is just weird. Unless you're a big fan of Sci-Fi films, then, I daresay, you're not going to like this.

Reviews?!? We don't need no stinkin' reviews!! This is a solid and original movie. Casting is decent, acting is believable, and the look is convincing. Best movie ever? Not a chance. Good enough to purchase? Well, I did.
It has elements of Star Wars , Enemy Mine and Indiana Jones (thematically), so how could it bomb ?!? Good , entertaining with a few twists and plenty of action !
Action-packed film with a couple of twists; kept a person's interest; machine vs. man with an escape hide away.  Would recommend this film to a friend.

This is a must watch for fans of sci-fi, as it is truly visionary film conceptually and stunning in its cinematography. Ordinary film-goers should also consider seeing this in theaters for the thrilling action and fascinating mind-games Oblivion offers to the audience. A moving tale of the transcendence of love and a provocative examination of conscience, home, memory and what it means to be truly human.

For a full review, search for my blog "Pulling On The Push Door", and look for the "Oblivion" review.

*Thoughts on Blu-Ray at the bottom*

Oblivion is a fun, if not particularly great sci-fi action film starring Tom Cruise from writer/director Joseph Kosinski.  A wonderful treat for the eyes, Oblivion manages to create a fun, visual spectacular sci-fi action flick, even if its story leaves something to be desired.

The opening narration of the film establishes that Earth has been attacked by an alien force.  Most of the population has evacuated Earth to create a colony on Titan.  Earth meanwhile is being terra formed to make conditions suitable for human life.  The orbital space station "Tet" oversees this process.  On the surface a cleanup crew of Jack Harper (Tom Cruise) and Victoria Olsen (Andrea Riseborough) handle drone repair and fend off the alien Scavengers ("Scavs" for short) who threaten the drones and power stations on the planet's surface.  They receive orders from Sally (Melissa Leo) aboard Tet, and is their sole human contact.

Jack is curious of his surroundings, and in his final two weeks of duty a series of events take place that cause him to question his mission.  After capsules containing human bodies fall from the sky and are destroyed by the drones he's been watching over he is thrust into a life or death struggle to discover to real fate of the planet, and its human population.

Oblivion reminded me an awful lot of the kind sci-fi movies made during the 1970s.  The movie has numerous twists and I'd say at a certain point you're either going to throw your hands up in frustration or simply accept that this is the kind of movie you're watching.  Oblivion feels right at home next to movies such as The Omega Man, Soylent Green, and Logan's Run, and if you go in expecting that kind of story you shouldn't be too disappointed.

Tom Cruise isn't breaking any new ground with his performance in Oblivion.  He's as good as he's ever been in the hero's role, but still, given the nature of the script there were a lot of directions they could have gone with this character.  Cruise gives the best performance in the film, but that isn't saying too much.  If they'd added some more internal conflict to the Jack Harper character I'm sure Cruise could have pulled it off and the movie would have been better for it.  As it is, this is you're pretty typical protagonist role for Tom Cruise.

It is the visuals and action sequences of Oblivion that really sell the picture.  As with his previous outing in TRON: Legacy, Joseph Kosinski proves he has an eye for striking sci-fi visuals and spectacular action.  When the story isn't breaking any new ground the visuals will keep you interested, if nothing else.  It just works.  Oblivion has some outstanding aerial battles involving Jack's "Bubble Ship" which really is a blast to watch.  From a design standpoint I  think the bubble ship Jack flies around is one of the coolest I've seen on film, looking like a cross between a helicopter and a dragonfly.  I wouldn't be surprised if the bubble ship winds up being the thing people remember most about this movie.

 As it is Oblivion, is an enjoyable sci-fi action movie.  If you're at all a fan of those old sci-fi movies where plot twists lie around every corner, exciting action sequences, and exciting sci-fi visuals odds are you'll enjoy Oblivion.

Blu-Ray:
The Blu-Ray release of Oblivion has great picture and sound.  Special features include a decent look into the making of the film.  What I valued most about the special features was the knowledge that many of Oblivion's effects were done in-camera.  In an age where CGI dominates almost every aspect of film this is refreshing, and further aids Kosinski in making Oblivion a tribute to 70s sci-fi. Also included are deleted scenes and a feature commentary by director Kosinski and Cruise, and an isolated soundtrack score.

Oblivion release will make great use of your Blu-Ray player, HDTV, and sound system.  I wish there'd been more material discussing the world of Oblivion, but it is a satisfying purchase. So, I'm going to give a thumbs up to Oblivion on Blu-Ray.

There is a little something here for everyone. If your idea of Science Fiction is technology and CGI firefights this movie has it. If you want a hero with heart, as much as I don't like Tom Cruise's real persona, he delivers. If you are tired of psychological manipulation and lies, the plot celebrates the value of truth over a many layered deception. If you hate drones and the idea of mindless mechanized destruction you'll love it. If you love the Earth and believe in the triumph of love and the human spirit you will be uplifted (for a change). Tired of Zombies, senseless violence, and seeing the worst humanity has to offer? This is your film. Held my interest right to the end and that hasn't happened in a long long time.
A post-apocalyptic story that gets the job done... amazing scenery blends nicely with the real world. No spoilers but it does have a happy ending. Kind of. ;-)
This is a great movie that is beautiful to watch and really makes you think about what is around the next corner

First, IGNORE ALL BAD REVIEWS OF THIS MOVIE.

Second, IGNORE ALL BAD REVIEWS OF THIS MOVIE.

Seriously, anyone giving this a bad review has to be the extreme geeky type that isn't pleased unless every little detail is perfect.  C'mon... You know the type I'm talking about.  They live in their grandma's basement and spend hours conversing in Klingon or arguing about what Chewie kept in each pocket of his bandolier.

Bottom line is: this movie is well worth adding to your collection.  This is one of the best sci fi movies I've seen in a while.  I now look forward to memorizing every line, actor, stuntman, gaffer, makeup artist, and pizza delivery boy involved with the production of this masterpiece.

All the actors are so fabulous, especially american newcomer Andrea Riseborough who is so captivating. Tom Cruise's professional career culminates in this film. Also the views and CG are truly fabulous.

I will NOT include any spoilers at all in this review, you can be sure of that.

What most people have been claiming about this movie is that it has many elements of innumerable other sci-fi movies. It's true, it has from small bits to colossal similarities in plot, filming, conclusion, and development from other titles. But it's not necessarily a copy, but a brilliant adaptation of what others have created.

People who have enjoyed titles like "Alien", "Matrix", "Red Planet", "Avatar", "Planet of the Apes", "Star Wars", "I, Robot" and "A.I." will surely enjoy this masterpiece.

When I first read about this movie and noted that Tom Cruse starred, I thought (like many others might) that Tom Cruise is anything but Sci-Fi material. His role in movies like Top Gun, MI (saga), Jack Reacher, and many other, wouldn't really make him suitable for this kind of film, but then again... Remember his appearance in Vanilla Sky, quite a great movie, and with similar elements to Oblivion.

All I can say about this movie is that it's suitable for anyone that loves Sci-Fi and Thrillers. I sustain my opinion of it as one of the greatest Sci-Fi titles since Matrix. And like Matrix, it is one movie that must be first-seen with as few (or none at all) spoilers at all.

As with rating, I'd say it is suitable for anyone down to 8 years old, there are some scenes that might qualify as violent, but they are minimal, since sound (explosions, alien sounds, machinery, etc.) is what enhances the violent scenes that might not be suitable for minors.

This is a must watch for all Sci-Fi fans.

I loved it. Oblivion delivers. It would have made a 100 million at the domestic box office if not for poor scheduling. Had it opened two weeks earlier it would have made over 100 million domestically. Tom Cruise still delivers after over three decades with a movie that is wonderfully crafted around people rather than kiddie superhero CGI. The movie had action aplenty but it was not action for the sake of action. The action came from the story line and the characters who peopled it. It is beautifully filmed and engrossing and satisfying until the last frame. Buy it, Rent it, whichever is your choice. Its worth it. Tom Cruise, the entire cast, the director and the film deliver.

I was impressed by this movie. I did not expect it to be that well done. I usually know what is going to happen in every movie or tv show before it happens. This one took me by surprise. It is not a movie that I will watch more then once or twice but well worth watching.
surprisingly good plot for a Tom Cruise movie.  Still, never really reached escape velocity, but reliable Tom Cruise entertainment for his fans.

Oblivion is a movie of human yearning for something that cannot be verbalized, but the heart is sure must exist somewhere just beyond the horizon. Tom Cruise's character longs for something, although he's not sure what, and his amazing portrayal of that subtle emotion along with the beautiful effects and scenery combines to make this one of the best movies of the year, and hands down the best sci-fi. I pre-ordered the DVD and can hardly wait for it to arrive so I can watch it again.

This movie has all the elements of a GREAT movie! First, it is Science Fiction! A man who stands apart finds Eternal Love and HOME!! And Led Zeppelin!! On my list of my top favorites The Last Samurai is always in the top 3 for me. I remember the LOOK on his face when he finds HOME from both movies!!! And he also has a companion named "Bob" he seems to always have one-way conversations with!
Sucked if not for the special effects and the fact that Morgan Freeman was in it, I would've never finished watching the movie.

This is of course all purely opinion, but, I love this movie.  It is one of the best sci-fi movies I have seen in a while.  Star Trek has really passed over to the Action genre.  I went to see this movie in the theater with no expectations, and I was blown away.  The imagery and visuals are terrific.  the story plays out nicely, leaving you wanting to know more as the movie progresses, which is key to hold someone's attention.  I love the soundtrack.  My father-in-law loves sci-fi and I highly recommended this to him as his favorite movie for 2013.  Hopefully he likes it.
Great movie... the best sci-fi movie ive seen in a long time great twist to wrap everything up..would recommend to anyone who like sci-fi

I'm a Sci-Fi fan and and this movie is great. If you are used to sci fi in general you'll probably figure out the huge plot point within a couple of minutes of the movie starting, but you'll still have to continue watching to understand why that is the case.

This isn't your standard post apocalyptic alien invasion movie. It has a little bit more brains. The setting is fantastic, the environment and cinematography is fantastic. Acting is ok, action is great, and the over arching plot point, really sets it apart from your standard "Aliens invade en mass and try to kill us." There is a far more intelligent methodology. What makes it work is the perspective that the move is told from. Meaning Tom Cruises characters's perspective is a unique take on a classic theme. Give it a shot.
Tom Cruise bores me to tears in this predictable dung-heap of a film.  Rent it for $1 from your local video vending machine - you'll be sorry if you make the purchase.
This movie is so bad that makes Prometheus a Masterpiece.  This movie is pointless, boring, absurd, and over rated.  Rent this only if you are curious.

Technically flawless effects mixed with heavy synthesizer music in a movie about the last humans on Earth after an alien invasion.  It all combines for an awesome homage to some of the great genre movies - The Road Warrior, Escape from New York, Planet of the Apes, and even Logan's Run.

Though the movie has a great take on the concept - some would call it a twist - it does bog down a time or two because characters don't bother having necessary conversations when one expects them to do so.  I chalk this up to storytelling technique and it does allow for a better visual journey toward the answers.

A minor quibble is that the alien invasion is shown to have started in 2017 but the human technology shown to exist at that time is at least several decades away.  I'm not sure why that date was chosen when a movie set in the future could have been written for any period of time, but it certainly doesn't detract from one's enjoyment of the film.

One can tell the concept started as a graphic novel by taking in the amazing visuals of post apocalyptic America.  The flying chase sequence also has the hallmarks of storyboarded shots fleshed out to full motion effects.  Indeed, when I think back on the movie, a series of framed scenes pop out in my memory.

Overall, I highly recommend this movie.
Way better than the other garbage out there today. People who didn't like are probably young 'reality tv' watchers, or better known as useful idiots.
You take an open mind into seeing this movie and you will not be disappointed. Good scifi writing and action. Cast are all top notch.
Highly recommended! I paid 14.99 to watch it in my home projector screen and was very happy with that decision. Besides, Tom Cruise looks his best in a pilot seat, which you get a lot in this movie!
Interesting cliff hanger.  Kept our attention till end. Some dialog unclear.  Worth watching with great graphics. Tom Cruise looked great.

If you like Tom Cruise playing Tom Cruise then you'll love this movie. This was a true disappointment. It had such potential. But the film is all special effects and predictable plot twists.

Don't bother.
Lov Tom cruise but this movie was terrible long boring n just unbelievable too weird for me not sure how it got 3 stars
I thought this was a good movie. To me, it makes me think of how people blindly follow orders to do certain jobs and when they question things, they realize what they thought were true, isn't.
Loved it. Is what a science fiction movie should be, entertaining, riveting, a must see experience. 5 star recommendation.  Happy...
Great script, actors and music. Uptempo Hollywood style. The recurrent topics with aliens and apocalyptic cliches. The enemy without is again addressed.

I was expecting what passes for a typical, modern, post-apocalyptic, big-budget sci-fi movie with Oblivion: a movie that was more suited to a bargain bin, just a hair above a 'b' sci-fi channel flick; and maybe not even that.  Loaded with trite messages about how bad humans are or how we screwed up the planet or some other tired overdone plot with all the distracting special effects the creators could junk into the frame at a time.  Instead I found myself really enjoying this movie.  It had very well done special effects that felt real and added to the story instead of becoming the focal point themselves.  The actors did a decent job, and the plot was familiar yet had some unique elements that kept it very entertaining and even gave it re-watch-ability.  I think it has wide appeal, especially to lovers of the genera.

I saw this movie in the theater. It is action packed, but the story line didn't provide much in the way of grabbing my interest. I actually fell asleep for a few minutes! It's not bad, but I don't recommend that you waste your money buying the DVD unless it's like $5.  This is a "bargain bin" movie (dvd).

I don't always like Tom Cruise, but he did very well in this one.  Good mix of action and a little drama of course, a little clich towards the end but it didn't mess things up too much.  Some of the scenes would have really been great at an IMAX, didn't get to see it there though...not sure I would have wanted to pony up the bucks either.  I do have a decent 3d set, that makes it worth a second look (first time was 2d).

I've watched this movie three times now and could not get off my seat every time I put it on. It's plot is a bit thin but the acting and progress of the film is paced very well and the movie looks and sounds amazing. There's a love story but some action as well. I would definitely recommend anyone to buy if they have the least bit of interest in it. Tom Cruise played the role very good. I could feel the immersion in this film. Not so much from Morgan Freeman but he's not a big part of the movie. There's some really awesome sound effects that made me smile and the soundtrack is unbelievable. Wish I would have seen it at the theaters. You end the movie thinking it was good but it sticks with you. You'll watch it again paying attention to details.

I have always been a big fan of Sci-Fi movies and there are some great ones out there.
This movie started well but ended up with clunky movement foreward and little convincing
drama, often confusing building up leading to nothing.  Cruise has made some great
movies.  I wish that this had been one of them.  Visuals were nice so on a big screen
there were nice visual moments.

This was a nice relief from what currently masquerades as Sci Fi these days. Great story, thin characters that allowed the story to shine thru and CGI that added to the story, rather than taking over from it.

I mention the CGI because when CGI is done right, it makes you want to have the device, be in the story and believe in the future tech. Too many movies these days have a story that falls flat on it's face, Then tries to make up for that with CGI.

Oblivion is CGI done just right, adding to this complex, but yet simply told story that will never fail to surprise you too. Watching it for the second time tonight!

From a writer's point of view, this is the retelling of the Moses story. When you watch this. look for the shapes that we know well from Egypt, the idea of Moses stopping the abuse of a slave by an over-seer and some other images that will tell you more. Won't spoil this for you, but there is more than meets the eye, in Oblivion's imagery.

I've tired of people saying the movie copied this and copied that.  All movies copy something from each other and what made this movie enjoyable was that the pieces fit well into the story.  I must commend the director Joseph Kosinski and his editor.  They did a marvelous job of movie pacing.  There are slow cerebral moments and then high paced action sequences and never once did I feel the story dragged down or got slow.

For a year of multiple science fiction movies from "Into the Darkness", "Pacific Rim", "After Earth", "Robot and Frank", and my much anticipated movie "Elysium", (There are others but these are what I've seen so far) I'd say this Oblivion so far is my favorite Sci-Fi movie this year.  I'm sure that "Elysium" will top that.  Definitely worth you time to watch and enjoy

This is I think one of those shows that just did catch on while it was in the theaters. I was not able to go an see it there but wanted too.  So for me picking it up on instant video at Amazon was a good deal. I hope you enjoy it as much as I did.

I can't say that I'm a huge fan of Tom Cruise in any regard but this movie is fundamentally pretty good. I think it's easily worth 4 possibly 5 stars depending really on how strict you are with the ratings. For pure entertainment purposes, this is a winner.
plot was intriguing, but story line seems rushed. I would imagine it was a movie made from the hype of a book. I just wish they took more time to play it out.

I suppose the impact is greater in a theater, where the actor's faces are twenty feet tall. However, on a computer monitor, the high flying concepts encased in this film seemed to shrink a bit. One cannot fault the production values. They are absolutely impeccable. However, if exploitation of certain memes in Hollywood culture counts as a black mark for getting out of sticky explanation points, well, the narrative structure doesn't maintain the pristine impeccability of the physical design.
I was really pleasantly surprised by this movie. An innovative and interesting plot with great acting (for a sci-fi). Great cinematography and a wonderful score, not to be missed.

Half the movie is like a music video (I mean that in the best way possible), Tron Director Joseph Kosinski recruited M83 to do the soundtrack for this film, just as he got Daft Punk to 'score' Tron Legacy. The music goes together so well with the absolutely incredible cinematography, and to top it all off, the visuals are so good, you will actually feel like you have escaped to another world. As for the story and acting, both good, but the visuals are infatuating enough, they alone are worth the price of admission.
Love Morgan Freeman, not a big Tom Cruise fan at all, but he did a really good job in this.
Good acting, great special effects, visually stunning and very entertaining. It is not an all-time great but I liked the movie. Some people on here fancy themselves real critics. You're not.

Oblivion 2013 124 min Action/Adventure/Sci-Fi April 19, 2013 USA Director:Joseph Kosinski Writers:Karl Gajdusek - screenplay, Michael Arndt - screenplay Stars:Tom Cruise, Morgan Freeman, and Olga Kurylenko Underrated SciFi as far as I am concerned. Some critics may say there are parallels and similarities to other movies, but I didn't feel that and I have seen most the SciFi movies out there from the last sixty years. Whether you are a fan of Cruise or Morgan or not, it doesn't matter. The story is compelling enough to satisfy most SciFi fans. I went into this with no more than a few glimpses of preview scenes and no idea of the ending at all. Although had I known it would have detracted some from the experience, it still wouldn't take away from the overall story, acting, scenery, and special effects. My step-daughter begged me to pause it whenever she left the room, and my wife was upset when she came downstairs and realized we were watching it without her. I had bought this so my wife need not worry about viewing it, but my point is the ladies will enjoy this one too so be sure they are present. A man and woman are left to finish mining the oceans before joining the rest of mankind on Jupiter's moon Titan. They have both had memory wipes but the man is seeing flashbacks of another time. He starts to question who he really is and does he really want to leave Earth. What he finds out while fighting the alien scavengers will change mankind forever. Recommendations: Planet Of The Apes,The Time Machine, and Minority Report CA Luster
i was really expecting more here due to all the hype but in the end it became a bit tiresome.
It was a great show.  The plot and sequence of unexpected directions kept me interested during the entire length of the movie.  I will watch it again!
i liked it, and found it interesting and full of the sci fi thing. Good enough for me to watch.
The graphics are awesome but the plot is retarded and the acting is stupid.  It's like someone was trying to polish a turd.
Movie had a nice surprise in the theme and had enough action.  I think this was not rated well, but for home rental, it was good entertainment for the night.

The story line for Oblivion is filled with mystery and suspense. The beauty of the visual landscape belies the tragic circumstances that preceeded the immediate story. The actors do a fine job creating believable characters and, although the last 15 minutes of the movie was a bit anticlimactic, there were plenty of surprises to keep the story interesting.

Although the movie is okay I don't think it is worth spending more than a few bucks to watch  I'm glad I didn't go see it at the box office or I would have been very displeased. I personally think that advertising that Morgan Freeman as a co-star was very misleading. He was in all of about 3-4 scenes and they were relatively limited. I don't know the two girls' names who were co-stars, but they both had far more scene time than Morgan did. As usual he did - as usual - do a fine job.

This movie was alright but it definitely wasn't Cruise's best by far or for that matter Freeman's either. Worth watching,it was entertaining. I would have given it a 3.5 if it was a choice but I'll let the 3 rating stand.

Cinematography was well done, cgi effects blended well.  Storyline has been used before but as usual skillful acting and thoroughly twisted plot will keep you guessing as to what has gone on and how it leads up for the climax.  Couple of scenes drag part of the plot down bu still overall good intertainment
The whole movie is confusing and unclear what is going on.  Morgan Freeman is in the movie for maybe 10min total.  It's not a poorly acted movie, but a poorly written one.

this review is on the blu ray disc of the movie as follows -
movie - 4 / 5
video - 4.5 / 5
audio - 4.5 / 5

good addition to your collection of sci-fi movie.
storyline needed just that little topping to push it
up to 5 stars.
great video and audio throughout.
recommended.

I saw a lot of negative reviews before watching this, and after seeing it, it left me wondering:  what the heck do people want?

It's so hard anymore to find something that is not derivative of something else coming out of Hollywood.  Was the plot completely unique?  Not completely.  Was it entertaining?  Yes, for me it was.  It was well executed, the special effects were very good.  I thought Tom did a good job, after reading several reviewers that didn't.  Some of those reviews were colored by their views on Tom's personal life and religious affinities.  Really?  I expect actors to entertain me.  If I were going to judge an actor by their politics, or world views, I would not enjoy a great many actors and actresses.  Similarly, I don't go into a movie looking to find plot holes or continuity errors.  I simply go to be entertained.  To take my mind off my life.

I've amended my original review with the benefit of hindsight.  This movie stuck with me, and I've viewed it several times since.  For me, it was simply a very well executed movie.  And, it was good Sci-Fi.  Much better, in my opinion, than a lot of the Sci-Fi that the Hollywood machine has offered lately.  I remain surprised by those that rate it so low.  I wonder if they're not really fans for the genre, or perhaps movie critic types?  My whole family really liked it.

So, entertaining? Check.  Good acting? Check.  Good special effects? Check.  Good directing?  Check.  Good story?  Yes, actually it was. It was derivative of other stories that have come before to some extent.  But the story had it's own vision.  Really, if you're going to whine about it not being completely unique, don't watch Hollywood movies.  It was unique enough, for me.  It was good Sci-Fi.  If you like Sci-Fi (and I love good Sci-Fi), I can't see why you'd come away not at least enjoying it.  For me, it was worth it.
I enjoyed it, great cinematics, plot was interesting.... Amazon wants more info than that so I'm typing this to fill in the word requirement

Plot was a little obvious about fifteen minutes in but it had a good pace and had a couple of little twists at the end.  I enjoyed it and it passed my litmus test that I didn't fall asleep half way through.
Ok!  for a stay wake person! Fun to watch but no redeeming value.  Lot of good action, but story line is mediocre.

Oblivion is a visually appealing flick with a strong bias toward lifting elements from sci-fi that did it better, and thankfully those movies didn't try to cram the whole kitchen sink into two hours. The action sequences were mostly good, though sometimes hokey ("I'm a droid with frickin' lasers, so naturally I'm going to come alongside your craft and ram you!" <-- seems legit). In the end, Oblivion left as many questions open as it answered and it sailed too close to the sun. I pray the open loops are not entry points for a sequel, it wasn't polished enough for folks to get excited about the prospect.

Then again, Hollywood's not known for its good sense. (See: Grown Ups 2, Extra Excrement Edition)
Good amount of action and the story had a fair amount of twists and intrigue.  Will watch this again when released.

very nice  futuristic movie with a technology that is near to reach for us as humans

i give 5 star  we like and enjoy from vegging to ending
I like anything with Morgan Freeman and this doesn't disappoint ! Plenty of action and looks & sounds fabulous on 1080HD with Dolby surround!

I generally hold Morgan Freeman in high regard.  I find that he can usually get a primary or secondary character shine when acting alongside him.  This didn't hold true for Tom Cruise, nor did the script/story add anything worthwhile to the experience.  I only wish I would've rented before I bought... but it was Morgan Freeman!
One of Tom Cruise's worst performances ever. I love Morgan Freeman, if his part would have been better and longer he might have helped the movie. All and all a really poor movie.

I was hesitant to watch this after seeing some very bad reviews from movie critics. I am glad that I watched it. The plot was engaging, the characters were interesting, the plot twists (which I will not go into) actually made the movie more enjoyable, the effects were great, and the depiction of post apocalyptic Earth was intriguing. I wish that Morgan Freeman would have appeared earlier in the film. I wish that the last five minutes of the film (after the movie's climax) would have been changed or eliminated which is why I didn't give it a five star rating.

If you enjoy Science Fiction films, this is a film you should definitely check out.
There was no connection with any of the characters.  There was not sense of the calamity. The characters were bland.
I thought this was a really good movie.  Many plot twists right up to the ending seeing Tom Cruise to something different was refreshing.

A fantastic movie with everything a science fiction classic aught to have; Stunning special effects, a brisk yet atmospheric pace, "aliens" and technology, (and my personal favorite element of this film) an excellent soundtrack. The score is from the same creator that did the soundtrack for Tron Legacy with a haunting futuristic feel. The whole movie has a very entrancing atmosphere as the audience is introduced to a gritty post apocalyptic Earth strewn with the refuse and debris of it's former self. This is artistically contrasted with the very cool looking clean-cut and bold design of the technology the survivors use, who are left surveying this dying world. The plot is fairly typical with nothing totally unseen however, this movie does like to throw a handful of plot twists your way of which I personally have never been a big fan. It isn't terribly confusing, but it does give the sense that the film-maker is high on them-self for being such a clever little story teller. Anyways, all and all this is worth buying and I would definitely recommend a hi-def version with a quality sound system. As a science fiction buff, I certainly intend to add this to my small elite collection (which is actually saying something as I only buy what I consider the cream of the science-fiction crop). Enjoy!

Two good actors who failed. Bad script with stolen ideas. I felt like I was watching clips from good SF movies strung together in a poor manner. M Freeman didn't seem to be even trying to act and Tom Cruise was pretty useless. The plot was bad and the actors worked at it's level. It was a waste of time.
