Joe, I wonder how that movie is going to impress me. LOL
Great movie for Sci Fi fans, good special effects and great story line. Must see for sure, I would love to see it again in the big screen.  Will be buying the DVD for sure.

I usually write product reviews.  But this time I wanted to give you my opinion of Oblivion.  Yes, its a Sci Fi Movie, with action and its also a drama.  Of course its got Tom Cruise playing the lead role of Jack.  Tom did a good job in this movie especially the action scenes, the motocross riding, and the confrontation scenes with the Scavs.  I was a little disappointed in his aha moment with Olga Kurylenko playing the role of Julia on the Empire State Building.  I mean really, the only thing he could say about a previous relationship was "Thats Impossible"  over and over with little emotion?  Hmmmmm.  How would that make you feel?  How about some jumping up and down on Opra's couch!  Ok, that was a little harsh, but the rest of the movie he is flawless.  And how did Morgan Freeman do?  He was good, he played the role of outsmarting his enemy well with a smile, albeit somewhat hidden, but curiously given away in his new found cheek bones bulging with glee.... nearly permanently!  That's not a bad thing because it wasn't over done and quite refreshing actually. There is something that I would call more than determined when a person has a permanent smile - focused perhaps, knowing that you have finally figured out the enemy and can hardly contain yourself.  I was a little mystified of the pairing between Andrea Riseborough playing Victoria who is work partners with Tom Cruise playing the role of Jack.  Ok, she just seemed a little young I guess.  She looks beautiful of course, nearly twenty something yet work partners (who share the same house and bed) with Jack who looks, well at least 50 years old, but yet they seem to be an "effective team".  But what the heck do Aliens know anyways?  Which brings me to the next point.  The plot.  Yes, it was good and out of the box for sure.  I mean why send your brother aliens to battle when you can send... well, something else.  Doesn't that make more sense anyways?  Its what we do in our world right now.  And how about those special effects?  Truly, how do you get a 4000 square foot home complete with plexiglass bottom Olympic size pool, Airport tower, landing pad, medical bay, a shop to fix drones, and up 2000 to 3000 feet in the air supported on a single needle metal structure?  And have it look so freaking real?  Bravo!.... THATS IMPOSSIBLE!  LOL  5 stars! Or was that 49, 51 or 52 stars?
not to spoil the movie, this was easy to guess the ending, and reminded me of a couple of movies all too well. Not recommended.
Much better that I thought it would be. Heard critics pan it but it looked too good to pass up. Great visuals and nice plot.
Man I really enjoyed this one. The plot twist kept me involved to what would happen at the end of the movie.
Great script, excellent visuals, awesome acting!  I highly recommend this movie.  I think this is one of Tom Cruise's best.  M83's soundtrack is electrifying.
Enjoyed the plot twist.  I think it was missing something and did not feel completely happy with the ending of the movie.  I think HAL made a cameo near the end.
The twists in this film are not so obvious, you think it might be and it's not. Don't want to give it away.
Very good movie. Unexpected turn. U have to watch carefully to get it. Got underrated reviews but i don't think many ppl got it
Hard to get into need to watch twice! If you want to get it, don't know if I can,,,we will see
I found the story line very interesting and the ending is out of this world. And i will watch it again.
We only watched 5 minutes of this video, the quality was really bad, we finally got it on iTunes, great quality
I enjoyed this movie quite a bit more that I thought I would. Will it be up for any awards? Doubtful. Good story and well executed though.
This movie rocked from beginning to end. Aesthetically pleasing and I thought the plot flowed very well, was exciting, and the turns were not obvious.

I can't remember how long it has been since I have seen a classic sci-fi movie. All the recent entries in the genre have been either superhero movies or bombastic-boom-boom-shoot-em-up-alien-invasion ones. And while Oblivion does tread familiar ground sometimes it gets 5 stars by comparison with its peers in the industry at the moment. On its own, it is technically superb with a great sweeping soundtrack, well presented minimalist art direction, stunning landscapes, great acting from a small and excellent cast and tight screenplay that keeps your attention (if you have been longing from a reprieve of movies with giant ball of fires every 2 minutes). This movie also manages to stand on its own without the need for sequels which probably means it gets another 5 stars just for that.

From the end credits, it seems that it has been adapted from an unpublished graphic novel and the writer of said novel directs this movie so I guess I saw his vision of his book. And it's only after I came here that I realized that he directed TRON Legacy too (another excellent movie). Hats off to Joseph Kosinski.

Whatever you think about Tom Cruise, he sure as heck can deliver a great action/sci-fi movie. This one revolves around him and he carries it effortlessly while displaying a wide variety of emotions ever so subtly. His supporting cast is very good in general but I thought that Andrea Risenborough displayed a wider set of emotions really well and it probably would have been better if she and Olga Kurylenko had switched roles. Morgan Freeman, Coster-Waldau and Leo deliver excellent performances with the little screen time they have and to be honest I really like movies where the director manages to make a story around a small set of characters work well.

This is a very good sci-fi movie. If you have ever read sci-fi short stories (Dick, Asimov etc.) and ever wondered how it would be on film, this would be a good example.

Straight up, very good movie.  Special effects were great, Tom did a wonderful job, and the story was solid.  I could ask for two or three things to be different, or explained more, but who doesn't.  That's how most movies go.  If you like Cruise & Sci-Fi, you are likely to enjoy this movie.  I'd definitely like to see more Sci-fi like this.

Visually this movie is really good. I loved the special effects, and the music in this movie was awesome. My only complaint on this movie was the fact that the first hour dragged on and was boring. Once it got into around 76 minutes in, that's when it started getting interesting. Decent movie, but i wouldn't buy this on DVD. I might check it out again. I thought the performances were great but i think the story needed to be more interesting.

This movie reminded me a bit of The Matrix movies and at the end more of Independence Day. Like i said before, it's a decent movie, but you really have to be patient and sit through the first hour in order to enjoy the movie.
I liked the twists in the story and how things were explained to make sense.  A little long but I enjoyed it.

Bought the HD download. Hard to believe it was available before DVD's and Blu-ray. My wife and I enjoyed the movie. I was pleased that it wasn't just action but had a plot behind it. I want to be tactful and not give any of the story away.

I was happy about the price too. Cheaper than both of us going to the theatre and now I can watch the movie on Amazon instant video! On our PS3, iPhones and iPads.

I was prepared, after Minority Report, to be grudgingly impressed with Tom Cruise working in sci-fi. I was prepared to give him the benefit of the doubt. Unfortunately, the writers on this one were purely awful. So while it's a very pretty film indeed, it has plot holes big enough to fly a spaceship through, and that ruined it for me.  I won't spoil it here in case someone else decides they want to watch it and ends up liking it, but honestly, it was an awful plot. About 10 other sci-fi movies have done these individual concepts better. It felt a bit like the origin of the term "hack" for writers: someone took a dozen other, better films, chopped them to bits, and randomly stuck those bits back together to make this. When it's done well it ends up being a "mashup" or "x meets y", but in this case, "hack job" is what comes to mind.

But - it's very pretty. Very visually atmospheric. Sadly, not good, but very pretty.
with this film.  If you like good sci-fi, you'll enjoy this.  First rate.  The negative reviews must be coming from "rocket scientists."
Movie maintained my attention, Love story weak, tentative subplot. Effects convincing but we have seen the ruined planet many times.  Three stars.
love the concept and ending, Tom Cruise always does thought provoking sci fi's. Not predictable or just another hero movie.
Had a good cast of characters and good story, except it seemed to drag on a bit. Once it got going it was pretty good. Good special effects and plenty of action.
Horrible movie!  No real plot, few good actors, crappy computer animated graphics and special effects and totally disappointing!  I am so disappointed that I purchased this worthless movie!!!

Just finished watching Oblivion, and wow what a visual master piece. I'm confused on why I did not catch this at the movies. Not sure how they promoted this movie and whether maybe it was just the timing of it's release. So with that said, I wished I could have seen it on the big screen and not on my 42 inches LCD. Tom Cruse did a great job as always, I know some folks may not be Tom Cruse fans, but he makes you believe in the movie. If you have always enjoyed science fiction movies then this is a must see and an add to your personal collection. I can't imagine why any one would give this movie less than 5 stars. I guess there are just people out there that can never be happy. Don't let any of those negative reviewers swayed you from watching this movie. AND don't read any reviews that are spoiler alerts! The story line also adds to the beauty of this movie. Enjoy.

Incredible special effects, great story telling, and the best part is the fresh crisp feel you get while enjoying this movie. When you want to be living in that surreal world I think that's when the director delivered a great piece of science fiction. Its that world that we can't currently live in but would like to.

BTW - I saw a review about poor character development. Lets compare this to the recent Prometheus that probably achieves the same level of special effects and feel but spends a lot of time developing a bunch of characters i wasn't crazy about. Here in Oblivion you get all your answers at the end and all the characters are well... congruent. I always find it annoying when there's too much character development and you get something like a Dr. Jekyll Mr Hyde feel with a bunch of characters you don't care very much for. I'd rather just see a few characters fully explored than a bunch of GI Joe's where you know a ton of facts about but don't end up relating to them and seeing them die off doesn't really bother you at all.

I think a big part of good science fiction is that future world you want to show to the audience and spending too much time on multiple plots and character development takes away from it. Oblivion has the perfect balance.

Anyways, loved it want to see more movies like this. Certainly raises the bar for modern science fiction.

Two things struck me in the first hour of Universal's recent blockbuster Oblivion: The familiarity of its elements (at times iconic, at others clich) and the degree of physicality in so thoroughly digital a production. The first of these I was prompted for, by reviews that cited a derivative spirit in the film with few citing exactly what its screenplay was deriving from, or explaining why the makers of Oblivion - or any film, for that matter - should be faulted for the practice. The second aspect was harder to put my finger on; so much has changed - and in ways improved - in VFX in these first years of digital's victory over photo-chemical film. Was the sense of physicality `just me', or was it also in the product, as a document of actual, and not merely (i.e., excessively) computer generated events? This sense of substantive record in the film does indeed concern its staging. More significantly, it also concerns the two marriages of the film: the superficially genuine, fundamentally phony one of soldier-laborer Jack Harper (Cruise) with the more clerical half of his "effective team," Victoria (Andrea Riseborough), and his diegetically genuine, yet distractingly cosmetic marriage to a Russian astronaut by the name of Ruskova.
  Exquisitely shot on the Cinealta F46 and Red Epic, Oblivion is one of the more visually arresting contributions to its genre, largely due to its reliance on natural light and exteriors. Even key interior scenes often feature exterior visuals against which actors perform in real time, and objects with reflective surfaces (numerous here) are shot without concern. Instead of employing green screen for the film's sky-high, glass house scenes, the F46's mechanical shutter allowed for flicker-free front projection of clouds, stars, etc  The cinematography also exploits Iceland's steely terrain and unusually long magic hour (from 6pm-1am, due to the island's northern position), yielding an embarrassment of landscape riches. It is primarily for this reason of exceptional staging and location - and despite occasionally rushed CGI - that it compares favorably with forebears The Quiet Earth (d. Geoff Murphy, 1984), Robinson Crusoe on Mars (d. Byron Haskin, 1964), The Omega Man (d. Boris Segal, 1971), Planet of the Apes (d. Franklin J. Schaffner, 1968), 2001: A Space Odyssey (d. Stanley Kubrick, 1968), Solaris (d. Andrei Tarkovsky, 1972), Zardoz (d. John Boorman, 1974), Demon Seed (d. Donald Cammell, 1977), Capricorn One (Peter Hyams, 1978), and Moon (d. Duncan Jones, 2009), as it claims little conceptual innovation. This is not necessarily a strike against the film - a characteristic of genre filmmaking is after all the repetition of form and theme - but it does command attention and perhaps a bit of research, and in this the many negative reviews, claiming weak writing, are remiss, and somewhat misleading. Excessive recourse to the grounding device (e.g., the dashboard bobble-head); exceedingly long action sequences (i.e., better suited to an action film, which this is not); the tired boomerism of Procol Harum's "A Whiter Shade of Pale"; the lithe, supermodel wife (former supermodel Olga Kurylenko, now the vaguely exotic/Eastern love interest of several films, including this one); Morgan Freeman as the go-to black elder statesman; the pat homecoming... The easy choices of the production are many, but their essential error of familiarity (i.e., convention) at the expense of internal realism is perhaps mistaken for something native to the film's achievement, precisely because it effectively combines so many now familiar sources. A patchwork of perennial science-fiction tropes (e.g., first contact, the lost civilization, the ascendant machine, simulacra & virtuality), Oblivion draws from each of the titles just cited in various ways, perhaps most obviously from the red-eyed computer/Cyclops of Kubrick's 2001', though most heavily from Jones' Moon, itself a sci-fi hybrid (its own sources 2001' and Solaris, as well as Silent Running, d. Douglas Trumball, 1972, Dark Star, d. John Carpenter, 1974, and some measure of his father's ballad to Britain's also-ran space program, "Space Oddity"). In another, more ironic parallel, Oblivion bears the title of a low budget space western from Charles Band's straight-to-video schlockmill, Full Moon Entertainment. Shot in Romania, Oblivion (d. Sam Irvin, 1994) takes place in the small town of Oblivion, on a distant planet on the interstellar frontier (in a nod to the Western expansion premise George Takei is one of a handful of bargain celebrities), and pivots on the mining exploits of an alien tyrant called "Redeye." The makers of the blockbuster Oblivion were likely aware of echoing the earlier title, but the reason this wouldn't concern them, and the reasons they might claim obliviousness (alas) are interesting, as the original Oblivion is not only cheaply and shoddily produced, but woefully derivative, in a manner that makes the better conceived, funded, and mounted Oblivion appear inspired.
  To return to the more substantial parallel, the protagonist's distance from the home world - whether spatial or temporal - is linked to the moon's destruction in Oblivion, and lunar mining in Duncan Jones' Moon, but the causal connection between the two sci-fi conceits is plain. What makes this connection curious - and potentially problematic - is the differing scale of each production, as Moon was astronomically cheaper, costing a mere $5 million compared to Oblivion's $120 million, suggesting a longstanding Hollywood tradition: throw enough money at a project, and its creative problem/s (in this case, clear derivation) are solved by an economics of scale. However, aside from its visuals - which reflect the film's artistry at least as much as its generous budgeting - there are two fairly unique themes that save Oblivion from itself - from what we might call its indistinction. These are the hi-tech war, in which the all/any-American is complicit, and the conflict of the celluloid/cellular (i.e., live/living), and digital/electronic (i.e., virtual), beginning with the nostalgic opening image of the Empire State Building's observation deck, a coin-operated pair of binoculars greeting us like an emissary of the medium on which it is shot - or appears to be shot. Though evident throughout the film due to the prominent role of lethal "drones" (in addition to ubiquitous surveillance, satellite mapping, heat-signature, and other video images and imaging of distant topography, figures, and events), the theme of telepresent war is clearest in the film's second half, when the elusive, desert-dwelling enemy capture Harper, force him to recognize their humanity, and coerce him to program one of the captured drones to attack its origin (the orbiting artificial intelligence Harper unwittingly serves). The other theme is more profound but less apparent, giving the film a weight just beneath conscious detection: the tenuous relationship between a film past of material means - a past at risk of oblivion, naturally represented by Cruise - and the current one of digital optimism, enfigured in the wife who dresses for work without leaving home (who in fact refuses to), and a CG rendering of a completed One World Trade Center, composited onto a healed New York, ripe for cataclysm and reified through the antiquated binoculars (n.b., from the deck of what was once the tallest skyscraper, and the first to suffer impact from an airplane). Blurred, but clearly the object of focus, an engagement ring is held up tentatively in the foreground, dwarfing the new tower. The form and tone of the essential conflict are perfectly united here. The trouble is in the proposition of such limited options for man and wife (not to mention viewer), when drawing from so vast a catalogue of futurist fiction. Ultimately, the nuclear family functions as a sort of punchline. Not a bad one, perhaps, but an exceedingly clean one - a choice, apparently, between Town and Country. Forget the ashes of your fathers and temples of your Gods, your cabin in the sky awaits. Or, if you prefer, the hidden valley of the LP.

Oblivion wasn't a dynamic bang `em up, annihilate the universe sci-fi. It was steady, uncomplicated and extremely enjoyable. Cruise's performance is good (not a big fan of his, but he does have that charisma that is caught on film and makes it work extremely well). The premise was really good; the plot was a twist I did not even anticipate, but it was a really nice surprise for a sci-fi flick. The visuals and special effects are outstanding! Overall, it was an extremely enjoyable and entertaining Saturday night movie. For you sci-fi fans who need a fix, give this a look-see! Highly Recommend!

Not going to push any spoilers but expect great special effects, plots and twists. Tom Cruise while many look for a way to deflect his success, I find to be a committed actor (we cannot hold the Mission Impossible movies against him).

This movie was crap. Total crap. I've spent more amusing hours with food poisoning. Don't waste your time. I've already spent more time writing this review then the scriptwriters spent on creating a coherent plot and convincing characters.

Sci-fi that involves Cruise or Travolta can be suspicious at times, but I thought this movie was worth watching.  I paid full price to get it here on AMZ, but it's better than sitting in a theater with noisy dolts.  The non-main characters are flat and quiet, but at 2 hours, there wasn't much time to get other characters yapping as well.

I love disaster movies and often think that earth would be better off without us, some of what I saw in this film reminded me of personal ideas and it's nice to see them out there in parallel.  Some reviews said that this movie was confusing and it had me wondering if the movie critic had any good brain cells left. If you want confusing double up on Inception and 12 Monkeys. Oblivion is fine, but it's not Memento or Butterfly Effect for worthy plot twists.

Don't look for a super tight story line, and I'm sure you'll find the same holes in the story that I did.  Some things can be explained if you just fill in the blanks yourself. For instance the life pod that gets reused for Julia, says "Harper" on the lid. They got it by going back to a site to reuse it. I'm leaving out the spoiler bits, but you get it. If you pay attention or watch it a few times, you'll fill in the questions. MM
There is a huge twist at the end (I won't spoil it) you just don't expect.  I loved it, great sci-fi movie!
How could one not like a movie that featured Morgan Freeman backed up by Tom Cruise! Time went by very quickly!
Very good. Action with a twist. Loved the ending .Best Tom Cruises film I have seen since Days of Thunder
Tom Cruise does it again with Top Gun meets Independence Day meets Vanilla Sky. I enjoyed the action, the beautiful scenery, and a great plot. Watch this movie.
Lack luster performances, poor script, just plain old boring...I wanted to like this, but beyond what could have been an interesting storyline, there was nothing worthwhile to see here.

With the Sci-Fi genre seemingly suffering beneath the weight of old series and remakes, Oblivion does the genre justice. Based on a graphic novel, it may not be truly novel fiction, but it certainly explores a story unseen in my memory. With tastes of Firefly, Moon, and others of the theme, it kept my interest. Freeman, Riseborough, and Cruise play their roles remarkably well and together make a great team. Eerie and with enough uncertainty to move the film along, Oblivion gets an A for freshness.
It unfortunately suffers from the occasional sense of solidarity of older Sci-Fi flicks like 2001 and a lack of answers and depth of other greats.
I'd happily watch it again if for nothing else, the eye-candy of the settings and cinematography.

Enjoyed the story, kept me intrigued. Although I disagree with the premise that there is no separation from the man's soul and the brain. There was no sense of loss since jack was a mere clone and there were several more of him around.
I have Prime so I don't have to pay for movies all the time, I hate when I receive these advertisements and I can't watch it.

AT first I thought how could the movie be bad for who is in it. Wrong ! Sadly I think the actors  got paid but the move is a bomb. I got tired of every sentence starting out with  JACK can you hear me, JACK are you there , Jack come back, Jack look out, jack this jack that  jack off !  I enjoy Tom C but not in this movie.  Wow Tom C produced it also what a flop !
This movie was very well written loved every second of it. Had a lot of surprises I was not expecting. Tom does it again great acting from Morgan freeman and entire cast.

2nd time watching it and it's even better.  You catch things you missed on the first viewing.  Have to admit that I'm a diehard scifi lover and gamer.  Aspects of this movie remind me of the MMO EVE Online which made it that much more pleasurable.  I need more movies like this.

Tom Cruise's real life weirdness aside, I think he is a good actor.  He is well suited for this film. While some of the story drags a bit sappy, the film is very interesting as a whole and especially worthwhile visually.  It warrants a big screen/HD viewing.  I enjoyed the references to past sci fi flics.  Anyone that thinks the scenes are a "rip off" doesn't understand homage. They were about respect of the genre and fun to spy for those who know the references. The overall story may feel like it has holes but this film is very good because it is one to reflect upon.  In doing so, you can figure out why things were the way they were and that the holes were not as much as your initially thought.  The pacing of the film was good too- not overloaded with action like big budget bozo films, and not too hung up on slow story/character development.  It was a really good mix that, for me, now puts this film up there with my sci fi faves. [I would have liked to give it a 4 and half star rating]  By the way, in a small way Oblivion reminded me of an even better recent sci fi film- "District 9".  They're no where near the same in story, but both are finally some contemporary sci fi that balances thinking and action.
What a great movie this was, as a sci-fi fan I absolutely loved it. Seems I have to write at least twenty words here but I don't want to spoil the movie.

What a beautiful rendition of sci-fi fiction, simply fabulous and breath taking panaromas, great perspective toward life, in another words, this movie is intelligently mind boggling. Do yourself a favor and go watch it. Don't go by those rotten reviews scattered all over the internet, this movie deserve 5, not because it has Tom Cruise only but the way post-apocalypse scenario is shown, whao.. beautifully told story. Tet or Ted, I dunno Sally in it.. reminded me of HAL from 2001:Space Odyssey.
The movie is much deeper than what seems to be. Worth every second. I recommend this movie for those with common sense.

I am usually a big Tom Cruise movie fan but this movie may be his worst. This movie's plot is long and drawn out. We watched this with my extended family last week and half of them left before the movie was over. Has some backside nudity (pool scene)which may make it inappropriate for teens. The movie plot can be summarized by 4 words Captured--Cloned--Controlled-Overcome.

I would have given this a higher rating, but can't give half stars. Tom Cruise proves that he can still make a good movie, despite all the 'baggage'. I did find myself thinking about that during the movie, which was distracting. This was a good movie, nonetheless.

Additional details:

Tom Cruise plays Jack Harper, a drone maintenance technician in some future where mankind has had a war with an alien race. A war which has left the Earth mostly uninhabitable. A few technicians and their controllers remain on Earth to repair and maintain the automated drones that protect harvesters which create energy from seawater. The remaining humans are living either in the TET, a massive space station in orbit, or are orbiting Titan, a moon of Saturn. Once their tour is over, Tom and his controller, Victoria, are to transfer to the TET and then go to Titan. You see early on that Jack is dissatisfied with leaving the Earth, and finds beauty in small things, such as a flower growing in the midst of a massive desert. You also see that Victoria is a `ask no questions and do your job' personality. As the film progresses, this difference between the two characters becomes more and more evident. I don't want to spoil anything about the remainder of the movie's plot, so I'll leave it there.

The special effects in this movie are some of the best that I've ever seen, and the flight sequences of the `bubble ship' that cruise uses to go out to repair the drones, are awesome. I really enjoyed the behind the scenes footage that is included. The version that I purchased included the DVD, Blu-Ray, digital copy, and Vudu streamed version of the film, so having the proper player was no issue at all.

I usually don't jump at the chance to see sci-fi movies, but I really enjoyed this one. Not as predictable as a lot of alien invasion/end of the world type movies out there. And after seeing it in the theatres, I still enjoyed watching it again at home, the tell-tale sign of a good movie in my book.

Hello everyone! Even though this is my first Amazon review, it is definitely not my first movie review. I must say that this was an AWESOME movie!

To start with, the casting was well done. Tom Cruise played a character named Jack, a clean- up crew guy who fixes drones. If you don't like Tom Cruise as an actor,then you can at least like the character he is playing. Jack is a totally believable character, a confused man trying to remember his life before his memory was wiped. While he would go out to fix drones, he would also try and find things that reminded him of his previous home. He can't exactly choose what he does, he kinda just has to do his job and then leave, which he really doesn't want to do. I like that about the movie; it always seems as though the characters are real, it was like Tom was born to play the role. The rest of the crew,consisting of familiar faces like Morgan Freeman and Olga Kurymento, also fit their roles quite nicely.

The plot was interesting, and I think the trailer explains it pretty thoroughly, but I'll tell you anyway. So there is the huge war between these aliens and humans, and (yay!) the humans win. They didn't really save the earth though... only half of it remains somewhat liveable. With what they are given, most of the human race moves to the Moon Titan, the one that revolves around Jupiter. As I said before, Jack comes along along with Victoria, both led by Sally, who have to clean up up Earth a bit and fix the drones that they made to analyse for the aliens. That's all I am going to say because I really don't want to spoil it for you.

The graphics surpassed all of my expectations, everything in the movie looked real. It was all so futuristic and high tech, but it all looked plausible. You felt like you were flying in that jet sometimes, and that was also a nice feature.

So, as a whole, I can't exactly tell you how I feel about every part of the movie, but I did enjoy myself while watching it. You should watch this movie if the following traits fit you: You are above 13 years of age(for violence, brief nudity, and language), you like sci-fi post-apocolyptic worlds, stuff that blows up, amazing graphics, and scenes that may make you cry from loveydoveyness.

5/5 stars!

By the end of this movie you will by asking a lot of questions.  Quite frankly, the story is incredibly thin.  And the characters pretty emotionless, though that may have been partly intentional.  The visual and technical aspects of the movie are amazing.  Great visuals and sound design.  It leads me to think this director, who also directed the more recent Tron remake, should perhaps be more of a visual effects director and not in charge of the whole film.  In the end the movie was pretty forgettable.

I don't even know what to think about this movie.

 First of all, the trailer spoils the first major twist of the film. So already I was looking for twists. The 2nd twist *SPOILER*  directly rips off Moon and that's when I checked out.

This movie is basically a combination of Moon, Independence day, Total recall, The Matrix, Wall-e and maybe a little 2001 space odyssey and because of that it feels completely derivative. And the more I think about it, the less I like it.

Bottom line would be to go watch Moon, a much better film.

i am a huge tom cruise fan but this movie missed the mark.  no story.  hard to follow.  lack of action.  interesting plot but then to find out its a redux of space odyssey is defeating.  wanted to like it.  sat through the whole thing but really can't recommend it.

I really loved this movie. I won't bother to go over the plot again as this has been covered in many different reviews and it would spoil things anyway. But, this movie left me in tears in the end. It accomplished what only the best science fiction is able to accomplish - use the genre to get the viewer to question basic premises and assumptions about his or her own life. The beauty of science fiction is that it can use aliens and new technologies as analogy to the questions we all face today that can get pedantic or dreary if it were set in the present day. A movie like District 9, although deeply flawed, can raise questions about our basic views of how we relate to those different from us, especially when they are in our power. Oblivion raises deeper, more philosophical questions: who am I really? What makes me myself? Why am I different from anyone else? Am I doing good in the world? Am I a good person? How do I know? Do I have a soul? If I do, what is it made of? What happens when I die?  Yes, the plot incorporated elements of many different works. So do they all. We all stand on the shoulders of giants. If a reviewer says that this movie is derivative and worn, I would accuse that reviewer of simply missing the point. Don't trust every negative review you see. It reminds me of something Lex Luthor said in the original Superman movie - to paraphrase: some people can read War and Peace and think that it's just another adventure novel. Others can read the label of a bubblegum wrapper and get the meaning of life.  This movie is awesome. Just trust me on this one.

I went to see this movie at the theater when I was traveling and had nothing else to do. I was not expecting much and it is usually hit or miss with a Tom Cruise movie. I was really surprised how good the movie was. I love SciFi but have been disappointed in much of the recent crop that has come out. Oblivion had a unique story with a couple of good twists.

Even people that are not SciFi fans will enjoy the story if you like a little suspense and mystery. Definitely worth a rental!

Oblivion is a great film for science fiction aficionados, and it certainly doesn't fail to deliver a captivating world with unique and well developed characters -- most of the characters are well developed that is, though some definitely fall short. With a beautiful soundtrack to match -- which at times can get a little overpowering -- this is an all around great movie. It's not perfect, there are a few plot-holes at times. However, my problem with this movie was that the trailer revealed way too much information. I don't want to spoil anything, but I will say this:

I understand Morgan Freeman can be a huge selling point to a movie, but revealing his character took a level of surprise completely out of the movie, and actually ended up making the movie's general plot far too predictable. The movie tries to evoke a sense of mystery and intrigue for the first beginning portion. However, having seen the trailer, and being able to piece one and two together, your best educated guess about what's going to happen in the movie is most likely correct. It's a shame, I usually love piecing things together as I watch a movie, but they definitely should have held back more in the trailer.

As a side note, Morgan Freeman's role could have literally been played by anyone and it wouldn't have made a difference. Morgan Freeman is a badass actor, but he really didn't need to be in this movie.
there was a lot of potential here, but the characters were not developed and the plot drug on... the last hour I thought it would turn around but it did not delivery. creative - yes. good - no.

First things first, the visuals and cinematography in this movie are outstanding. The world looks pretty damn real blending cgi with real locations and I want that swimming pool at Jack's home base. Again fantastic stuff that you should expect from good sci-fi, but the story and dialogue itself are decent and at points seem repetitive. But it wasn't enough for me to lose interest and I recommend a rental before purchasing.

Simply outstanding, this is one of the best movies I have ever seen! Story was interesting all the way through and I mean all the way, no halfway point where everything gets boring and predictable. The visuals are beautiful, one of the best I've ever watched. The audio and video were top notch on my blu ray. I don't often keep movies I get or re-watch them but this instantly goes in my collection.

Wow!... What a great sci-fi movie. How did this one slip through the Hollywood machine? It has a real plot, action, love, and cool tech. Gore is even kept to the minimum needed to tell the story. Huh, how did this happen :-)) Please Hollywood, I want some more like this...

I just bought the film on Vudu for instant streaming and my final thoughts of the film is that it is much better then what critics say about the movie.. It had a decent plot that was exciting enough and the action scenes were paced and pretty good in my opinion. This movie won't win Best picture but is good entertainment.
What a great surprise! Tom Cruise delivers a great performance! This is the best original sci-fi film i have seen since the 5th Element.

I am not a Tom Cruise fan but I thought the trailer for Oblivion looked interesting.  However, I was disappointed when it just seemed to be sandy land scenes and chasing/repairing drones.  My seventeen year old son was even bored with it and we didn't watch all the movie.  Amazon did not give you a chance to rent so I purchased it and am sorry I did.  What a waste of money.

I LOVE SCI FI MOVIES BUT THIS WAS SO SLOW,BORING AND POINLESS. WHAT A DISSAPOINTMENT. HOW ANYONE CAN GIVE THIS A GOOD REVIEW IS BEYOND ME.DOES ANYONE IN HOLLYWEIRD EVER BOTHER WATCHING THEIR OWN MOVIE BEFORE THEY PUT IT OUT SO THEY CAN SEE THAT IT SUCKS???

trying to stop gag reflex... trying... ughhh... no... no, aghhh  gurggrrggglll... ughhh...  /spit  ughhh... disgusting aftertaste in my mouth from the vomit now... I did swallow some of my own vomit when I saw the advertisement for this recycled Hollywood garbage.  get this crap off my amazon.  wtf?  you don't have to advertise every stupid mainstream crap to me.

 you should realize from my buying habits that i am not interested in this and stop trying to shove this sort of crap down my throat...  I buy enough from amazon as it is, and I find these advertisements offensive.  you personalize the store to suite my buying trends, well, trend recycled Hollywood crap that is only viewed because of popular name actors off my site...

Science fiction is more than just laser swords and alien space battles.  At its heart, science fiction is about showing how the human condition fairs in a futuristic setting.  Oblivion is the Science Fiction that those of us who love Sci-Fi have been yearning for.  It has heart, it has spirit, realism of character, and a plot that is not full of holes or typical contrived Hollywood bs.

If you liked Moon then you will love Oblivion.

Look, most science fiction movies stink. Especially these days.  If you're a fan, you know that. Because you've watched enough duds to earn your stripes.

And when it comes to sci fi, you can't rate movies as compared to other genres.  So I give Oblivion 4 stars - Within the universe of Sci Fi films. Not 4 stars as compared to say, Dead Man by Jarmusch or Chinatown or Bergman films..  4 stars means that if your a fan of the genre and you are dying to watch something that doesn't make you groan, watch this.

 Much like the recent "Dredd" or "Pandorum" from '09, this one is quite enjoyable. Good effects, decent story and not complete drivel. Hollywood serves up a ton of high budget crap. This one is well above average. Despite the fact that it has Tom Cruise and Morgan freeman.
It's rather hard to be completely original these days.  This movie manages to deliver an original twist on a story told many times.  We were very please and surprised.

I have to say I was not sure what to expect when I bought this.  I love the special effects, very well done.  The plot twist was perfect.  The only thing I am left wondering is what happens to all the other "clones".  I mean if he's 49 and the other is 52 there are a lot of others running around.

This is a great action, adventure and sci-fi movie!  The acting and story are both great, I really hope this movie does well on rental as it is well worth the money.  I hope Tom Cruise does more movies like this one!

The initial advertising for Oblivion seemed to be that of a typical sci-fi/apocalypse film.  I'm glad I went to see it myself.  The plot is original, the acting is great and it's just plain fun to watch.  I enjoyed Oblivion more than just about any other movie I've seen in the last few years.

Oblivion is an entertaining movie with a measure of freshness. No aspects were obviously lacking, though some questions the audience may have (less pressing, I suppose) do go unanswered, though the biggest plot points obtain resolution. It's a film that focuses primarily on its main character, Jack (Tom Cruise), despite the enormity of its reach, and so, for a sci-fi movie, it felt a little unsatisfying. Still, my attention was happily kept for the duration.

I don't know what I expected from this movie, but this one just laid there and went no where.  I was irritated by the character Victoria and her calling "Jack" 100 billion times!!  Overall, the movie just dragged and never provided anything that I will remember five minutes from now.

Yes, I'm older but I still use a MAC, edit and create home movies.  I have an iPhone 5 and know how to use iCloud and iTunes Match.  My disdain for this movie is not that I "didn't get it".  It was simply the worst movie and I should have known that when we entered the theater.  I had a house guest (a very well known artist from NYC) and we decided to catch a movie.  When we took our seats for this movie we noticed that we were the only two people in the room and given that it was only the second week the movie had been out and given the fact that it was a Friday night in a suburb of Nashville, TN we should have known it was going to be a stinker.  Not only was it a stinker....it was a MAJOR STINKER.  These people who write these redeeming reviews for this film must work for the distributor of the film, the studio that made the film or be friends with one of the production or acting staff of the movie.

I have a masters degree from GeoTown Univ and I am not one who is "failing to appreciate the uniqueness of the film".  It was a piece of garbage and I would be very surprised if it is not the beginning of the end of Tom Cruise's aging career.  The only surprise in the film was that Morgan Freeman accepted a role in the film.

If you still purchase this film on DVD or Blu Ray then you deserve to kick yourself for wasting your money.  I think the box office take for this film says it all....disastrous!

This movie is truely something to put in your collection.  Something that will move you and change you.  I am so glad I have this movie and you will also.  Tom and Morgan thanks for be a part of this masterpiece that will go down in history as one of the greats of a life time!!!!  So deep and beautiful!!!!

This really is not a bad film at all. Decent plot, pacing, action, effects. Even Cruise was ok and no Cruise fan. Saw it on theater screen and not sure how it going to translate to a TV screen. BUT give this a try. Good enough and sometimes that is enough.

Jack Harper (Tom Cruise) works on a now-abandoned Earth as a security guy / repairman who lives on a platform in the sky with his co-worker Victoria (Andrea Riseborough).  Every day he hops in his little space ship and repairs the security droids that patrol the earth below, ensuring that the massive natural resources extractors continue to function and send those resources back to Titan, where all of Earth's inhabitants now live.  This is a difficult movie to review as there are several twists and turns and I don't want to ruin it for you -- so I won't really tell you who Morgan Freeman is or what he does.  Jack has a bunch of flashbacks to a pre-war Earth and even has some sort of idyllic Yosemite-like park to escape to, complete with a cabin furnished with an old stereo, turntable, and classic records including Creedence Clearwater Revival and... Asia.  However this isn't a music review.

I've never been much of a Tom Cruise fan, but in many ways he is very well-suited to this role (i.e. someone who has had his brain wiped and doesn't really know what's going on).  [Sorry if that sounds rude, not my intention]  His rather stiff acting style and inability to really create characters with warmth or depth actually works here.

The running time is 126 minutes but I swear it felt like 180.  There are definitely moments where you want to hit fast-forward but given that each scene reveals another piece of the puzzle you don't really want to do that.  I think the film would have benefited from a little more editing.

Overall I'd probably say 3.5 out of 5 stars... the fact that I'm still thinking about it and decided to write this review is a good sign.  It's one of those movies like the Sixth Sense where you might want to go back and view it again once you know the whole story.

Special effects are very good, and the landscapes of a post-apocalyptic earth are pretty striking.  Fortunately there's not the requisite destroyed Statue of Liberty however you do get a glimpse of her in one of the chase scenes.  And she's not in such good shape.  Jack's apartment in the sky is super cool, as his his space ship.  If Frank Lloyd Wright designed houses in the sky, this might be it.

Would I "buy" this movie and add to my collection?  Probably not.  But a good rainy day film, and one that will leave you thinking.

I am a picky sci-fi elitist viewer.  I admit it.  To prove it, I opine that the only good Star Trek (of the Shatner vintage) was "Wrath of Khan".  The others varied from "sucks" to "really sucks."  (The new cast though is excellent with Chris Pine at the helm.)  And, the only good Alien franchise films were 1 & 2.  The rest-drivel for plebes.  It takes a lot to win me over.  Don't even ask about Will Smith's pitiful attempts in any of his serious stabs at sci-fi.  Drivel and dross.  (Though "Men in Black" was good as a sci-fi satire.)  Harry Potter?  All suck.  The "Star Wars" franchise films started with a bang and then made me want to tear off my ears with the bad acting.  "Avatar" was eye candy, but largely just Pocahontas with Dragons.  The last really great sci-fi film was James Cameron's "The Abyss", but only the Director's cut as the theatrical release...you guessed it...sucked!  Yeah, I'm picky and a snob.  So sue me.  I admire "Soylent Green", original "Planet of the Apes" and "Omega Man" just because they were novel in their day and had Charlton Heston.  (Heston always gets at least a nod of admiration because,... well, it's Heston.)  But even they were dated.  My standards are high and so I went to "Oblivion" in the "cheap theater", just 3 weeks before its release on DVD/Blu Ray.  Frankly, with only a low 53% from Rotten Tomatoes, I expected very little.  Boy was I wrong.

Tom Cruise, always dedicated to whatever project he's doing, has pulled it off.  In spades!  This film is tight enough to float like an aircraft carrier in any storm.  The plot is both intriguing and confident enough to play out over the entire length of the movie.  Gradual reveals with respect for a discerning audience.  It is not "derivative",--a word critics use to sound high brow-- as frankly this combo of plot twists, surprises, and tempered revelations never creates a hole in the plot.  And I've never seen it done before.  A totally new take on earth apocalypse and Alien invasion.  And it's unique in making the Alien master-race ominous yet virtually never appearing on screen.  The facts are layered in discovery, just as they would be to the viewpoint of Cruise, the hero of the story.  The emotions are credible.  The audience is presumed to have brains.  I suspect the negative reviews I've read were because it is not a sound-bite movie.  It expects you to think and take hints without forcing you to come to the director's conclusion all at once.  The acting superb.  Kudos to all the principles, which really is confined to just 3 actors.  Morgan Freeman appears briefly but in a pivotal role.  The rest of this story rests on the backs of just 3 main characters.  Yet this epic sci-fi film is far from claustrophobic and is anything but "small".  It literally encompasses the entire earth.  The cinematography is grand.  The story is compelling and commands empathy.  The heroism is realistically portrayed.  The plot and writing are superb.  There were a few very minor script tweaks I would have made, which I can't say or it would spoil the plot twists.  In fact, though the main "reveal" occurs about 2/3rds of the way into the film, even the last 5 minutes still give little, welcomed, and faithful-to-the-plot surprises.  It has just the right blend of drama, action, wisdom, shock and humanity to rate 5 of 5 stars from me.  Yes!  From me.  A great film.  If you just want sci-fi schlock, stick to "2012", or "Independence Day."  But if you want a quality film that you can see over and over and still enjoy, you can't do better than "Oblivion"!  A nearly flawless sci-fi classic that will stand the test of time.  Don't miss this film or I will mock you for sucking.

The movie is set about sixty to seventy years in the future. The earth was attack. Those humanity survived. But the humanity and earth paid a heavy cost. The earth was damaged. And humanity had to leave earth for a colony on Titan. Only a handful people stayed to maintain the fusion machines to help there colony to survive. And a enmity which mystery wants to destroy the fusion machines. The movie as twists and turns in the film. Once you think you know what's happening. You known something wrong but you don't what until the end of the movie. To tell you too much. Will spoil the movie. Because it will keep you guessing!

Creative, fast paced, excellent story, good character development and the special effects are superb. One of the few recent movies I intend to buy in BluRay for my tangible library.

As with other 5 star reviewers, I too am saddened to see this movie bashed but I acknowledge the diversity of perception and right of all to their own view but (what are they using as the criteria for or a reference about good science fiction)?

If you consider yourself a person that appreciates sensitive, dramatic, creative, mind challenging SciFi, then take a risk and see this. I am confident you will be pleased you did.

Then you too can write a review based on the facts as you see them.

Also can you please stop posting spoilers with your reviews?  Lots of us have not seen this movie yet so thanks for being a jerk.  The whole point is if you wanna be cool and have people think you are some movie critic then review the movie on a blog or appropriate review page.  Don't go on amazon and write a movie review with spoilers on a product that has not actually been released yet and you are not even rating the product.
